Reductive in the best way, this wine opens in a layering of salty brine and oak as a creamy palate reveals itself with power and concentration. Baked apple, gingersnap and cinnamon toast configure around bold structure and moderate acidity, allowing for a fulsome, voluptuous experience.
This 100% Niellucciu wine is spicy and bright, with fine fruitiness and intense acidity. It has no need of aging, so drink now.

The painter Cézanne is more associated with Aix-en-Provence than Saint-Tropez, but it's not too far. This wine displays plenty of color, with a rounded texture and soft, generous fruits. Nicely balanced acidity gives a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

A solid concentration of black raspberry and red currant shows on the nose, with sweet baking spice backing it up. Medium in body and soft in feel, fresh acidity keeps the ripe dark fruit flavors in focus on the palate.
The nose is subdued on this pink wine, the palate comes in with lemony cheesecake notes and rounded freshness. This is easy, citrussy and dry, with notions of bottled strawberries.

The pale color is reflected in the light texture of this accessible wine. Its warm red fruits, cut with acidity, are a classic blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah, allowing room for plenty of fruitiness as well as a crisp tangy texture. Drink now.
Aromas of tire rubber, green pepper, blackberry and sweet barrel spice are followed by ripe fruit flavors that finish a bitter touch. The tannins dry out the finish.

Delicate whiffs of red berries, white peaches and crushed minerals perfume this fruity, full-bodied, dry Riesling. It's rounded and quite plush yet balanced by pert strikes of lemony acidity and a mouthwatering edge of salt. Enjoy now–2021.

Made from 72% Pinot Noir, 27% Pinotage and 1% Pinot Meunier, this sparkler boasts superbright scents of white melon, firm guava and red cherry that are supported by a pretty floral hint of fresh peony. It's direct and focused on the palate, with vibrant acidity and brisk red-currant and pomegranate flavors that lend freshness through the medium-length close.
designation: Kaapse Vonkel Méthode Cap Classique Brut Rosé

description: Intense aromas of crushed mint take center stage along with more subtle scents of black-skinned berry, leather and exotic spice. The minty note carries over to the firm, full-bodied but linear palate, along with black cherry and licorice tones. Firm acidity and tight, close-grained tannins provide the backbone. Don't even attempt this before 2025.

Aromas of Spanish broom, crushed rock, toasted nut and a whiff of oak follow over to the crisp, elegant palate, along with ripe yellow apple and citrus zest. Hints of butterscotch and mineral linger on the finish.

A blend of organically farmed Carricante, Catarratto and Minnella, this radiant white opens with light scents of citrus, yellow wildflower, Mediterranean brush and saline. Vibrant and linear, the crisp palate delivers lemon zest, crushed herb and flinty minerality. It's understated and elegant. Drink through 2021.

Aromas of pipe tobacco, grilled porcini, leather, dark-skinned fruit and a whiff of dried aromatic herb form the nose. The palate shows prune, dried black cherry, sage and a hint of exotic spice alongside a backbone of assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the salty finish.

Effusive black-cherry and raspberry aromas lead to more tightly wound rhubarb and red-cherry flavors in this attractively restrained, medium-bodied and fascinating wine that has the nervy energy to age well. It has a good sense of balance due to firm acidity and light tannins that keeps it refreshing sip after sip. Best after 2022.

Attractive aromas of mocha, vanilla, wood grain and healthy plum and red-berry fruits come in front of a creamy rich palate that some might say is a touch fat. Deep plum, cherry, cassis, vanilla and chocolate flavors are equally rich on a long finish with savory berry and vanilla-cream flavors. Drink through 2030.

Camphor, forest floor, new leather and rose aromas make their way to the forefront on this fragrant red. On the linear, ethereally elegant palate, lithe tannins give polished support to red cherry, pomegranate, crushed mint and star anise while bright acidity lends balance. Drink through 2024.

Graphite, crushed herb, pipe tobacco, new leather and dried rose are some of the aromas you'll discover on this fragrant radiant wine. It has focus, structure and elegance, delivering red cherry, strawberry, licorice and orange zest set against a backbone of firm acidity and tightly-knit, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2034.

Rich and generous fruit flavors mingle with deft touches of sweet, spicy oak in this full-bodied and mouthfilling wine. Black cherry, ripe plum and a touch of raspberry meet cinnamon and black tea accents. Moderate tannins add good structure in this standout wine from a relative newcomer.

Pure Malbec has tannins. But when, like here, they are well integrated into the dark fruits and the wood-aging flavors, they almost melt. This wine has ripe berry flavors and great concentration. The rich structure and power indicate that it will age. Drink from 2023.

This wine comes in a can. Up-front aromas of lychee, flower and peach are followed by spritzy fruit flavors. It provides easy-drinking appeal. The spritziness seems distracting, but once it flattens out, it's very enjoyable.
Crisp and well balanced between acidity and raspberry fruitiness, this is an attractive wine. It is ripe but fresh. Drink now.

The three grape varieties (castas) in this wine are Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Together they make a surprisingly soft wine considering the tannic nature of each grape. The wine retains the perfumes and the rich berry flavors to give a juicy and very fruity wine to drink now.
A fresh nose of ripe red cherry, mentholated herbs and dried hay start off this juicy, easy red. Light in feel, with a mild grip of tannins, this is well balanced in nature but lacks concentration.

This light, fruity wine is made from Savoie's own Mondeuse grape. It gives light tannins and a fresh red-currant flavor. This is a style of wine that could be easily enjoyed slightly chilled. Drink now.

The fresh nose offers fruity aromas of pineapple, mango and melon, alongside somewhat soapy notes of honeysuckle. This is firmly medium bodied but feels bright and zippy on the palate, with ripe flavors of oranges and mangoes joined by honey and white pepper. A touch of vanilla and a squeeze of lemon introduce the finish, which lingers on a bitter peanut shell note.

This neutral French oak-aged blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot is a side project from the folks at Andrew Will. Its aromas draw you into the glass, evoking savory herbs, cherry, tangerine peel, fresh tobacco, green pepper and black olive. The palate brings pure, textured, seamless fruit and savory flavors that sail into the distance.

Winemaker: John Loubser. Made from 60% Chardonnay and 40% Pinot Noir, this leads with scents of yellow apple skin, brioche, fresh straw and faint pie crust. The mouthfeel is rich and satisfying, with abundant melon and apple fruit tones as well as more orange oil and toasted brioche hints on the close. Bright acidity and lively carbonation keeps the palate fresh and balanced.
designation: Cape Winemakers Guild Big Dog IV Méthode Cap Classique

description: This single-vineyard bottling from one of the winery's prized properties shows black cherry sauce, dill, anise and coffee bean on the nose. The coffee element is quite strong on the palate, where it spices up the dark-red fruits and settles in next to fresh acidity.
designation: Cote del Sol Valley View Vineyard Estate Vineyards

description: This is a rather unique and fascinating wine, starting with aromas of pear galette, peach and apple blossom. There is a lemon-peel tension to the medium-bodied palate but also warmer nectarine and apple-syrup flavors, with a cantaloupe touch that goes into the finish.

This rich, ripe wine is also balanced. Named after the Saint-Émilion classed-growth estate Château la Gaffelière (although no longer produced by that estate), the wine has great style and plenty of black-currant acidity as well as generous tannins. Drink from 2022.
designation: Les Hauts de la Gaffelière Sélection d'Excellence

description: Joyous aromas of red and black cherry and sugar plums meet with ginger snaps and vanilla dust on the nose of this bottling. Dried strawberry and rhubarb pie are cut by orange peel and a hint of mint on the palate.

Pale straw in color, this wine has a bouquet of apricot and geranium leaf. Flavors of white peach, guava and bitter almond make the mouth pucker just a bit. The finish is marked by notes of flint and saline.

This is a big red wine, where cherry cola, mocha and vanillin oak lead the way with hints of dried green herbs and mint in the background. The palate is rich and juicy with grainy tannins and an oaky finish.

A little stalky and stinky at first sniff, but beneath that lies the fruit: pineapple and peach with white pepper and butter. Medium bodied with a slippery texture and some citrus and cream notes, none of the funk shows on the palate, it's all just bit characterless. In an ocean of Chardonnays, there are better out there even at this affordable price point.
This Nero d'Avola shows delicate aromas of scorched earth, baking spice and a hint of dark fruit. The simple palate offers tobacco and black cherry jam alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Grilled white peach, smoked chicken, vanilla and caramel show on the oak-driven nose of this widely available bottling. The palate is clean and inoffensive if simple, with lemon-lime candy flavors.

This wine's cherry candy and rubber aromas lead to a palate that's bouyant and lively but unsettled. Its plum and currant flavors are lean and edgy, framed by rubbery grape skin tannins and slight oxidation.

This wine is boisterous and full of energy, featuring juicy bolts of strawberry and citrus seasoned in dried herb and plenty of earthiness. Bright and acid-driven, it's light and made in a style that will rightfully please fans of more restrained wines.

This red label cuvée is made exclusively from estate grown fruit. And although its production is higher in 2016, the quality remains consistent. Concentrated black fruit abounds, recalling blackberry, blueberry and black cherry. There's a touch of dark chocolate and café crème, along with fine-grained tannins.

Warm aromas of baked red cherry and caramel grow more complex due to a gravelly minerality and hints of peppercorns on the nose of this bottling by Ian Brand. The palate leads with oregano and pepper, those spices overwhelming the fruit, and the rocky minerality continues, leading into a cocoa-laced finish. It is a lithe and lively style of Cab.

Only one barrel of this wine was produced, and it seems to have taken a leathery direction, owing perhaps to its two years of oak aging. That leathery note permeates the black cherry and cassis fruit, which is concentrated enough to withstand that feature. Still, it's a bit over the top, with coffee liqueur, amaro and cured meat flavors and austere, drying tannins.

Though bottled in early 2017, this wine appeared to be in a dumb phase when tasted a year later. Nonetheless, the overall complexity was apparent, with whiffs of mushroom, ground coffee and cherry tobacco introducing a mellow blend of black fruit notes. It's layered and complex behind a translucent screen at the moment, as it fades into flavors of dried leaves and crackers.

This wine offers aromas of leather, earth, and berries. The palate is intensely concentrated and jammy, with brambly blackberry and cassis flavors that show a minty herbal side. Roasted, earthy notes rise up on the finish. Drink through 2030.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

description: Unfortunately, the first bottle of this was corked, which seems a shame considering the steep price, which has skyrocketed in recent years. The second bottle, however, showed off richness and complexity, with notes of raspberry, cherry, beets, coffee grounds, dark chocolate and a savory earthy Middle Eastern spice element. Chalky in texture with tight dusty tannins and drying herbal woody characters, this Cab is still in its infancy. Leave it be for a few years, however, and it should blossom beautifully.

Earthy in an inviting tapestry of spice, this wine is textured and full bodied, with lingering sentiments of clove and cinnamon. The fruit shines bright and tart in red currant and cassis. It offers well-developed flavors that work well with a complement of oak.

This is a screaming deal for a wine of this quality: a light, delicate and earthy expression of the grape that's stemmy and spicy. Forest floor, bark and dark brooding fruit meet a tangle of tight-woven acidity dipped in orange zest.

Initial notes of smoke and earth subside with aeration revealing an intensely fruity palate full of juicy white-peach, guava and yellow-cherry flavors. Delightfully off dry yet puckering in style, it's a penetrating wine nuanced by a fresh mineral finish. It will improve till 2026, hold further.

This appealing, fragrant wine displays the textural complexity for which the AVA is noted. It's a thoroughly delicious bottle with a subtle mix of barrel spice and black fruit flavors. Threads of cola, brown spice and mocha weave through the long finish.

This is a big fascinating wine that adds complex smoky earthy tobacco aromas to rich mouthfilling flavors of blackberry and blueberry. Full body, moderate tannins and good acidity give it grip on the palate and deep funky earthy flavors linger on the finish.

Aged in neutral oak and made from great grapes, this shines in layers of bright refreshing acidity and sharp focused flavors of orange, grapefruit and cherry. Complex and beautiful, this is a wine that needs to be in your glass.

The nose on this bottling from a vineyard planted in 2000 is loaded with raspberry gelato, hibiscus and spicy cinnamon-stick aromas on the nose. There's a twiggy herbal edge to the palate, where dried sagebrush, wild thyme and peppercorn play with tangy cranberry and nearly tapenade flavors. Intriguing throughout.

There is a strong wet-chalk note on the nose of this bottling, along with aromas of marmalade, sourdough, apple, pear and lemon candy. The palate is consumed by a compelling tannic grip, framing diverse yet complementary flavors of chalk, clay, honeysuckle, Asian pear and nectarine.

This wine is blended from some of the best barrels that the winery made in 2015 from various parts of Sonoma. Gorgeous, plump blackberry aromas meet palate-drenching berry and black-cherry flavors in this dramatically concentrated but smooth-textured wine. It has a great sense of depth and focus due to the perfectly ripened fruit, while staying supple and composed. Best through 2025.

Fine-grained but persistent tannins and a deep strikes of minerality abound throughout this ripe but restrained Gigondas. It's concentrated in blackberry and boysenberry flavors, but has an invigorating freshness often attributed to the vineyard's sandy soils and northern exposition. Hints of crushed mineral and anise linger on the finish. Elegant now but likely better from 2021.

This full, rich wine is still young, but its toastiness, ripe apricot and pear flavors and intense spiciness all point to a good future. The wine has weight, ripe fruits and a tight texture. Drink from 2021.
This ripe and fruity wine is lightly structured and offers appealing berry flavors. Acidity and juiciness come through the tannins strongly, giving a wine that will be delicious. Drink from 2020.
Solid with tannins but also ripe with fruits, this fragrant wine is developing quickly. It is attractive, with acidity and berry flavors in balance. Drink from 2021.
This is a ripe and spicy wine with attractive black fruits and soft tannins. It has good acidity and juicy blackberry fruits. Drink this wine from 2020.
This is a juicy wine, with intense acidity that shows through the structure strongly. Richness comes from the bright fruits with the tannins playing a supporting role. Drink from 2021.
Firm tannins are the hallmark of this wine. Although its solid structure and dry core still dominate, the wine's weight shows there is plenty of fruit to develop. Drink from 2021.

This is a dry wine, with firm tannins and a tough core. It is solid right through. The tiny vineyard sits at 1,000 feet near the top of the Pommard slope. There may not be enough ripe fruit to balance the wine.

Soft rounded tones of strawberry, melon and lemon are straightforward and likable on the nose of this pink Pinot Noir. The palate combines light raspberry and red-apple skins with the hint of lime juice.

One of three Provence wines produced by major Bordeaux chateau owner Bernard Magrez, this wine is ripe and full, generous both with its red fruits and acidity. It is stylish with a crisp edge and a clean, fruity aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.

Tropical and nutty in tone, this full-bodied concentrated wine offers robust foundations of oak with creamy fulfilling layers of pineapple and papaya. There's a hint of reduction on the nose that invites.
The aromas bring fresh notes of lemon zest and yellow apple. The palate is full bodied and lightly creamy in feel, with roasted corn notes on the finish.

Flowery white-fruit aromas are mellow. A round melony palate is a touch soft but holding on. Melon and peach flavors are basic but perfectly good, while this is just vital enough on the finish. Drink up!
Briskly concentrated Asian pear and grapefruit flavors are accented by crisp acidity and a clean, mineral tone in this full-bodied but fresh white. It's an easy-drinking dry wine to enjoy now–2020.

Pure berry and black-cherry aromas make for a flush and friendly nose. In the mouth, this is quite dry and drawing, with rough-textured tannins. Lightly salty and savory blackberry and black-plum flavors finish with surface-level depth and a reprise of scratchiness; drink through 2024.

Made with 100% Nerello Mascalese, this has an alluring fragrance of Spanish broom, wild berry and Mediterranean brush. On the palate, fresh acidity lifts red cherry, pomegranate and a hint of star anise.

This is a bright, light unoaked red. Red currants, black olives, cocoa, bay leaves and smoke lead the way, while a quiet, savory line of tannins balances the crunchy acidity and tart cherry fruit on the palate.

Well balanced and medium bodied, this wine from a unique mountainside vineyard combines good elements of natural acidity for freshness with ripe apple and pear for flavor. A smooth, layered mouthfeel wraps it all up nicely.

Showing the richness and soft texture of ripe Pinot Meunier, this wine comes from Jérôme Trudon's small-production Champagne house. It has just the right balance, with spice and zingy apple flavors coming through the ripeness. Drink now.

Hints of waxy lemon peel and chestnut skin lend a rustic tone to this savory, phenolic white wine. Made from old-vine grapes fermented via indigenous yeast and matured in barrel for 19 months, it's a uniquely earthen rather than fruity expression of Silvaner. Dry and exceptionally light in body, it finishes long with a lingering waxy vein.

Cola, loam, mint and dried black cherries show on the nose of this library release from the boundary-pushing winery owned by tech mogul T. J. Rodgers. The tannins are very refined on the palate, easing in the earthy flavors of bay leaf, pine needle, fig and black plum, which is nearing prune.

A cool backdrop of stone and yeast informs the fresh nose. The palate comes in with ripe red apple fruit, again supported by that lovely, sonorous and unifying tone of autolysis that here is reminiscent of baked apple tart. This is full of fruit and carried by very fine, creamy mousse. A very understated, elegant and lovely Crémant of real staying power. Lovely. Dirnk 2018-2025.

Baked apple has the fruity almond-edged headiness of kirsch brandy about it. The palate has some of that same directness but tones down to present juicy apple and ripe pear. They are balanced by fresh lemon and come together on a concentrated, zesty palate. The finish is dry and long. Drink through 2028.

The nose has a heady hint of lime peel and apple freshness. On the palate, there also is a herbal touch of citrus foliage that frames the tart but ripe green and red-apple fruit with wonderful freshness. The concentrated palate has something honest and incisive. The finish is dry and aromatic with lovely length. Drink until 2028.

Expressive notes of very ripe Williams pear are met with the floral overtones of rose and honeysuckle. The medium-sweet palate then adds the juicy richness of Mirabelle plums and juicy sweet mandarins to the mix. This is expressive, very full-fruited but also zesty and long. Lovely now but certain to evolve. Drink until 2028.

Zesty notions of lime peel have a fruity, riper touch of red apple about them. It is these apple flavors that become very expressive and aromatic on the dry concentrated palate. There is lovely midpalate texture that has something of citrus pith about it, while lemon freshness is the central structural element. There is something solid and honest about this. Drink through 2028.
A mild concentration of wet earth, damp florals and spicy cherry carry the nose. This is light and lithe on the palate, with fresh red-fruit flavors accented by bright acidity and sandy tannins.

A mix of citrus-blossom and pear-juice aromas carry the mildly intense nose. The palate is riper in feel, starting off with a tropical banana-peel flavor that transitions to tart apple and pear. This finish is short yet clean.
Quiet aromas of citrus and yellow apple carry to the light-bodied palate. Enjoy this wine for its easygoing, fruit-forward nature and mild acidic verve.

Soft notes of strawberry hull, white raspberry and peony are graced with the faintest hint of white chocolate. This is medium in weight, but with just enough acidity to lift the finish and liven up the close.
Crisp and lean, this is an unusually light-bodied and straightforward wine for the grape variety. It has mild green-apple and pine needle aromas and flavors and a tangy texture.

Aromas of braised green pepper, blueberry, coffee and herb are followed by lightly sweet, medium-bodied fruit flavors. It provides a lot of easy-drinking appeal, though the variety seems a bit hard to find.

Made in a dry style but with a honeyed edge, this is a balanced and crisp wine. Youthful acidity combines with flavors of almonds, quince and spice to give a wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.

Acid-driven and bone dry, this is a thirst-quenching wine with a savory backbone of edgy grapefruit, lemon zest and stony minerality. Integrated and brimming in complexity, it's a fine example of how delicious this category of wine can be when intent and talent meet.

This is a rich, complex and concentrated style of Muscadet. It also boasts a steely edge that comes from the granite soil of Vallet. Made from biodynamic vines, it shows intense fruit character, with spice and pepper at the end. It is attractive now, though it could also age further.

Ripe and delicious, this wine loads up black cherry, blueberry and milk chocolate while a soothing, soft texture helps coat the palate. It's not a typical dinner-table red wine but it is definitely luxurious and flavorful.

A powerful nose of leather, sun-dried tomato and olive tapenade gets things going in this cellar-worthy red. On the palate, it offers a blend of warming spice, dried fruit flavors and mature tannins. Good acidity and a spicy finish add to the appeal.

This is a luscious sweet wine from a small appellation just next to Sauternes. It is rounded, full of marmalade and spice flavors, rich with honey as well as having a dry botrytis core. The wine has aged well and is ready to drink.
This wine's tea and spiced plum aromas come with a hint of orange peel. It tastes of reedy raspberries and currants on the narrow palate. Moderate oak spice is detectable on the lean finish.
This wine's earthy plum and vanilla aromas are cheesy and rough. It's round on the palate, with spiced plum, herb and oak-based vanilla flavors that flatten out on the finish, showing mild oxidation.

This wine's berry aromas carry a faint hint of animal hide. The palate is raw with acidity yet saturated with roasted berry flavors and minty, oaky notes. Those wood suggestions linger on the edgy finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

description: Rounded and ripe, this generously textured wine has clear apple and pineapple flavors and just a hint of tangy minerality.

Made with organically farmed grapes, 80% Nero d'Avola and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this easygoing red opens with aromas of black plum, star anise and a touch of green olive. The aromas follow through to the informal palate alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.

The state's first canned Chardonnay, this was made from Goose Ridge Estate Vineyard fruit. The aromas include apple and melon notes. Showing a light spritz out of the gate, it has sleek and easy-drinking flavors. It's well priced and true to the variety.

A broad-shouldered, fruit-forward wine with plenty of ripeness, this is blended with a hearty 15% Petite Sirah. Cherry, blackberry, vanilla and peppery cinnamon take turns on the rich, concentrated palate, finishing on an oaky tone.

This seriously wood-aged wine is rich and smoothly textured. The initial fruitiness has dissipated to leave a broad wine with almonds as well as a creamy texture. The wine is full bodied and dense, ready to drink now.

Bottled unfiltered, this wine has definite aging potential. It is perfumed and structured with ripe tannins as well as red fruits. It is a dry style of Port, bringing out fruit as well as structure and acidity. The tannins will allow the wine to age. Drink now, but better from 2021.

Lovely aromas introduce this pleasingly complex young wine. One new and one once-used barrel were used, lending interesting scents and highlights of mushroom, cola and chocolate to its core of black cherry fruit. The tannins are well managed and ripe, with resonating streaks of bacon and vanilla.

Crisp blackberry and red-cherry flavors are balanced neatly by savory complexities of smoke and earth in this elegant Pinot Noir. It's a graceful, tautly balanced wine showcasing a fresh granitic backbone and zesty sour-cherry acidity. Soft fine tannins accentuate its approachablea spry style.

Pretty on the nose in floral freshness, this wine offers big bold flavors of smoked cherry, stemmy earth and a bite of citrus that keeps it intriguing and bright. Tart complementary flavors of pomegranate and strawberry persist pleasurably on the light-bodied palate.

Acclaimed winemaker Steve Flamsteed delivers the goods in this complex yet easygoing single-vineyard Chard. There's a lot going one here: citrus blossom, lime leaf, lemon balm and pineapple leaf notes are backed by warm stones, struck match and some toasty creaminess. The acidity is prickly and citrusy, wrapped in a pineapple tang, with a limey and seemingly endless finish. Drink now–2023.
This is a youthful, tightly woven wine, with a floral nose of cherry blossom. A wealth of bright cranberry and raspberry melds over a grainy texture, supportive acidity and integrated oak.

The winery calls this the most Chablis-like of their many Chardonnays due to its tight, high-acid style and firm spine. Apple, grapefruit, lime and stone flavors are in focus, with Graham cracker highlights and a hint of straw. It was gently aged in 50% new French oak.

Wet earth, ripe pear, rose petals and tangerine zest on the nose almost attain a kind of marzipan spice on the palate. Residual sugar boosts that bittersweet almond notion on the even-handed, rounded and concentrated body. This is lovely now, but will be sensational in the future. Drink now–2028.

In this wine, it seems like the purest orange zest is clouded in stony smoke. The palate allows for more generous juiciness, rippling across the tongue with ample freshness and verve. The finish is of aromatic citrus foliage, ripe lemon and tangerine.

Very dense in the glass, this rich complex wine shows dark blackberry, black currant and even flashes of blueberry on the nose, with spice cake and concentrated jasmine as well. The tannins are thick but polished on the sip, where elegant purple-flower flavors meet with vanilla cake, chocolate, blueberry muffin and a strong acid blast on the finish.

Citrus, pineapple, dried Mediterranean herb and bread dough aromas follow through to the elegant, savory palate along with a hint of ginger. It's gorgeous, fresh and savory, with a bone-dry, mineral finish. Bright acidity and a silky mousse give it finesse and tension.

This has an invitingly fragrant sweetness on the nose, with jasmine and cotton candy, while the palate is etched in generous helpings of honeyed oak and brioche. Full bodied and richly textured, it delivers ample complexity around its strong additional flavors of hazelnut and vanilla.

Hedonistic is an apt word to describe this luscious, perfumed sip full of black plum and cherry flavors. It's unabashedly ripe and rich but maintains an upright edge marked by earth and mineral tones. The finish is long and silky, framed by chalky tannins and whiffs of rose and violet. Delicious already but should improve through 2028.

Beautiful fruit, flower and spice aromas give way to opulent, rich and complex flavors in this very appealing and polished wine. It has vivid black-cherry flavors, baking-spice accents and a palate-soothing texture of fine-grained tannins and moderate acidity.

Elegant aromas of cranberry, strawberry and dusty gravel show on the nose of this block-designated bottling. The palate is subtle but persistent, offering delicate flavors of hibiscus, pomegranate, oregano and wild thyme.

Intensely ripe yet finessed, this big-bodied Gigondas offers luscious blackberry and cherry flavors shaded by brushstrokes of earth, garrigue and violet. It's silky yet brisk with a transparency of crushed minerals brightening the finish. Fine, firm tannins lend structure. Enjoy now–2030.
Well integrated, this wine is bright, tight and fruity. A touch of minerality as well as citrus balances the riper yellow fruits. Drink this wine now.
This ripe wine is toasty, yeasty and ready to drink. Its fruitiness is there although the wine is more about texture and spiciness. Drink now.

This ripe, green-plum-flavored wine is crisp with acidity and a lively texture. It comes from vines on the elevated plateau behind Nuits Saint-Georges, giving the wine a cool, collected and tangy character. Drink now.

A strong herbal display shows on the nose of this bottling, including dried oregano as well as shaved chocolate, coffee and red-plum fruit. The palate adds marjoram and pencil shavings to the mix, which gives a strong cedar tone to the cooked blackberry flavor, finishing with sticky tannins.

Sweeter-leaning aromas of lime and lemon syrup meet with crushed white rocks and light orange blossom on the nose of this bottling. The palate proves more dry than expected, with flavors of lime rind, orange-blossom candies and fresh herbs.
Rustic and well priced, this has a char oak imprint with highlights of cedar and pencil, its overall intensity and blackberry richness tamed by an herbal underbelly and lifted acidity.

Aromas of oak, plum and exotic spice lead the way along with a whiff of smoke. The aromas follow over to the firm palate, together with prune, cherry, star anise and bitter cocoa. It's youthfully tight, with a backbone of bracing acidity and assertive, close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2025.

A blend of grapes from the pioneering family's properties in Livermore and Arroyo Seco, this starts with aromas of pear flesh, lime skin, bright tangerine, honeydew and a touch of chalk. There is a tropical streak to the palate, but it's energetic and balanced, showing flavors of guava, mango and ripe red apple, all honed in by a tight pink-grapefruit-pith structure.

This is a polished and tightly wound blend that is savory and meaty in flavors of tart cranberry, hoisin sauce and cigar box. It's a medium- to full-bodied wine, wrapped in drying, chalky tannins, but ends on a fruity finish.

Aromas of rose petal, red berry and underbrush emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, crushed raspberry and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2028.

This blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Petit Verdot commemorates the number of consecutive harvests by the Scotto family of Steele Canyon Cellars. Candied red fruit gives it broad, lasting richness that lingers across the structured palate.

This wood-aged wine is deliciously spicy. Antão Vaz dominates the blend and lends both rich apple and citrus flavors as well as an opulent character. The wine is poised, balanced and is just ready to drink.
Mellow and relaxed in texture and extremely ripe in flavor, this full-bodied wine oozes jammy blackberry and black cherry on a mouthcoating structure of soft tannins and acidity.
designation: Year of the Ram Single Vineyard

description: Voluptuous aromas of dark strawberry, rose and hibiscus are set against strong cinnamon spice and slate-like minerality on the nose of this bottling from a Talley-owned vineyard that doesn't sell much fruit. That minerality is strong on the sip, with gravelly, soil-laced flavors framing the dark cranberry fruits.

Enticing aromas of rose petal, woodland berry and dark spice are front and center. The energetic palate doles out red cherry, juicy cranberry, cinnamon and tobacco alongside youthfully austere refined tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2022–2033.

Made from 90% Pinot Noir and 10% Chardonnay, this is cranberry colored and flavored, with a rich, thick mousse. Delicately textured, it has back notes of orange and strawberry and bright, fresh, persistent acidity and a complex lingering of seashell.

Dark-skinned berry, rose, dark spice and menthol aromas mingle together in the glass. On the full-bodied palate, youthfully austere fine-grained tannins give taut polished support to juicy Marasca cherry, cranberry, licorice and a sprinkling of cinnamon. It's still young and needs a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2024–2034.

Creamy notes of apple, lemon and yeast combine appealingly on the nose. The same inherent balance is also evident on the fresh, fizzing palate where autolytic generosity meets refreshing clean fruit of green apple and zesty lemon. The contrast between generous fruit and restrained slenderness is delicious, the finish is beautifully dry and lasting.

The aromas are downright fruity, with notes of black plum and black currant along with herb and green pepper. The palate brings sweet, simple fruit flavors, with the oak influence not apparent. It's a straightforward quaffer.

Grapy black-fruit aromas are friendly enough, with a dusting of baking spices. A tight snappy palate ranks as firm and not that giving, while this tastes of saucy plum and berry fruits prior to a dry tight finish with puckery scratchy tannins.
A fashionably pale-colored rosé, this crisp wine has a light touch of caramel and plenty of red-berry fruits. It leaves a bright, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

Aged for six months in oak, this ripe wine has spice as well as plenty of rich berry flavors. It is rounded and smooth, with a juicy, succulent aftertaste. Drink this blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah now.

Very extracted aromas of blackberry and raspberry meet with cola on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely tangy and primary: like drinking straight blackberry juice with the slightest hint of tannic structure.
Thick, concentrated and rich, this is a 100% stainless-steel fermented white that tangles in tart flavors of lemon and grapefruit.
This opens with delicate hawthorn and citrus aromas. The bright palate offers Granny Smith apple and Concorde pear flavors, crisp acidity and an almondy finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

description: This opens with banana, tangerine zest and pineapple aromas that carry over to the savory palate. Fresh acidity gives it a quenching finish. Drink through 2020.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

description: Dark-skinned berry, baking spice and leather aromas lead the nose of this wine. On the savory palate, fine-grained tannins support ripe black cherry, licorice and star anise flavors. Enjoy through 2022.

This blend of 80% Sangiovese, 10% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon opens with aromas of pressed violet, ripe wild berry and a whiff of pipe tobacco. Soft and juicy, the accessible palate offers crushed raspberry, vanilla and licorice framed in pliant tannins. Drink now.

This wine's name celebrates the chirrup of the cicada, a familiar Provençal sound. It is a smooth, creamy-textured wine with the ripe red fruits up front. It has tangy acidity as well as a crisp texture in the back, but enjoy this delicious wine mainly for its fruit.

Produced in the Beaujolais region using Gamay grapes this has a satisfying bite of acidity and structure, giving a ripe but crisp texture. Its textured apple and berry fruit is balanced by minerality. Drink now.

This is a ripe, lightly toasty wine, rich with blackberry flavors and showing considerable weight. It offers a touch of licorice, a firm core and the potential to age. This is the first vintage under the Jean-Claude Labrune family for this 130-acre organic Fronsac estate. Drink from 2022.

A deeply mineral elegance elevates this brisk rosé, lending hints of smoke and crushed stone to crisp raspberry and red-cherry flavors. It's full bodied but vibrantly balanced by refreshing acidity and a pristine, citrusy finish. Enjoy now—2019.

Made from equal parts Grenache and Syrah, this full-bodied wine offers loads of plummy, ripe cherry and berry flavors offset by an invigorating edge of black pepper and brisk acidity. It's luscious and juicy but firmly structured by taut, persistent tannins. Although it drinks well now it should improve through 2020 and hold further.

This 17th-century estate is on the plateau of Lussac, with 12 acres of silica and clay soil. The wine has a smoky edge along with perfumes from the Cabernet Franc in the blend. Its berry flavors, ripe tannins and cinnamon touch are rich and promise some good aging. Drink from 2022.

A touch of elderflower plays on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with easy, friendly lemon notes and an earthy texture reminiscent of ripe russet pear peel. Its lemon and ripe pear flavors harmonize, but the flicker of clean zestiness makes you long for more. Lovely.

This is an impressive wine, canned and ready to go in 4-packs. The producer focuses only on rosé, and it shows, the offering effortless in bright flavors of rose petal, red cherry and pomegranate, the acidity is up front and lasting.
This medium-bodied wine has an earthy, lightly herbal aroma, with plum and red cherry flavors as well as a little  textural grip. The slightly rustic, earthy notes add character.
This red-fruit and citrus-flavored wine is soft, light and open. Packed with attractive fruitiness, it's lightly textured. Drink this spicy wine now.
This juicy, ripe blend of seven grapes (including the rare Calado) is generous, fruity and immediately drinkable. With soft black fruit and balanced acidity, it has a ripe finish.

This wine's berry and cherry cola aromas seem candied and medicinal. On the palate, it's tight with rugged tannins. Its spiced plum and tobacco flavors have a burnt character while the finish is marked by tannic dryness.

Roses, lavender and dried herb wrap around the nose of this wine, a light-bodied expression that's enjoyable and approachable. The structure is moderate, as is the acidity, with a straightforward approach to the texture.
This wine has an aroma just like blackberry jam followed by opulent jammy mapley flavors and a sense of sweetness that lingers on the finish. It's full bodied and very lush in texture.

Stainless steel-aged, this delightful white shows high-toned floral characteristics of apricot and green apple, with a medium-bodied oomph of creamy lushness on the finish. It'll do well with food or on its own.

This big but superbly polished wine shows a great sense of finesse along with abundant fruit and spice flavors. The aromas are at once bright, spicy and like new leather, while the flavors evoke black cherry, black currant and blueberry.

Too many rosés go for power over finesse; this takes the lighter path, to good effect. Made from all organic estate fruit fermented entirely in stainless steel, it's fragrant and spicy at just 12% alcohol. But there's no lack of flavor: fresh strawberry, pink grapefruit and blood orange. A hint of pepper spices up the finish.

This wine is made from equal parts Upland, Hedges and Destiny Ridge vineyard fruit. The aromas leap out of the glass, suggesting green olives, chopped parsley, fresh flowers and smoked meat, the fruit notes lurking the background. The concentration of fruit and savory flavors is seamless and exquisite, with a lengthy finish.

Stillwater Creek is considered a Bordeaux variety site, but this wine proves that Syrah can excel there too. Mineral, dried herb, bacon fat, dark plum, barrel spice and red and blue fruit aromas lead to a full-bodied palate that blends fruit and savory notes. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.

Dense aromas of black-plum syrup are fruit-forward and plump but not sweet on the nose of this bottling from the producer who brought this grape to California. A chalky, very full mouthfeel carries flavors of black plum, fennel and pepper.

Silky smooth, soft and concentrated, this hails from 100-year-old vines in the heart of the appellation. The wine is luscious in strawberry and black-cherry flavors. Expansive and boldly ripe, it has a core of richness that never overwhelms, finding companionship in a wisp of black and white pepper.
designation: Fanucchi Wood Road Vineyard Old Vine

description: Both lime zest and candied lime appear on the nose but the palate gives a fuller picture of citrus, with the ripeness of juicy mandarin and the clarity of ripe lemon. An earthy backdrop creates texture and a counterpoint to the freshness. This wine is taut, dry and refreshing.

Baked red cherry, roasted plum, rose petals, carnation and extremely dark spice show on the nose of this bold bottling from the historic vineyard. It's elegantly presented on the palate, where flavors of red currant and framboise mix with baking spice, prominent floral touches and a penetrating acidity.

This delicious blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc hails from the Red Willow, Dionysus and Bacchus Vineyards. It's locked-up on first pour, opening to reveal bittersweet chocolate, graphite, raspberry, blackberry and dried herb notes. The palate is soft and smooth yet dense, showing sophistication, structure and impressive length. Best from 2023–2029.

Restrained hints of bergamot play on the nose. The palate sings with that same aroma, helped along by a touch of residual sweetness and vivid lemon freshness. Both heighten the flavor expression, creating tension and concentration. Juicy and lovely, this finishes dry.

This blend of 43% Mourvèdre, 16% Syrah, 14% Grenache, 14% Carignane and 13% Cabernet Sauvignon is a great look at what this cult producer is doing, but for much less price than other bottlings. Pure tangy fruit aromas of mulberry and condensed flower petals cut through the rustic earthy and gamy elements on the nose. Vibrant acidity explodes on the palate, which is full of red-currant, cranberry, parsley, sage and lavender flavors.
Named for the clone used in the cuvée, this wine offers lightly spiced, delicately layered tones of raspberry, cherry and pomegranate. The acidity is interwoven nicely between the fruit and spice.

Aromas of toast, bread crust and mature exotic fruit waft out of the glass. On the creamy palate, tangy acidity lifts ripe Golden Delicious apple, candied citrus zest, ginger and hazelnut, while a silky perlage lends finesse. It finishes on a honeyed mineral note.

Made by the firm that helped put quality Lambrusco on the map, this delicious, stunning wine opens with enticing scents of wild berry, rose petal and citrus. The aromas carry over to the elegant, foaming palate along with juicy strawberry, creamy nectarine, grapefruit and a sprinkling of white pepper. A silky mousse gives it an irresistible texture, while fresh acidity keeps it balanced.

Sourced from a mountainous site, this wine is brimming in mineral aspects of volcanic ash and crushed rock. Tangy and expansive on the palate, it offers persistent tones of flowers, ginger and lavender that accent rich baked plum. Enjoy 2021–2031.

Whispers of dried thyme, rosemary and wild mint extend from nose to finish in this supple, silken blend of Grenache and Syrah. It's a penetrating wine full of succulent black cherry flavor but keenly balanced, too. The finish is marked by rambling minerality and very fine, soft tannins. Pleasurable already but will improve through 2030.

Hints of crushed stone, savory dried thyme and lavender accent lush blackberry and cherry flavors in this wine. A blend of Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah, it's lavishly textured but anchored by restraint and earthiness. It drinks beautifully already but should improve through 2028.

Wild rose, red berry, new leather and dried aromatic herb aromas lead the way. On the taut palate, firm acidity provides the backbone for sour cherry, cranberry, white pepper and star anise. Drink 2020–2026.
While steely in acidity, this wine offers a counterbalance of fleshy pineapple and mango flavors. It finds a balance between both sides of the equation and also shows great integration with the oak.
Meaty layers of wild strawberry, peach and cherry shine in this well-integrated wine. It's light in ripeness and entirely refreshing in acidity.
designation: Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of

description: From a single vineyard, this rich wine balances acidity, concentration, ripe creamed-apple fruits and minerality. The wine is generous while never losing its great crispness. Drink now.
designation: Clos des Grands Primos Sur Lie

description: Cranberry and raspberry hold down the center of this blend, which serves as the entry point to the winery's extensive single vineyard portfolio. Citrus and herb flavors are well integrated, with just a hint of stem in the finishing tannins.

The 2016 vintage is strong for this well-established winery's Chardonnays, and this twist-top appellation blend is a more affordable way to indulge. Broad, fleshy aromas of ripe Asian pear, sea salt and nectarine tart lead into a rich palate that's rip with lemon and yellow pear but defined by penetrating acidity and decent tension.
Light aromas of spice, tobacco and herb lead to lighter styled fruit flavors. It doesn't entirely stand up on its own but has a place at the dinner table.
Pineapple, guava and grapefruit lead the way in this refreshing wine. There's a good lick of acidity that's balanced by ripe fruit flavors.
This wine is very smooth, fruity, ripe and almost sweet in flavor. It has plum and raisin notes, a soft texture, elevated alcohol and low acidity.

This single-vineyard Cabernet Franc has aromas of cherry cola and farm fresh green peppers. In the mouth, there are flavors of ripe blueberries and blackberry. The tannins are well balanced and the persistent finish has a touch of spice.

Small producer Ralph Hertelendy blends 81% Merlot with smaller percentages of other red Bordeaux grapes from a variety of sites across the valley in this well-made, complex wine. Char, smoked meat, juicy currant and cranberry are set against tight compressed tannins and intense oak, suggesting more time in bottle. Enjoy best 2025–2030.

Spicy, complex and layered, this is a richly interwoven vineyard-designate. It shines in earthy lavender and forest floor, spiced cherry and cardamom, lingering with ease on the palate within a balanced framework of acidity and tenacious freshness.

This blend of three of the Douro's classic grapes, Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz, is powerful and ripe while also retaining a sense of elegance.Fine tannins are integrated with the wood and black fruits to give a wine that needs to age. Drink from 2020.

A wonderfully heightened note of lemon exists midst the apple richness on the nose. The palate comes across as very fine and super creamy with its multitude of tiny bursting bubbles that swish across the palate with their freshness and flavor. Stony freshness resides somewhere deeply at the core of this wine. There is creaminess and red-apple briskness, gentle aroma and stony depth. The finish of this classy and elegant sparkler is dry and utterly moreish.

Demure and lightly earthy in forest and cardamom, this wine is defined by that underlying spiciness and a lengthy background of oak. Its balanced take on fruit includes strong twists of orange and wild strawberry.

Grown on a vineyard less than three miles to the ocean behind Cambria, this bottling shows popcorn, light marshmallow and light cream on the very plush nose. The sip tightens up considerably, focusing on fresh and racy lime peels yet with richer hints of clotted cream and flowing butter in the background.
Extremely light in the glass, this wine's aromas are almost so subtle that they don't exist. The palate is more interesting, starting a tad sweet then tightening around chalk and nectarine.
Punchy red-fruit aromas are lightly concentrated and floral. In the mouth, this is smacking and superficially hard. Generic berry and cherry flavors finish rough and tough, with jagged edges.
This clean, picnic-style wine gushes fresh fruit in the aroma and the flavor, like apricots, cherries and apples. It is medium bodied, appears slightly sweet and has a relatively soft mouthfeel.

Woody aromas of sawdust blend into berry, graphite and wet shale scents. With that much outsize upfront oak, it's no shock that this feels resiny and grabby. Woody savory black-fruit flavors are dry on a rubbing tannic finish.

A chewing-gum-pink color announces a simple, neutral nose that echoes this sweet sparkler's tint. A fresh easygoing palate avoids being cloying, while this tastes of candied fruits and Hawaiian Punch. This is candied but clean and tasty for the most part.
Aromas of medicine cabinet, brambly berry, tire rubber, and woodspice lead to sweet seeming fruit flavors. It doesn't all come together.

Made by adding brandy to stop fermentation, this richly structured wine is sweet yet firm with tannins. Its jammy black fruit is balanced by acidity and a dry edge. Let it age for a few months and drink from 2019.
Tense and mineral driven, this is a young wine. With its fruit-driven acidity, it is fresh while also having richness and concentration. This dense wine will be better from late 2018.
Full bodied yet delicate in concentration, this dry white wine offers crisp white pear and tangerine flavors accented by bramble, cashew and honey tones. The finish is brisk yet refreshing.

This estate, located some way inland, is one of several properties owned by the Sumeire family. The wine's blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah is classic and gives a ripe, rich while still crisp wine. Its acidity and layers of spice are perfumed and ready to drink.

This simple, fruity wine is soft, direct with its red fruits and crispness at the end. Its easy acidity and full-bodied character are balanced, giving room for the lively berry flavors and fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
Made from 100% Niellucciu, this wine is rich and ripe. Its strawberry fruit flavors and soft acidity give it a smooth texture, with an essential hint of freshness at the end. Drink now.

This opens with subtle scents evoking yellow wild flower and ripe orchard fruit. On the medium-bodied, elegant palate, hazelnut and tangerine zest add depth to a core of ripe yellow apple and Bartlett pear. It closes on a graphite note.

Sage and thyme lend herbal intrigue to this bottling, which also shows tangy aromas of red cherry compote. There's more herbal touches to the palate as well, with dried oregano and thyme set against a fresh pomegranate background.

This 100% Chardonnay méthode Champenoise sparkler boasts bright lemon rind, green apple and brioche aromas. Small bubbles frame its light-bodied palate, with crisp tree fruit, clarified butter and blanched almond flavors. An invigorating salty note carries the finish.

This is a substantive, savory and flavorful rose that has more oomph than is typical. Made from Rhône varieties grown at high elevation, its meaty, melony flavors, herbal accents, full body and relatively rich texture can fill the role of a light red wine at mealtime.

Crushed rose petal and lavender open the aromatic nose of this lovely wine, which is light bodied and delicately crafted. The midpalate evolves quietly to reveal earthy forest, cardamom and a tang of blood orange.

Earthy barnyard and turned earth open this wine, followed by fistfuls of baking spice and soft leather. Heat comes from the ripeness of baked black fruit and clove, the wine ultimately complex and structured.
Very fruity and mostly soft on the palate, this medium-bodied wine is an easy sipper for casual occasions. It has well-concentrated blackberry and raspberry flavors and a lightly tannic mouthfeel.

This is a straightforward, well-balanced and medium-bodied wine that will please a lot of people and offend no one. It has fresh juicy berry flavors, and mild tannins and acidity that add just enough texture.
Aromas of tropical fruit, Mediterranean scrub and citrus carry over to bright linear palate along with lemon notes. Crisp acidity gives it a refreshing finish.

Honeycomb, apple skin and light sweet-spice aromas set the scene for the nose and mouth of this medium-weight wine. The palate offers additional flavors of ripe melon flesh, while a peach-pit accent unfolds on the close. Drink now.

This is, frankly, a bomb of a wine (and is rather simple for the price), dripping in sweet, slightly sweaty oak, ripe berries and cola notes. You can feel the 15% alcohol on the palate but those jammy fruits and big oak characters will appeal to some big red lovers.

An earthy tinge clings to the ripe pear and rose-petal notes of the nose. The palate is rounded, fleshy and sweet with ripe peach and juicy pear but lacks a little focus. However, the fruit is out in full force in the medium-sweet finish.

Larry Schaffer isn't afraid to tackle obscure blending grapes and throw them in the bottle alone. This large grape produces a lighter, fresh wine, showing red plum skins, strawberry, rose petals, sumac and pepper on the nose, like an herbally enhanced fruit punch. The palate carries forth with juicy, rounded red melon and bubblegum flavors and buoyant acidity.

Extremely fruity and relatively light in body, this exuberant wine is easy to quaff. The strawberry and cherry flavors are so ripe and fresh they taste sweet, and the texture is soft and full with very little tannin.

Full of generous tannins and ripe black fruit, this estate wine is perfumed, ripe and balanced between acidity and structure. It comes from a 74-acre estate on the second terrace above the river Lot. It will soften and broaden out to give a full, fruity wine. Drink from 2021.

Savory notes of dried herb, nut and toast accent crisp black plum and currant in this full-bodied Lemberger. While a shade earthen and green, it's a juicy mouthwatering wine balancing plush texture against firm slightly tacky tannins.

Big flavors and a broad, mouthfilling texture help this barrel-fermented beauty stand out. Vanilla, custard and melted butter aromas lead to similarly rich flavors on the palate, where the wine feels layered and concentrated.
Densely textured, full of dusty tannins and with rich black fruits, this wine is hardly shy. It comes from ripe fruits, rich tannins and texture and juicy final acidity. Drink from 2020.

Savory aromas of black pepper, roasted lamb and burnt bacon decorate the boysenberry-syrup and dried maple-sugar notes of this bottling's extremely compelling nose. Brown sugar-glazed pork flavors meet with more pepper, soy and au jus on the palate, which will grow more complex and delicious with time. Drink 2020–2030.

Clos Fonta is a personal favorite among Priorat wines, and per usual, this vintage is dense and ripe. It offers prune, dried cheese, leather and oak aromas. Its lush palate is loaded with baked black fruit flavors and layered with toasty spice, coffee and chocolate notes. With its smooth finish, it's dark and rich but lacks energy. Drink through 2024.

Earth and dusty mineral tones blow off with aeration revealing vibrant notes of lemon and lime. It's a gorgeously concentrated kabinett with sweet, waxy flavors of pink grapefruit and honey. Zesty lime acidity and a backbone of spicy sunbaked slate lend pert structure.

The name “Pur Mineral” is an apt descriptor for this intensely mineral wine full of dusty slate and river rock complexities. It's luminously fruity too offering pristine Muscat grape and pear accented by a hint of exotic spice. It is dry in style yet rich and expansive in mouthfeel.

A floral and flinty aroma leads to rich black-cherry and mushroom flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine from one of California's earliest Pinot Noir specialists. It emphasizes complexity more than pure fruit and gets extra credit for a savory, mineral thread and supportive tannins.

This leads with oak-derived smoky, chocolaty aromas, but blackberry, maple and molasses notes fill out the nose. The muscular palate boasts blackberry and black currant flavors, while chocolaty richness is the prime driver of the powerful finish. Drink this brick of a Tempranillo through 2030.

A rose-tinged floral aroma opens this wine, giving way to a juicy expression of the grape that is velvety in texture and substantial in tannins. Black cherry and cassis flavors take on a liqueur-like richness, with a lingering tease of tobacco.

Aromas of dark-skinned berry, cooking spice, leather and a balsamic note come together on this full-bodied red. The concentrated palate offers dried Marasca cherry, clove and licorice alongside youthfully firm tannins and rather fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2029.

The crisp, mineral Chardonnay in this wine is keeping it fresh and still young. With acidity and tight citrus flavors, it has a dense texture that dominates the white-stone fruits, suggesting it should age a little longer. Drink from 2020.

One of the pair of prestige cuvées from this producer, this wine is full of ripe fruits, with touches of tannin as well as minerality. Extra time in bottle before release has deepened the wine's richness and introduced some secondary flavors. Drink now.
designation: Charles VII Blanc de Noirs Brut

description: Truffle, underbrush, leather, prune and exotic spice aromas lead the nose. The palate has a firm structure, offering dried Marasca cherry, bitter cocoa and star anise, as well as hints of oak. Drying, fine-grained tannins provide support.

Aromas of scorched earth, chopped aromatic herb, exotic spice and a balsamic whiff of menthol lead the nose. The tight structured palate shows dried morello cherry, star anise, leather and clove set against firm, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins time to unwind then drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit. Drink after 2022.

Good balance and a plethora of juicy, ripe fruit flavors highlight this full-bodied wine. It has generous black cherry and light baking-spice aromas, plenty of cherry and sour cherry in the flavors and a moderately tannic texture livened by good acidity.

Elegant aromas of black raspberry, wild mint, tarragon and mossy earth show on the nose of this clonal blend. Earthy thyme and cherry-tomato flavors play against the cranberry and raspberry fruit of the palate, with bright acidity driving deep into the finish.

Under winemaker Nadine Gublin's hand and new ownership, this four-acre former Charles Blondeau-Danne Père property delivers from the start offering both great richness and a tight texture. It is concentrated with mineral texture giving a balanced, rich wine that also has freshness. It sings of attractive fruits and structure as well as immediate drinkability.
designation: La Pièce sous le Bois Premier Cru

description: Dark yet pure aromas of blueberry, black pepper, olive and savory roasted beef show on the nose of this blend of 57% Merlot and 43% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's thick and lavish on the palate, with sticky tannins and dark berry and charred meat flavors that make the mouth stand at attention. Drink 2020–2035.
This wine has both power and the richness of the vintage. It has the potential to be opulent, full and delicious. Give this ripe wine with dense red fruits time. Drink from 2024

Crisp black plum and blackberry aromas are tinged with violet, spice and crushed mineral on the nose of this vibrant, perfumed wine. It's supple and plump, offering plumes of rich blackberry and plum flavors, but there's a firm mineral backbone as well, along with fine, upright tannins. Lovely already but will improve through 2030.

Aromas of camphor, dried rose, aromatic herb and a whiff of new leather come together on this fragrant red. Elegantly structured, the focused palate delivers red cherry, cranberry, star anise and rosemary alongside firm refined tannins and vibrant acidity. It's still youthfully austere so give it a few more years to unwind. Drink 2022–2029.

This impressive wine has weight and serious intent. Even at four years old, the tannins and the black-coffee flavors are prominent, suggesting this complex wine needs to age further. To balance all this density and concentration, the opulent blackberry fruits power through the rich structure. Drink from 2020.

Fermented in large oval casks, this wine is lush in aromas of seashell, flint and peaches. Those flavors combine in a textured, complex midpalate, adding orange, apple and butter cookie along the way. Drink now through the late 2020s.

With the Bandol's very own Mourvèdre dominating the blend of this wine, it has a spicy character, with layers of tannins as well as rich red-currant and berry fruits. It's a complex wine, offering pure fruit but with elegance and a rich aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.

Notions of very ripe aromatic pear stream from the nose with almost insistent headiness. The palate continues in this heady vein with a full boost of sweetness to the rich pear fruit, creating even more opulence. The palate is immensely concentrated, also in freshness, to provide a counterpoint to the decadence of all the honeyed fruit. Everything about this happens at full volume and the finish is long, medium sweet and lasting.

Savory aromas of white pepper, charred wood and roasted black fruit run alongside elegant touches of purple flowers on the very layered nose of this bottling. It's lightly bodied for Syrah but very energetic on the palate, offering lilac, violet, pepper and elderberry flavors.

Earthy, beefy berry aromas are gamy and herbal, with a hint of green. A full palate with grabby tannins is unrefined but energetic, while this Cabernet tastes of herbal berry fruits. A finish with oak, plum and currant flavors shows fresh acidity and scratchiness.
This simple, ripe and fruity wine offers spice as well as rich red-berry flavors. Softly textured and with just enough acidity, it is ready to drink.

Condensed dark berry aromas run heavy on the spice and low on nuance. This is a shearing, aggressive number with hard tannins. Chocolaty oak and berry fruit flavors are firm, herbal and finish with hard-driving acidity. In general, the 2016 vintage in Chile was difficult for red wines.

A cassis aroma blends with star anise and cinnamon, wrapped in tobacco leaf on the nose. The palate is laden in ripe blackberry and cassis, backed by robust tannins and balanced by linear acidity. The finish brings black pepper and tobacco muddled with black cherries and a final leathery note.

Refreshing aromas of fresh grapefruit and lemon are tempered by lime pith and wet stone. The palate echoes the nose, showing more bright citrus fruit and river rock tones alongside tangy lime-juice acidity. The finish brings fresh squeezed lemon juice laced with white pepper.

A touch of reduction still plays about the nose of this fresh, brisk, lemon- and lemon balm-scented Riesling. A lovely dimension of leesy yeast in the background hints at its youth, lending some extra body to the otherwise slender yet utterly refreshing palate.

One of the coolest sites sourced by the producer, this vineyard produces tiny berries, and the wine is concentrated and complex as a result. Spicy turned earth and baked strawberry show first, followed by clove, black pepper and anise, the wine textured with plenty of acidity.

Jasmine, orange blossom and citrus scents start this food-friendly white from Santorini. Sea salt, lemon and slate flavors prevail on the palate, feeling crisp and laser-focused. A perfect cohort to grilled fish or chicken.

This is what Anne-Laure Dufour considers to be her best wine: from the best vines and best grapes. Almost mature, certainly luscious, the wine is balanced, crisp and rich with honeyed botrytis. It is richly intense, with spicy, apricot and bitter-orange flavors that go well together. The wine could be drunk now, but will be even better from 2020.

This wine is a blend of fruit from Lawrence, Cold Creek and Canoe Ridge Vineyards. Its aromas are not yet ready to reveal their charms, with custard, lemon zest and flower blossom notes. The palate shows focus,  which carries through the lingering finish.

This wine is ripe and offers plenty of dry botrytis to give density and longevity. With 95% Sémillon, the apricot, orange and crisp acidity are coming together well. Full but not cloying, it will be delicious from 2021.

Briny apple, hay, mustard and yeasty aromas comprise the nose on this basic Cava. A lemony fruity palate is in balance, while this tastes of apple and nectarine prior to a steady finish with no glaring faults.

Plump black-currant, wood oil and licorice aromas show on the fairly ripe and deep nose of this bottling from northern San Diego County. Tannins rise quickly as does prominent acid on the palate, where black-fruit and darker-spice flavors reign.
This is a fat, full-bodied rosé, better drunk with food rather than as an aperitif. Red berries and a ripe character give it a rich finish.

A fairly dark shade of reddish, rusty red pink, this older rosé shows aromas of dark cherry and juniper on the nose. There are lots of earthy tones to the palate, where cranberry is the dominant fruit.

This sparkling Albariño holds its own, and given how little sparkling Albariño exists, that's a back-handed compliment. Aromas of apple and smoky flint set up floral flavors of citrus fruits backed by a cured-meat note of Iberico ham. On the finish, this turns green and bitter, with citrus-skin notes taking charge.

Crisp white-fruit and green-herb aromas lead to palate that's lean and juicy at first, but which goes flat in short order. Slightly bitter white-fruit flavors finish with lemony notes and some minerality.
Produced from organically grown grapes, this blend of five varieties is fruity and crisp, with mineral-driven acidity. Well balanced, it is ready to drink.

This wine's subdued aromas of white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit emerge in the glass. Reflecting the nose, the bright palate offers green apple, white peach and citrus notes. It has a clean, juicy finish.
From the east coast of Corsica, this wine is rich, ripe and full of tropical fruit flavors. It has fine acidity to balance the delicious, creaminess. Drink now.
Lifted ripe red-cherry notes on the nose carry right through to the palate with their joyful juiciness. This is easy-drinking but brimming with ripe cherry and freshness.

This wine opens in a wave of bright fresh flavor that evolves to present more creamy and substantive body and richness. The highlights are dipped in peach, apricot and melon, with a pronounced finish of vanilla and cinnamon.

This wine's fragrant blue flower and wild berry aromas align with a whiff of dark spice. Round and juicy, the savory, accessible palate doles out fleshy black cherry, crushed raspberry and baking spice flavors cushioned by supple tannins. Enjoy through 2020.

This varietal wine was aged for 32 months in new American oak. Its vanilla, coconut and cherry aromas lead to a mixture of fruit and sweet barrel flavors, and the latter win out on the finish. The tannins are strong and cinching, and the oak seems too far out front.
This wine's melony aromas come with a dried cheese note. It's soft in texture, with citrus and nectarine flavors that finish melony and sweet, with low intensity and little focus.

It's difficult to imagine a darker inkier color than this full-bodied wine has. The aromas and flavors are not as deep and concentrated as the color suggests. Mild blackberry and blueberry flavors dominate and the texture is moderately tannic.
This wine's yellow color is offputting. It smells more of haystack, compost and rubber than fruit and tastes like butter and dried apricots. It seems oxidized on the finish.

Though prinicipally Pinot Noir and Gamay, this simple, quaffing blend includes 5% Chardonnay and a splash of Pinot Gris. It's light and fruity, with citrus and strawberry notes and a hint of cherry candy, making it a go-to pour when something heavier suits neither your mood nor your food.

Made in the southern Vinho Verde region, this is a blend of Arinto, Loureiro and Trajadura. It's off dry and soft, with fine fruitiness and an attractive touch of bright acidity to bring out the refreshing nature of the grapes. Drink now.

This tannin-backed wine is firm and structured. A blend from multiple parcels, it is full of fruit cut by acidity and impressive tannins. The 15% Cabernet Franc in the blend brings its own softer perfumed character, leaving a wine that is still young but has a fine future. Drink from 2023.

The 49% Grenache shows strongly on the nose of this bottling, which also includes 32% Mourvèdre and 19% Syrah, with aromas of rose petals, hibiscus, fruit punch and exotic red spices on the nose. The palate is lighter bodied and very quaffable, with flavors of dark hibiscus and red plum. The tannins are a bit firm and need some time to smooth.

This is a fragrant, floral Shiraz, with plummy elements and a savory, dusting polish core. The easy-going palate is juicy and savory—firmly medium-bodied—with soft tannins but enough structure to make it last for several years. Drink now–2025.

Made from estate-grown fruit fermented in neutral oak, this is a unique white wine with a pale straw color and remarkable power. Fleshy and loaded with an intriguing mix of apple, pear, chocolate and almond paste flavors, it's a bit like a blend of Viognier and Pinot Gris, with more muscle.

Organically grown grapes give a pure fruit sense to this ripe wine. Its tannins and firm structure are still developing and softening, so it has good potential, with the richness and black fruits coming together. Drink from 2020.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Organic

description: Structured while also fruity, this is a rich blend of classic Douro grapes. Firm tannins and strong mineral texture point to aging potential. With black fruits, pepper, spice and good acidity, the wine is developing well. Drink from 2019.

Hints of sweet licorice and spice mark this intensely ripe but stately wine made from predominantly Mourvèdre. Compared with the producer's other Gigondas bottlings, La Plateau has a depth of minerality and distinct freshness of acidity. A potent yet graceful wine edged by fine, persistent tannins. Enjoy now–2030.

Hardly a run-of-the-mill wine, this potent liquid exudes tobacco and flint aromas that join with wood smoke, cocoa and blackberry flavors to make it dramatic and spicy. Full body and firm tannins build great structure to pair with indulgent proteins and give it the stuffing to age. Best from 2022.

The beautiful Rochioli site is divinely represented here, offering a lush, plush wine with an effusive nose of spicy oak. On the palate, the acidity is firm and focused, adding to a complex layering of texture and well-defined flavors of green apple, grapefruit and lime.

This single-vineyard wine hums on the nose but sings on the palate. Aromas of roasted, salted nuts, delicate orange and lemon peel seem to float in midair. On the palate, the toasty oak may be in plain view, but it's beautifully balanced by river stone minerality, crystalline acidity and a satiny mouthfeel that never seems to end. Drink now–2025.

Elegant and silky, this lovely sparkler opens with aromas of wildflower, crushed herb, orchard fruit and a yeasty hint of bread dough. Made with 70% Pinot Nero and 30% Chardonnay, the vibrant, creamy palate shows red cherry, Gala apple, white peach and tangerine zest alongside bright acidity and an ultrafine perlage. A mineral note lingers on the dry, juicy finish.

There's a deeply satisfying interplay of texture in this robust yet elegant wine. Its black plum and berry flavors are concentrated and plump but anchored by brisk acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins. It's rolling and rich yet full of tension and vibe. Drinks well already but could gain complexity through 2026 and hold a few years further.

Tightly packed blackberry, wood-smoke and black-pepper aromas are remarkably vivid in this full-bodied, rich and creamy-textured wine. It's big in structure, attractively oaky, and filled with ripe, exotic but classic meaty spicy gamy flavors.

This wine has a depth of flavor and length that's rewarding within a richly balanced, focused and tightly textured ring of acidity. There's an imprint of lemon oil that's slightly viscous and completely compelling on the palate.

Most of the fruit for this wine comes from Old Stones Vineyard in The Rocks District, the rest from top sites Forgotten Hills and Olsen. The aromas pop, with smoked meat, green and black olive, mountain blueberry, gun smoke, fresh herb, orange peel, flower and wet stone notes. The palate is soft, smooth and sultry yet balanced with vibrancy and freshness. With its extraordinarily long blue fruit- and charcuterie-laced finish, it's an outrageous value. Best before 2024.

Gentle, herb-fringed pear appears on the nose. The palate is dry and slender but shimmers with generous, bright rays of juicy pear, toned with lemon freshness. This is earthy Pinot Gris, but with an elegant flair. The finish is dry and refreshing.
designation: Clos des Capucines Cuvée Ste Catherine

description: Aged in second-fill French puncheons, this wine pops with green and black olive, charcuterie, stem, wet rock and potpourri aromas. The palate explodes with fruit and savory flavors that persist into a mineral-laden finish. A knockout.

Faint hints of orange zest on the nose become fuller on the juicy palate. A wonderful apple tartness veers between ripe, juicy fruit and lip-smacking refreshment. This wine offers a lovely, dry, concentrated mouthful of fruit on a lithe body.

Very easy-to-like aromas of lemon rind, lime pith and light apple blossom make for a refreshing and pleasurable entry to this bottling. There is great grip to the sip, where wet cement minerality meets with grapefruit-juice flavors.

Labeled Willamette Valley, but entirely estate-grown McMinnville AVA fruit, this is a bit on the chewy, tannic side, but has plenty of blackberry fruit power as well. Barrel aging adds brown spices and coffee accents, with a vein of cola running through the finish.
Leather, cedar and dark berry aromas lead the nose. The taut palate offers sour cherry, tobacco and clove alongside chewy tannins. Drink 2022–2028.

Big in luscious flavor and ample body and ripeness, this white shines in pear, honeysuckle and vanilla cream, fermented and aged in neutral French oak barrels. It is fleshy and well integrated, with a moderate streak of supportive acidity.

Though slightly high toned, there's much to like here. Black cherry fruit and a dusting of cocoa powder focus the flavors in a smooth and spicy wine. As it moves across the palate, a streak of vanilla, followed by a lingering flavor of bacon, comes up. It's probably best to drink this now through the early 2020s.

Earthy, rubbery berry and plum aromas are spicy and dry. A tight palate with firm tannins and bold acidity offers plenty of grip. Baked plum and currant flavors are dry and spicy on a finish with residual oak character. Drink through 2023.

Deep and dark aromas of black plum meet with smoke, turned earth and dried herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines juicy flavors of baked cherry and more plum with sharp baking spices, all framed by strong but pleasant tannins.

A mingling of 55% Pinot Noir and 45% Chardonnay, this imparts nicely complex, layered elements of brioche, wet stone and lemon rind, the acidity tenacious and complementary. Dry, its late disgorging makes for admirable length and breadth.

The combination of ripest peach and Damask rose on the nose makes for immediate headiness. This continues unabashed on the rounded medium-sweet palate where the residual sweetness makes the peachiness wash over all the senses. This is full-on, rounded, juicy and totally peachy with a sweet finish. With already a number of years in bottle, this is just about hitting its stride. Drink through 2028.

This is an approachable release from the mountain estate that is known for ageworthy Cabernet. Earthy and herbal, it offers clove, cedar and peppery notes. The structure is rounded and concentrated in balanced black fruit.

Lush blackberry and cassis aromas offer a deep dive into the land of ripe fruit, all touched up by notes of coffee and mocha. This Uco Valley Malbec is flush, with volume and precision to the palate. Earthy berry, mocha and chocolate cake flavors finish full and ripe. Drink through 2028.

A heady dose of fresh dill and cigar box rides over a dense core of cherry and spicy blackberry in this flagship wine from Masciarelli. It's big and bold on the palate, boasting a concentrated berry tone bolstered by bracing tannins and shot through with a refreshing granite twang. This powerful wine needs time in the cellar. Drink 2022–2030.

This rich, rounded white wine offers concentrated lemon and yellow-apple flavors balanced by fresh citrusy acidity. It's silky and enveloping on the palate, accented by a touch of vanilla and toast. The finish is long, marked by a hint of phenolic grip.

This wine is a blend of fruit from Grand Ciel (30%), Upchurch (30%), Ciel du Cheval (26%) and Klipsun vineyards. Its vibrant aromas of bittersweet chocolate, graphite, coffee, black cherries, black raspberries and barrel spices lead to a palate packed to the brim with dark fruit flavors. Its supported by a firm handshake of tannin.
This wine's raspberry, cherry, herb, orange peel, coffee, smoke and spice aromas are understated. The flavors showing a very pretty sense of styling.

This ripe and perfumed wine is full of rich black cherry and spice. It is balanced with acidity, fine, dusty tannins and a full, juicy aftertaste. The wine is still young, with a touch of licorice and bitter extraction that will dissipate. Drink from 2020.
