It's full bodied and inviting, offering Marasca cherry, pomegranate, white pepper and star anise set against fresh acidity and refined tannins. It's already almost approachable but will also offer years of pleasure. Drink 2020–2026.

Quite a dark expression of Pinot Noir, this wine begins with aromas of boysenberry juice, pungent star anise and a black licorice touch on the nose. On the palate, bouncy and sharp acidity drives through dark-fruit flavors, making for a very lively bottling.
This brilliant garnet colored wine has aromas of black cherry and raspberry that translate to the palate. The finish is bright and crisp.

This wine's tropical aromas are true to the variety. It has an oily texture and modest acidity. Its mix of salty tropical fruit and nutty flavors shifts to lychee on the finish. Overall, it's no more than an easy quaffer.

Pretty, light aromas of green melon rind, lime leaf, thyme, clover and just-dried grass dance on the nose of this white blend. The palate offers even less intensity, with a faint green-melon flavor and a thin yet clean mouthfeel. Drink now.
Soft, with candied raspberry and spice, this is an easy, gentle wine. With freshness as well as ripe strawberry flavors, it is a generous wine that is ready to drink.
This is an herbal wine, crisp with lively acidity and some ripe raspberry flavors. The fruit balances with freshness and a smooth, clean aftertaste. Drink now.

Brambly fruit, wet earth and a green stalky character make up this wine's aroma profile. The stalkiness disappears on the palate and the plush fruit takes the fore and is balanced by a solid line of tannins. Sweet oak creeps in on the finish.

Estate grown, this is a signature wine for the producer. It is named for Biale's father and made from vines planted decades ago. Tangy red fruit, plum and citrus complement a rich and tannic midpalate of powerful density and complexity, seasoned in dried flowers.

Bright layers of citrus and strawberry highlight a wild element of high-toned character in this fiercely complex, tannic wine that expands on the palate over time. Floral rose and lavender persist from start to finish.

This wine opens with a voluptuous nose of black cherry, vanilla and black tea. The palate is lush and expansive, with complex earthiness that highlights a fruit profile brimming in spice and lively acidity.
A ripe, smoky wine with great fruit and rich tannins, this is going to age well. It has power and the structure you expect from this appellation. Drink this dense, rich wine from 2025.

Tight, concentrated aromas of black fig and dark chocolate meet beefy, earthy and ripe berry flavors in this high-powered, concentrated wine. It has a full body and firm tannins that give it a powerful structure, with nice depth and a lingering chocolate and cherry finish.

This has a shy nose that eventually reveals subtle aromas evoking dark culinary spice, crushed rock, crushed herb and a whiff of blue flower. The palate boasts the firm's trademark of structure and weightless elegance, delivering red cherry, wild strawberry, orange zest, star anise and salty minerals alongside polished tannins. It's well balanced, with bright acidity. Drink 2021–2028.

This wine comes from the oldest vines on Red Mountain, planted in 1975. The aromas are appealing, recalling herbs, cassis, dark fruit, dates and exotic spice. The fruit and barrel flavors are concentrated and tightly wound, bringing a structure that augurs well for its longevity.

This dark red-violet-hued wine offers aromas of blackberry, strawberry and juniper. The palate is filled with flavors of cherry, raspberry, lavender and almond blossom set into lush tannins. A burst of orange zest makes for a bold finish.
Aromas of orange rind, dried apricot and acacia honey follow over to the deeply colored full-bodied palate along with toasted hazelnut and thyme. It's unusual but also intriguing and savory.

Dark cherry, blackberry, menthol, cracked pepper and dried green herbs are all out to play on the nose here. But it's the savory, elegant palate really makes this wine. It's tightly wound with sinewy tannins, black olives and tangy fruit, finishing long and herbal.

This wine's light strawberry fruit is scented with unusual notes of dried straw. There's a hint of barnyard on the nose, which follows through to the palate. The mix of grain, grass and berry notes keeps it interesting, though it's definitely on the lighter side of Oregon Pinot.

This is a fascinating wine at all turns. The color is not darker than water, and the aromas are extremely juicy with orange blossom, poached pear, bubblegum and gardenia—one of the most aromatic bottlings around. The palate is bone dry with a chalky flavor and backbone, yet hints of bubblegum and plumeria give warmth.

Fermented in concrete, this also spent a year in one-quarter new French oak. Some vanilla scents emerge on first sniff, leading into fruit flavors of berry and plum. As the wine breathes open, it adds some refreshing citrus to the base, and with ample time fleshes out into a full-bodied, fine-tuned Pinot.

Aromas of iris, leather, dark spice and a balsamic note lead the nose. The juicy slender palate offers cherry, pomegranate and white pepper alongside polished tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2020–2028.

This blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Cabernet Franc opens with aromas of dark berry, bell pepper and tilled soil. The firm, balanced palate offers black plum, mocha, ginger and green peppercorn alongside fine-grained tannins.

Heady aromas of ripe strawberry, red cherry, clove and white pepper follow over to the vibrant palate alongside supple, polished tannins. Bright acidity lends balance and gives it a crisp, juicy finish. Chill slightly for a perfect summer red.

This expressive white opens with heady scents of apricot, rose and grapefruit that follow through to the savory palate along with peach, crushed herb and a mineral note suggesting sea salt. It closes crisp and clean.

This is a well-made blend of equal parts Merlot and Syrah, the wine smooth and brawny in a grip of leathery tannin, spicy cinnamon and pepper. It has a meaty profile complemented by tastes of dried herb, cedar and dark cherry.
Dusty with highlights of cedar and sage, this full-bodied wine presents as somewhat dull on the palate—a soft, rounded and approachable expression of jammy blueberry.

Cedary aromas of dried berry and plum are leafy, earthy and raw. In the mouth, this is dominated by shearing acidity that creates scratchiness. Citrus and sour cherry flavors land on an acid-dominated finish. Freshness is good, but this Bordeaux blend goes a little too far in that direction.

Eighteen months in wood was perhaps too much for this wine. It is now dominated by toasty wood flavors and dense tannins. Spice, pepper and a bitter edge come before the fruitiness. It will soften, but it seems that woodiness will always be there.

This is the white wine in a trio of bottlings produced by the Miecaze family of Château Léognan. It is poised, fruity and crisply fresh. Citrus acidity and touches of apricot and green plum are balanced by a round, textured aftertaste. Drink now.

From the relatively cooler maritime climes of the Awatere Valley in Marlborough, this Sauvignon leads with green vegetal notes of snow pea and green bell pepper, backed up by lemon-lime and grapefruit. The palate slippery with some fruit sweetness and rather searing acid. Stylistically it feels a little forced.
This wine is almost too soft, with superripe grapes that are missing out on acidity. It does have plenty of richness, with full apricot and pineapple flavors. Drink the wine now.
A flinty aroma and smoky, white-peppery flavors give this medium-bodied wine a savory rather than fruity profile. Hints of earthiness join subtle lemon flavors on the palate.

Coming from the exceptionally cool 2011 vintage, this wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Malbec and Merlot. The aromas are high toned, with notes of cherry and licorice. The palate is lighter in style, with the concentration not seeming all there. Drink now.
A rare red grape, Tinta Miúda in Portugal is better known as Graciano in Spain. This simple, fruity wine sums up the grape with its soft texture and plenty of acidity. It is ready to drink.
Fresh in feel and a touch sweet, this fruity wine is light bodied and shows flavors of flowers and apples, supported by a soft texture.

Forward scents of peach, passion fruit, rose and fresh ginger are coupled with a soft warmth on the nose of this bottling. It's medium in weight on the palate, with a round, mouth-filling texture that could use a bit more lift to counter the ripe fruit tones.

This atypical blend of 70% Syrah, 22% Sangiovese, 8% Cabernet Franc shows tangy aromas of blackberry balsamic sauce, turned loam, smoke and grape seed on the nose. The palate is very primary with Concord grape and oak flavors.
Yellow apple, peach and banana make for a fruity entrance to this unoaked Chardonnay. There's nice weight and roundness to the palate, with ample acidity to back it up.

Blackberry, cracked pepper, crushed herbs, licorice and coffee show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 10% Merlot, 8% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Franc. There is decent heft to the sip, which offers flavors of blackberry, oregano, anise and a pinch of dill.
This leads with red fruit, tilled earth and leather aromas. The savory palate offers dried black cherry, white pepper and star anise flavors alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

Red plum and green peppercorn aromas lead the nose of this wine while the straightforward palate offers clove, blackberry and tobacco flavors. Polished tannins provide lithe support. Drink through 2021.

Fragrant blue flower, wild berry and underbrush aromas take center stage in this enjoyable red. The bright, supple palate doles out juicy black cherry, clove and tobacco leaf notes, offset by easygoing tannins. Drink soon.

Owned by the same family for five generations, this estate has 34 acres of vines. This spicy, peppery wine comes from the dominant Mourvèdre with Grenache and Cinsault. The wine is less about bright fruit and more about concentration, with a generous texture that will benefit from softening. Drink from 2018.

Soft nectarine flesh is cut by key lime and a touch of brioche on the nose of this bottling. It's relatively light and tightly focused on the palate, where poached pear, red apple, cherimoya and the slightest hint of butterscotch flavors arise.

Dry and made from older-vine Pinot Noir grapes, this wine is pinkish orange in hue, with crisp, firm flavors of strawberry, raspberry and cotton candy. Moderately structured, it has a welcome plushness on the palate.

Faint lemon zest notes open into mandarin hints on the nose of this wine. The palate presents a similarly ripe and tart picture of refreshing, juicy citrus. The palate is light, easy, aromatic and very refreshing—especially for summer sipping.

Green pear, sage and miso touches on the nose of this wine carry seamlessly over to the wonderfully expressive, textured palate. There's lemony brightness but also a midpalate core of yeast and salty savoriness. What a lovely Grüner Veltliner: dry, light but oh so expressive.

Nicely tangy and appetizing, this medium-bodied, absolutely dry wine smells like citrus blossoms and tastes like pink grapefruit. It has great balance, zingy acidity and good flavor concentration underneath.

Concentrated black currant is livened up with hints of espresso, olive and moist earth on the nose of this bottling. There is strong acid and decent tannins on the palate, framing the dark berry and baking-spice flavors.

A touch of fennel seed joins the notions of freshly cut red-apple peel on the nose. The palate comes in with lemon oil that suffuses the entire palate, bathing the dry, lithe but toned body in lemony light. The finish is long and intense.

The fruit of the historic Hickinbotham vineyard once went into some of Australia's top wines, including Penfolds Grange. Currently owned by California's Jackson family and meticulously farmed by Vineyard Manager Michael Lane, this top-notch fruit is getting the recognition it deserves under its own label. This wine is a heady combo of juicy ripe blackberry fruit, damp wood, the charred embers of a fire, sumac spice and something sanguine and meaty. The palate shows richness of fruit but it's well integrated with savory spicy wood and drying tannins. It's one for the cellar. Drink now–2038.

Among Holloran's lineup of excellent Rieslings, this is top tier. In this outstanding vintage, it shows exceptional focus and concentration, with heady aromas and dense peach, apricot and papaya flavors. Though quite young, it's supple, rich and ready for immediate enjoyment yet could certainly age for a decade or longer.

Light in the glass, there is freshness and tension to the nose of this blend of 52% Grenache, 25% Carignane and 23% Syrah, with aromas of mulberry, red plum and hibiscus but also cinnamon, sumac and rose petal. Its light weight sails across the palate, mixing pomegranate, sage and cracked pepper flavors.

Aromatic notes of ripe blood-orange peel and flesh on the nose continue seamlessly on the full-fruited, concentrated palate. They are joined by zesty lemon that accentuates their purity and freshness. The body is toned and slender but has real impact and exquisite freshness. The finish is long and clean.

This reserve-level offering is subtle and complex in tones of fig, blackberry, black cherry, leather, espresso and oregano that come together beautifully. There's no need to wait, but it should continue to drink well through 2025.

This wine is fermented partially in concrete, partially in amphora and French oak puncheon. Lemony green-apple and peach flavors star with ease against a backdrop of creamy, lush texture and plenty of fresh bright acidity.

From Inniskillin's Niagara Estate, this complex and detailed wine deftly balances its 235 g/L of residual sugar against firming acidity. The lemonade and iced tea mix of an Arnold Palmer meets with rich flavors of honey, maple syrup and butterscotch. It's decadently delicious, lively and lingering.

From the producer's estate vineyard wedged within the Vaca Mountains, this is a nicely structured wine, lengthy in dry tannin and a persistence of dried herb. A lingering fruitiness of cherry and cassis offer depth of flavor within floral aromatics of lavender and sage. The finish is defined in mocha.

Fresh friendly notes of ripe pear have some green-apple freshness about them. On the palate, that freshness is joined by juicy sweetness, boosting the notes of ripe pear. There is something easy about this—the wine wears its medium sweetness and the opulence this brings lightly. Drink until 2025.

Pressed rose, wild berry, underbrush and new leather aromas shape the delicate, enticing bouquet. On the ethereal palate, taut refined tannins support cranberry, sour cherry, white pepper, sage and a hint of tobacco alongside rather firm acidity. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.

A wealth of ripe cherry, clove, toast and tobacco carries to the linear, focused palate. While this wine is held together by bracing acidity and a firm grip of tannins, there's enough fruit to broaden out the midpalate and carry to the lingering cherry-skin and spice finish. Drink from 2020 for things to soften a bit.
Refreshing notes of pressed apple and pear are juicy and light footed in this off-dry Riesling. It's an easy-drinking wine without a lot of complexity but finishes crisp and clean.

Although its oaky plum and berry aromas smell a bit like sweet plastic, this is largely harmonious on the palate. Bright acidity pumps up its blackberry, plum and milk chocolate flavors, remaining racy on the finish.
This medium-bodied wine is pleasant and fruity, showing ripe apple and peach flavors over soft acidity.
A compost-like scent brings this wine's freshness into question. Despite piercing acidity, it lacks shape and focus—all salty orange and apricot flavors that finish flat, with little follow-through.
Garnet in the glass, this wine has aromas of red cherry, vanilla and black raspberry. On the palate, there are flavors of cherry vanilla and cocoa powder that are bolstered by chewy tannins.
This wine's punchy citrus, pineapple and pyrazine aromas lead to a steady but shy palate with adequate acidity. Its mix of tropical fruit and green citrus flavors finishes slightly bitter.

Grace and power embody this ripe, intensely concentrated wine. Black cherry and berry flavors are succulent yet pure, augmented by whispers of spice, cedar and earth. The palate is supple and mouthfilling yet rimmed by taut, integrated tannins. Drinks beautifully already but should improve through 2026 and hold a few years beyond.

While this wine is still very young with its dark tannins, it also has fine potential. Ripe red-berry flavors are right up front, giving a juicy character as well as plenty of acidity. The wine has weight and concentration, and is likely to be ready from 2022.

Extremely fresh aromas of spring blossoms, lily and lemongrass show on the nose of this blend of 36% Chardonnay, 32% Pinot Blanc and 32% Pinot Gris. The palate is immensely textural and racy, delivering tingling flavors of yellow grapefruit, lime rind, yuzu an Asian pear.

Plump red cherry, star anise, gingerbread and strawberry gelato aromas show on this single-vineyard expression. The palate is extremely structural even though it is lighter weight in mouthfeel, with taut tannins carrying snappy red-fruit flavors, dried ginger and brown spices. Drink 2019–2032.

Saturated aromas of jammy blackberry come with plenty of Maipo's herbal essence. A sappy, full-bodied palate is extracted in feel but doesn't tip in the wrong direction. Luscious blackberry flavors land on the finish alongside flavors of chocolate and prune. Drink through 2021.

Creamy and delicious, this lovely sparkler offers delicate scents of wildflower, yellow stone fruit, wet stone and a whiff of bread dough. The silky palate delivers golden apple, lemon zest and almond alongside a steely mineral note and crisp acidity. It has a pristine, bone-dry finish.

This is a bright fresh white that shows a nice complement of dried herb and lemongrass with juicier, more concentrated flavors of white peach and melon. Elegantly crafted, it has a lushness to the palate that's lengthy and complex.
This full-bodied Manzanilla's pine and stone fruit aromas are lively and precise. On the palate, dry citrus and apricot flavors roll out nicely over a firm and balanced finish.
Firm and tart, this is anchored by black cherry fruit, with strong coffee and cola highlights. Give it a long sniff and you'll detect a slightly funky note. Drink soon.

This wine is a blend of 57% Touriga Nacional, 29% Sauzao, 9% Tinta Cao and 5% Tinta Roriz. Its vanilla, purple fruit and barrel aromas lead to sweet, balanced fruit flavors that persist into the finish.

Smoke and coffee aromas float above this four-barrel reserve. In the mouth, it's still compact, with tart cherry and black olive flavors and astringent tannins. It spent 18 months in 30% new French oak and seems built for at least a decade of life ahead.

A savory Sangiovese-based wine, with 5% Merlot, this boasts aromas of violet, moist earth and black-skinned berry. The juicy palate offers succulent Marasca cherry, licorice, white pepper and clove alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2023.

A leafy, minty streak adds interest to this nicely fruity, silky smooth and medium-bodied wine. It seems to melt in the mouth and coat the tongue with an almost jammy but not too heavy plum character that's easy to enjoy.

From a high-elevation site, this is a broadly structured, full-bodied wine, with strong elements of cedar, dried herb and brown sugar. A cherry jam flavor accents the luxuriously lush palate, ending on an earthy leather note.

A ripe wine, full of apple and tropical fruit, this is a rich style of Sancerre. Still young with its mineral texture intact, it has delicious fruit, finely balanced acidity and an opulent character. Drink from 2019.

From a high-elevation site called Cooley Ranch, this combines 55% Cabernet Sauvignon with 26% Malbec, 17% Syrah and 2% Viognier. Clove, sage and peppercorn dot the smoothly textured palate, never holding back on the bold, juicy black-fruit flavor and the chocolate finish.
This is the home domaine of what has become a large negociant house. The wine is all about fruit, crisp and full of citrus and white stone-fruit flavors, with intense acidity. Drink now.

A naturally cloudy hue and some funky, still reduced yeast notes give a very honest impression of ripe grapes. The palate is light and dry, slightly sparkling and tangy, with a real, pervasive freshness. A lovely, honest Riesling-based pét-nat.

Most of the fruit for this wine comes from a block of Conner-Lee Vineyard planted in 1992. Somewhat light in color, it offers appealing raspberry, chocolate, dried herb and spice aromas and soft, supple fruit flavors, with light savory herb accents from the addition of 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. Juicy fruit flavors linger on the finish. It shows lovely balance and texture.

This buoyant red wine is marked by aromas of ripe blackberries, blueberries and anise. It's full bodied and plump but balanced by crisp acidity and a firm, tannic finish. An easy-drinking but classic Côtes du Rhône, it has just a hint of mineral intensity. Enjoy now–2021.
This full-bodied wine is delicious, layered, complex and well balanced. It is compelling from the first whiff of melon and fig to the rich, concentrated palate.

Cedar, currant and plum aromas introduce this wine from skilled winemaker Yiannis Voyatzis. On the palate, it offers structure, elegance and a complex herb-and-olive character that will continue to mellow with age. A wine with finesse and indigenous character.

Black pepper, tobacco and savory meat aromas signal that this wine means business. Its spicy yet elegant and understated black currant and cherry flavors finish with a smoky note. It has good structure and complex character. Definitely an ageable pour.

This fruity, juicy wine offers some well-structured tannins. Aged in wood for 18 months, it is ripe, concentrated and full of black-currant and blueberry flavors. It is a wine with potential; drink from 2022.
This wine proves that even simple Chablis can age well. The intense crispness has diminished to give a wine that has almonds, touches of spice and an edge of honey. Drink now.

Berry and cassis aromas are mildly damp and rubbery, while in the mouth this is chunky, with abrasive tannins. Plum and berry flavors are short and basic, while this is a bit unruly on an edgy finish. This is Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot.
Yellow apple and sweet oak aromas make for a pleasant if not particularly complex aromatic entry to this bottling. Ripe apple and pear meet with sweet buttercream on the palate.

This has aromas evoking medicinal herb and adhesive bandage that follow over to the palate along with citrus zest, powdered sage and bitter walnut. Vigorous bubbles and racy acidity provide the lively backdrop.
This single-vineyard Bulgarian Merlot has aromas of cotton candy, ripe cherry and fruits of the woods. In the mouth, there are flavors of ripe cherry, black berry and cassis.

From one of New Zealand's celebrated vintages, this Pinot should be showing some age but it still feels pretty youthful. There are notes of rich, ripe cherry, cola, black pepper and a woody, cedary spice. The palate is plush and satiny, and here its age shows a touch with fruit heading more into the dried spectrum than fresh. It finishes a little on the woody side. Overall it's lacking in some of the complexity and balance one would hope for by this stage.

This wine's jammy black plum and berry aromas contain an oaky whiff of milk chocolate. It's saturated and plump, with blackberry, blueberry and cassis flavors. Chocolate and licorice notes show on the woody finish. Drink through 2030.

This wine is both rich and soft. It combines the ripeness of red-fruit flavors and a creamy texture with a crisp edge of citrus acidity. A tight tannic edge gives it shape, adds to its richness and provides an intense, long-lasting afertaste. Drink now.

Pristine, primary lemon and lime flavors are bracing and taut in this penetrating dry Riesling. The midpalate builds in texture and concentration, filling the mouth with layers of waxy citrus. Earthy minerality and a lingering murmur of grapefruit zest marks the finish.

Blackberry, thyme, anise, maple and a prominent hickory smoke show on the nose of this blend. That smoke extends throughout the firmly structured palate, giving savory depth to flavors of boysenberry paste, pound cake and vanilla. Slick acidity carries it all deep into the finish.

From one of the country's first bicoastal wineries, the Virginia-cum-California is off to a strong start with this wine from John Sebastiano and La Rinconada vineyards. Aromas of lemon curd, sweet cream and lime pith are soft yet attention-grabbing. The palate is clean, crisp and tightly woven with tangy citrus flavors and great textural grip.

This wine comes from a small vineyard in Wildcat Canyon, which is located in the hills of the East Bay. Aromas of mulberry, purple flowers, new leather, curry and cardamom lead into a palate of roasted tomato jam and chai spice.

Soft, lemony acidity lends a sunny feel to crisp yellow apple and pear flavors here. Full bodied yet fresh, it's a thirst-quenching dry wine accented by white blossom and almond hints. Enjoy now–2020.
Fruity, crisp and with a tight texture, this is a concentrated wine. Piles of acidity, crisp grapefruit and lemon, and a strongly zesty character join in this delicious wine that is ready to drink.

This old-vine wine is an unusually rich style of rosé, soft, creamy-textured and generously fruity. The acidity is there although without crispness, so that the wine has intensity, caramel flavors and a touch of pepper at the end. Drink from late 2018.

This opens with red plum, underbrush and violet aromas. The easygoing palate offers black cherry and star anise flavors, with a touch of thyme and supple tannins. It's made to be drunk young, so enjoy soon.

This is a new offering from the winery. Almost all varietal with just a splash of Cabernet Franc (3%) coming from Quintessence and Red Willow vineyards, the aromas of toast, spice, cedar, black raspberry and dried herb aren't entirely revealing. The palate seems a bit linear and wound up. Perhaps some time will flesh it out?

Bold sandalwood and smoke notes perfume crisp lemon, white grapefruit and red apple in this full-bodied dry wine. It's concentrated yet vibrantly balanced, with lingering tones of white blossom and chalk.

Light raspberry and vanilla-cookie aromas are yeasty and simple. In the mouth, this light-pink rosé sparkler is wide and unfocused, but just fresh enough. Popsicle-like red-fruit and melon flavors finish with salt and grapefruit notes.

The aromas pop, with notes of blueberry, orange peel, flower, smoked meat and Dimetapp cough syrup. The palate is light but chock-full of mesquite flavors. Blueberry-pie notes linger on the finish. It doesn't all work.

This Pinot is more black-fruited in nature, offering abundant tones of fresh blackberry, boysenberry and cherry on the nose and mouth. Medium in weight, the ripe fruit flavors lend a plushness to the palate that is structured by moderate tannins. It closes with sweet impressions of mocha and cocoa.

Weighty aromas of slightly stale citrus and stone fruits are a harbinger of what's coming, namely a palate that's stuck in stop-motion and melony flavors that are nonspecific and ordinary. A flat finish with yeasty notes doesn't bode well for this lasting past 2018.
This wine is flabby and full-bodied, with ripe flavors of green olive and apple. There's a lingering sweetness to the finish.
This attractively soft and creamy wine has lively fruits and plenty of acidity. Green-plum and lemon-juice flavors are right up front, giving a bright wine that is ready to drink.

A creamy texture, buttery aromas and subtle ginger flavor make this wine from Schramsberg generous, complex and easy to love. Bosc pear, white peach, powdered ginger and cinnamon all combine for good complexity and concentration. Chardonnay leads the blend 68% to 32% Pinot Noir.

This blend of Petit Manseng, Gros Manseng and Petit Courbu is dry in style yet displays a rich honeyed character. Touches of toast, spice and tannins come from the wood aging. The palate is intense, packed with juicy acidity and ripe white and yellow fruits. Drink from 2020.

Something savory and soy-like creeps into the red hedgerow fruit on the nose of this pale-pink sparkler. The palate comes in with mouth-filling strawberry fruit and that same wonderful savoriness. There is pepper and ample lemon freshness. The finish resonates and spells pleasure, spice and refreshment.

This blend of 72% Malbec and 28% Cabernet Sauvignon is black as night. Inky oaky aromas of blackberry, graphite, coffee and wood smoke suggest an old-fashioned Mendoza bruiser. No surprise that this is chunky and jammy on the palate. Ripe black-fruit flavors include notes of toasted oak and licorice in front of a lush, ripe and toasty finish. While an excellent wine, any fault lies in how fleshy, heavy and soft this is. Drink now.

Balanced sweetness is at the heart of this wine, a blend of 71% Flora with 16% Pinot Noir and 13% Chardonnay. Richly layered flavors of peach and vanilla complement a lingering effervescence that will work beautifully with spicy foods.

This classy wine offers a mix of spice rack and black cherry aromas, with rich plum, earth and rhubarb flavors. There is balance between ripeness of fruit and tension from the tannins and acidity. It stands on it own as a beautifully complex but not heavy wine.

This wine's oily citrus aromas are not what you'd call refined. Its white grapefruit and bitter orange flavors are braced by modest acidity. On the finish, it resolves itself with a citrus peel-like note.

This is one quarter each Sauvignon Blanc, Muscat, Verdejo and Chardonnay—a blend you're not likely to find elsewhere. Its mix of tropical and floral aromas comes with a cheesy-smelling overlay. In the mouth, it's highly acidic, with sour and salty flavors.
This is a friendly, easy-drinking white that offers light aromas and flavors of green plum, orange peel and melon rind. Ample acidity keeps it brisk and clean through the close. Drink up.
This older vintage white has a salty briny nose and a disjointed sensibility of tart lemon on the palate, becoming somewhat heavy on the palate amidst its ultimate leanness.
This Nero d'Avola opens with restrained aromas of dark fruit and baking spice. The aromas carry over to the simple palate along with smooth tannins and a touch of black pepper. Drink soon.
This wine smells like pizza—all yeasty, bready aromas with tomato and herb notes. It lacks structure on the palate, tasting salty, with nonspecific citrus flavors and a bitter finish.

This big wine is so full of jammy fruit flavors and laced with such firm tannins that it's almost chewy. It has bold ripe fruit aromas like blackberries, rich and concentrated fruit flavors that are deep and focused, and a great structure of tannins and good acidity that make it lip-smacking to taste.

Produced by the winemaking team of Château la Dominique in Saint-Émilion, this bijou production wine is richly endowed both with tannins and black fruits. It has a perfumed touch as well as full, generous berry flavors and succulent acidity. Drink from 2022.

Lush dried berry and black cherry flavors are muted by darker tones of dried earth, bramble and thyme in this Grenache-dominant blend. It's pristinely fruity and plump, but savory and structured, too. The finish is extended by fine, persistent tannins. Enjoyable now but should develop complexity through 2028.

Muscular and commanding, this bold, voluminous wine offers concentrated but pristine blueberry and plum flavors. It's creamy and expansive on the palate, its curves framed by soft, sinewy tannins and yielding acidity. Drink now–2026.

The Bois des Mourres shares an identical grape blend with the producer's other Gigondas bottling, Les Mourres. Both are plush with black fruit and share a familiar perfume of dried mint, thyme and earth. Yet there's a lift of minerality and briskness of acidity that differentiates this cuvée, as well as hints of anise and spice that mark the finish. It's a concentrated, boldly structured wine to enjoy now–2026.

This dense, structured wine has a great future. It comes from a vineyard on the southern slopes of the town of Nuits-St.-Georges, giving a full, rich wine, with black fruits that will soften into the generous tannins. The wine does need to age, and should be drinkable from 2023.
designation: Domaine des Perdrix Aux Perdrix Premier Cru

description: This rich blend brings out the sunny character of the Alentejo, showing up in warm textures and ripe black fruit. Wood aging and swathes of generous fruitiness have produced a full-bodied wine ready to drink from 2019.
Honey, pear crushed stone and nut aromas follow over to the crisp structured palate along with a tangy saline note. Savory and elegant, it has good body and nice length.

Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this boasts earthy aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and leather. The savory palate delivers Marasca cherry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2023.

A first for Lange, this 75% Pinot Noir and 25% Chardonnay bubbly is elegant and bone dry, with a pleasant earthy character that suggests loess and chalk. The fruit flavors are dried apple, gooseberry and grapefruit, with first-rate length and finesse.
designation: Mia Mousseux Méthode Champenoise Brut Rosé

description: Concentrated black plum and slightly sour blueberry aromas met with dried earth and leather on the nose of this wine. The palate is dense and heavily weighted, with an acidity that slowly rises through the soft tannins, carrying flavors of dark fruit and peppery spice.

A good pét-nat combines funk, foam and fun with tart fruit and a full body, and this succeeds on all fronts. Cloudy in the glass, this shows aromas of watermelon soda, strawberry, cherry Jolly Rancher and yeast. Albeit focused on primary flavors, the palate is tart with raspberry candy and sour bubblegum, offering quite a voluptuous mouthfeel.

Racy streaks of lemon and white grapefruit are accented by layers of crushed salt and mineral in this exceptionally easy-drinking Kabinett. Just a shade off dry, it's a thirst-quenching Riesling to enjoy now–2023.

A touch of violet in the aroma is about the only delicate thing in this deeply colored, intense and tannic wine. It shows a spicy oak influence, and has the varietal's usual inky hue, concentrated black-pepper and blackberry flavors and strong but well-integrated tannins. Best after 2023.

Sourced from a vineyard planted in 1983, this displays ripe black fruits, silky tannins and enough acidity to balance out the finish. It spent 10 months in half new French oak. Though not especially big or ripe, it's balanced and lively and shows some interesting texture.

Rich cherry fruit is punctuated with pungent, slightly bitter phenolics, sending streaks of herb and earth under well-ripened fruit flavors. The ample supporting acidity leaves a trail of citrus through the finish.

Despite the steep 15.5% alcohol that adds some heat, this blend has a lot to offer. On the nose, ripe red currant and cranberry fruit mingles with more savory, earthy characters of green olive, tobacco and eucalyptus. The palate is grainy in textured, with a strong savory current propelled by soft, supple tannins and bright acidity.

This wine is big and bold yet still easy to drink. It has oodles of black fruit aromas, dense fruit flavors and generous dashes of spicy, smoky oak. The texture is firm enough to offer balance, yet is silky enough to remain enjoyable.

Aromas of pressed Spanish broom, citrus zest and Mediterranean brush lead the nose. On the elegant, structured palate, a mineral note energizes white peach, baked apple, toasted almond and lemon. Drink through 2022.

Juicy, sun-kissed pineapple and pear flavors are richly concentrated in this dry, full-bodied white. It's soft in acidity but subtle notes of tangerine and lemon add freshness. The finish is moderately long, lingering on cooling tones of crushed mineral and integrated notes of nut and spice.

Peppery and briary in brambly black fruit, this wine is varietal in all the best ways: complex, thick, concentrated and earthy. The sweet compost and wild strawberry elements are dipped in lingering aromatics of violet and rose.

This wine's rounded, toasted vanilla note promises creaminess from the start. The palate lives up to this billing, with ripe pear fruit enveloped in vanilla creaminess. It's light, dry and fruity but also smooth and fresh. The finish is long and zesty.

Concentrated ripe fruit flavors are well matched by spicy oak accents in this full-bodied firmly tannic wine. It has a darker than usual color—a combination of raspberry and black cherry flavors—and a gripping, mouth-filling texture.

This wine from Mendocino's Thornhill family offers a classic example of the variety. It shows tones of black cherry, wet earth and leather, framed in firm tannins and touches of sophisticated oak without being too full bodied.

Juicy watermelon and strawberry flavors are crisp and spry in this full-bodied yet delicately concentrated rosé. Dry and vibrantly mineral, it's a particularly refreshing poolside beverage for hot summer months.
Dark chocolate and spice notes accent roasted plum and cherry flavors in this fruity, forward red. It's full bodied and easy-drinking, balanced by crisp acidity and chalky tannins.

A riper hint, almost a touch of apricot, joins the pear fruit on the nose. The palate is just as fruit-driven, again in that lemony fresh apricot way, with a slight creaminess. The body is light and dry.

Leather, underbrush and dark-skinned berry aromas lead the nose of this wine. The easy-drinking palate doles out black cherry jam, star anise and white pepper hints alongside rounded tannins. Drink through 2020.
Subtle yellow flower and citrus aromas emerge from this wine. The rich palate shows ripe white peach, juicy pineapple and chamomile notes. Enjoy over the next few years.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

description: This wine's oak and butterscotch aromas carry over to the full-bodied palate, along with coffee, dried apricot and dried pineapple notes. The warmth of alcohol marks the close. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit richness.

This impressive wine, grown at 3,000 feet, offers deep dark-fruit flavors and hints of dark chocolate carried on a lush rich texture. It's full bodied, very ripe and concentrated, featuring blackberry and boysenberry flavors that flood the palate and linger on the finish.

Made with native grape Carricante, this lovely sparkler offers heady scents of Spanish broom, ripe orchard fruit and Mediterranean scrub. On the fresh, savory palate, notes of tangerine and lemon drop underscore yellow apple and ripe pear set against a refined persistent perlage. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.

Bottled in 2017, this dessert wine is made entirely from Chardonnay and dazzles in lithe layers of apple, pear and melon. With a medium-bodied feel, it shows density around underlying balance and structure.

From the wilds of the appellation and field blended with nearly 16% Petite Sirah and smaller amounts of Carignane and Alicante Bouschet, this wine is rich in red brambly dusty fruit. Demure on the palate at first, it is soft and structured, with a strong taste of strawberry and white pepper on the finish.

Invigorating notes of freshly cut grass, lime and green pepper abound in this crisp yet concentrated Sauvignon Blanc. It's ripe, silky and textural in mouthfeel yet balanced by zesty hits of lime and lemon acidity. Enjoy now through 2022.

This wine has a dark color, fragrant floral and blueberry aromas and a mouth-coating richness that carries jammy blackberry and boysenberry flavors. It is full bodied, moderately tannic and lingers nicely on the finish.
There is a light spritz to this wine with crisp citrus and green-apple flavors and a zesty lime aftertaste. The wine is not quite dry and the touch of sweetness gives a lifted aftertaste. Drink now.
Lightly perfumed, this is a soft, fruity wine. Its crisp texture combines with apples and quince to give a wine that is ready to drink.

Caramel candies, black cherries and oak dust aromas show on the nose of this blend of 50% Grenache and 50% Syrah. A coffee-candy flavor meets with black-cherry and cola flavors on the palate, which finishes with oddly chalky tannins.
Aromas of black currant, cassis and herb lead to off-dry dark-fruit flavors. It's a straightforward quaffer. Drink now.

A pale copper-salmon color, this leads with forward fruit aromas of peach, pineapple and tropical fruit salad. Ample acidic lift helps to keep the palate fresh and vibrant, finishing clean and refreshing.

Lifted scents of black cherry and plum skin start the experience of this Vin de France Pinot from famed Burgundy producer Simonnet-Febvre. It's like crushed velvet in texture, with moderately gripping tannins and fruit-skin flavors that carry through to the medium-length finish.
This is a full-bodied, boldly ripe Cabernet Sauvignon. Soft layers of dark cherry and plum are well integrated and contrasted against dusty crushed rock and toasted oak.
A deep shade of pink, this bottling from Pinot Noir grapes shows very subtle red-fruit aromas on the nose. There is decent texture on the sip, but the flavors are muddled and slightly rusty.

Aromas of ripe blueberry and blackberry mingle with vanilla and pumpkin spice on the nose. The fruit forward palate shows plum and cranberry backed by dried leaves, nutmeg and vanilla. The tannins are dusty yet structured, while the acidity is tied to the berry flavors and weaves in and out. It finishes with a tart berry flavor loaded with cracked pepper and earthy.
Brawny fruit is overwhelmed by smoke and charred oak in this thickly tannic wine that has a jammy core of blackberry and marshmallow flavor.
Pear, butter and vanilla aromas lead to a soft, rich texture and tasty fruit flavors. The wine is medium in weight, low in acidity and easy on the palate.

This is an easygoing, fruity wine that shows sweet-oak aromas, a soft texture and candy-like flavors of cherries and raspberries. The body is medium, tannins are light and it finishes with a sense of sweetness.

Alluring aromas of rose petal, leather and woodland berry meld together in the glass. The juicy, already accessible palate offers red cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and a hint of tobacco. It's balanced, with fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2027.

Berry and cassis aromas are uncompromised and offer a sprinkle of cinnamon and spice. A warm, slightly heavy palate is balanced by tartaric acidity, while flavors of plum and raisin are fully ripe but finish short. Overall, this is a very nice Malbec that comes up a bit short on structure and complexity. Drink through 2021.

This is a taut and bracing wine, with aromas of grapefruit and lime and flavors of lemon and jicama. It's rather light in bodied, but has such a refreshing, almost electric character that it still makes a big impression.

This is a new project from Skip Battle and family, with Patrick Sullivan making the 100%-varietal wine. Elegant and cool climate in nature, it offers exotic complex layers of forest floor, sage, graphite and currant, the tannins elongated and polished. The structure and moderate ripeness show potential for aging. Enjoy best 2024–2029.

Gentle peachiness on the nose is joined by equally gentle notes of rose petal. The palate boosts the ripe and juicy peach notes with medium sweetness which lends intensity and viscosity to the body. This is tempered with a little zesty lemon and tapers to a medium-sweet but fresh finish.

This is a compelling and delicious blend of 54% Grenache Blanc, 21% Viognier, 14% Marsanne, 8% Roussanne and 3% Vermentino from Doug Margerum's new estate property. Crisp Asian pear, apple blossom and stargazer lily aromas lead into a very grippy, tense and chalky palate full of nectarine sorbet, lime rind and tangerine flesh flavors.

From a vineyard farmed by Mark Pasternak on the Marin side of the new Petaluma Gap AVA, this is a perennially beautiful, bone-dry white. Floral, stony and crisp, it offers white peach and apple aromas and flavors, while the acidity is refreshing and integrated.

This is a rich style of Chablis, profiting from the deeper soil of the vineyard. It is full bodied while never losing sight of the essential minerality and crispness of the Chardonnay. The wine is already packed with fruit but needs to age further. Drink from 2021.

Winemaker Katy Wilson's dedication to delicate winemaking is on full display in this tangy acid-driven wine from a beloved coastal site. Pomegranate and citrus underline the fresh, focused fruit aspects complemented by earthy forest floor, turned earth and crushed rock.

Crisp and pure on the nose, this bottling by Mark Adams offers vibrant and fresh aromas of lime sorbet, honeydew and chalk. The palate is very tightly wound, steadily releasing flavors of grapefruit, lime and lemon, zipping with strong acid and chalky texture deep into the finish.

Minty in forest pine and seductively silky, this wine is wickedly sauvage and complex, offering delicately layered flavors of wild strawberry, black tea and crushed rock. The tannins are supportive and supple.
This wine is ripe with tannins and red-cherry fruits. It has spice from wood aging and a firm core that will soften. This will be a rich wine, juicy and well balanced. Drink from 2023.
With baked-apple aromas and a plush texture, this is a ripe wine. It is gentle, with a toffee and caramel flavor that balances the acidity. Drink now.

This informal wine has aromas reminiscent of Mediterranean scrub, tilled soil and a whiff of dark spice. The simple palate evokes suggestions of mature black-skinned fruit, vanilla and orange zest alongside round, easy tannins. Drink now.
This is straightforward yet tasty, with jammy red cherry and raspberry fruit that floods the nose and palate. The tannins are soft, but lend just enough textural grip through the close. Enjoy now.

This is surprisingly full and round on the palate for a 100% Pinot Noir-based rosé, though the bouquet offers pretty aromas of apople blossom, peach and watermelon rind. Overall, it's a fruit-forward pour that's best enjoyed now.
This Carmenère feels hard, with scratchy, savory berry aromas and hints of black olive and smoked meat. Its saucy berry flavors are herbal and peppery yet feel drying and minty on the finish.

This wine's damp earth and raisiny aromas don't suggest a high level of quality. It's jagged on the midpalate but creamy along the edges, with candied and raisinated berry flavors that fall flat on the finish, lacking complexity.

A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this presents mouthwatering aromas of black-skinned berry, chopped herb and cooking spice. The juicy medium-bodied palate offers ripe Marasca cherry, licorice, clove and a hint of vanilla alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2023.

Now ready to drink, this is a big wine, but one that is balanced, stylish even. Great black fruits and licorice and spice flavors are balanced within a framework of generous tannins and acidity. Drink this wine now.

In its home territory of the Dão, Touriga Nacional reveals its wonderful perfumes and takes nourishment from the granite soil to bring out minerality and structure. Although this wine has aged as long as it needs, it is still firm, packed with dense structure as well as fruit. Drink now.

This blend from Dionysus and Stone Tree vineyards offers ripe blackberry jam, black plum, nougat and barrel spice aromas. They're followed by a full-bodied palate rich with velvety tannins. There's no mistaking the warmth of the vintage, though its hedonistic style brings appeal.

This white wine, which comes from the same vineyard region as Madiran's red Tannat, is crisp while ripe. Its blend of the two Manseng grapes offers hints of apricot and honey, even though the wine is dry. Weight at the end gives final dense richness. Drink the wine now.

This well-balanced wine is ripe with black fruits and soft with rounded tannins. It has a smoky, perfumed character along with touches of eucalyptus from the oak aging. The wine is immediately attractive, generous and ready to drink.

This wine is pretty, fresh and toasty all at once. It opens with aromas of hazelnut brittle, toasted challah and grilled red apple, all of which carry through to the medium-weight palate alongside additional flavors of pie crust and peach pit. Voluptuous in feel, the rich tones are balanced by medium carbonation and bright orange- and lime-flecked acidity.
designation: Christina Limited Release Méthode Cap Classique Brut

description: This Chardonnay-based wine is crisp and mineral driven, yet balanced by a softer texture that will develop as the wine matures. Attractive fruitiness contrasts with the bright acidity and tangy aftertaste.

Aromas of honey and pears are marked by spice, cashew and hops in this deep gold Grauburgunder, or Pinot Gris. The palate is intensely fruity, almost tropical, boasting notes of pineapple and melon, but balanced by a deep mineral undertone and crisp acidity. The finish is moderate in length but edged by a delicate grip of tannins.

Briary berry aromas are spicy but also earthy and a bit stewed. A chewy dense palate is more chunky than structured, while this tastes of charred wood and baked berry fruits. Given that 2012 was a very warm year, this is in good shape. Drink through 2022.

This young wine needs a bit more time to soften up the stiff tannins and meld its components. At the moment it lacks grace, though it has interesting flavors of black cherry, chocolate and graphite. Aging in roughly one-quarter new French oak brings up baking spices through the finish.

Made from 55-year-old vines in relatively small quantities, Angove's top wine is a classic South Aussie. It oozes ultraripe fruits that veer into blackberry jam territory at the moment. Behind all that fruit peeks cola, mocha and peppery spice. The palate is equally plush-fruited and rich, with structured tannins that are balanced by a good lick of acidity.
This opens with white peach, chamomile and sage hints. The juicy palate doles out yellow peach, apricot and tangerine zest notes alongside bright acidity. Drink through 2021.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

description: Exuberant pear drop dominates the nose. The palate adds lovely zesty lemon notes on a rather slender, light, dry and easy body. The finish reveals some savory yeastiness.

A very rocky expression of the grape, this bottling shows mud, clay and just a hint of dark red fruit on the nose. Dark cherry starts the sip alongside cola spice, but it's the texture and structure that take center stage, with thick tannins and strong grip. A smoky meat character shows on the finish.

This wine's intense honeysuckle, jasmine and ripe green apple aromas leap out of the glass. The green apple note carries over to the palate, along with honeydew melon and citrus. Fresh acidity and a hint of mineral lift the fruity flavors.

Delicate aromas reminiscent of toasted oak, tomato vines and yellow wildflowers take shape in the glass. The full-bodied palate doles out candied citrus zest, grapefruit, vanilla and pineapple notes set against fresh acidity. A bitter almond note lingers on the close, as does some alcoholic warmth.
This wine has a delicious, appetizing, tart cherry character supported by firm tannins and good acidity, so it's lively on the palate. Touches of baking spices add to the vivid strawberry flavors.

Grapey, rich and ripe, this very fruit-forward but full-bodied wine from one of the Sierra Foothills' best sub-appellations is drenched in black fruit from the aroma through the finish. Hints of dark chocolate and oak spices chime in as the almost thick and lightly tannic texture floods the palate.

This blend from Seven Hills (56%), Octave (24%), Pepper Bridge (14%) and Yellow Jacket Vineyards offers coffee bean, toast, fresh herb, flower, orange peel, blackberry and black cherry aromas followed by well-balanced fruit and barrel flavors that stretch out on the finish. The tannins bring some grip. Best after 2022.

A smoky edge of reduction still hangs over this wine, but underneath it, the unmistakeable freshness of bright lemon peeks through. This lemon streak also informs the concentrated, taut palate. The finish is dry, juicy and lemony.

Aromas of oak-driven spice, toasted nut and mature exotic fruit take shape in the glass. The aromas glide over to the round full-bodied palate along with baked yellow apple, candied orange zest and dried herb. A hint of coffee lingers on the close.

A faint hint of lemon oil perfumes the nose of this wine. The palate presents tart apple and ripe lemon flavors in a juicy, light-bodied and easy package. It goes down far too easily with its lemony charm and dry finish.

A 100% varietal wine given 26 months in new French oak, this is a well-integrated richly concentrated showcase for the appellation. It is impressive in cinnamon, black pepper and jammy black cherry and plum.

This unusual blend doesn't clearly showcase any of its three varieties: Pinot Gris, Riesling and Chardonnay. Rather, it is a fruity combo of ripe tropical and citrus fruits. There seems to be a good dose of sulfur as well, which is masking some of the more subtle aromas and flavors. The palate is oily in texture yet nicely balanced by zingy acidity, more plush fruit and a slightly herbal finish.
This has a wealth of cherry cola flavor that brushes up against varietal black currant and cedar. It takes on a lush brawny ripeness that overwhelms and opts for fruit flavor over structure.
This Bulgarian Chardonnay has aromas of lemon lime zest and apple blossoms. In the mouth, there are flavors of canned peaches and apricots with a touch of vanilla bean in the soft finish.
This wine has aromas of lemon rind, peach blossom and tropical fruits. It is aged for six months in oak barrels and has flavors of pineapple and peach with a soft finish.

A bit more subtle than some of its more bombastic counterparts, this wine shows notes of grapefruit, guava and citrus. It's crisp in feel, but balanced by plenty of ripe fruit flavors on the palate. A zippy grapefruity note rings on the finish.
Floral and quite cherry-berry in fruity flavor, this wine has mild structure and generous tannin, with a midpalate bursting in earthy oak.

Subtle and complex rather than simply fruity, this medium-bodied wine brings aromas of sunbaked earth, cedar and leather along with flavors like sour cherry, beef broth and anise that are compelling to taste. The texture is firm, moderately tannic and provides just enough tension so that the flavors seem to release slowly onto the taste buds.

Moderate fruit flavors, light spices and a firm texture make this medium-bodied wine appetizing and food-friendly. Made from 86% Mourvèdre grapes plus Grenache and Syrah, it's a tenor rather than a baritone and gives a brilliant performance.

In recent vintages, this Limarí wine has been flexing its muscles as one of Chile's best Syrahs. It's big on the nose, which is loaded with cassis, blackberry, spice and leather notes. The palate is full bodied and saturated with lively berry and oak flavors that persist on the finish, keeping the energy level high. Drink now–2022.

Ripe luscious grapefruit and gooseberry flavors pulsate from the core of this dry medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. While pristinely fruity, it's a nuanced wine marked by invigorating hits of lime, bell pepper and crushed stone. The finish is lean and revitalizing. Drink now through 2022.

This blend of 60% Cabernet Franc from The Rocks and 40% Merlot from Canoe Ridge Vineyard enchants with its complex medley of fresh ground herb, sliced green pepper, moist earth, mineral and cherry aromas. There's dazzling texture and purity to its graceful fruit and savory flavors that carry deep into the finish. Delicious stuff.

This wine is half Merlot, with the balance Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Well-delineated notes of dried herb, raspberry, black cherry, dried flower, graphite and anise mark the nose. The palate bursts with fresh fruit and earth flavors that are at once textured, pure, polished and light on their feet. A long, fruit-filled finish caps it off. It's a gorgeous, nuanced wine that way over-delivers for the price.

Ripe but restrained black-plum and mulberry notes are accented by a whiff of violet perfume in this wine. It's full bodied and juicy, with enticing hints of mushroom and forest floor that lend complexity to the midpalate. The finish is elegant, velvety and firm. It should improve now through 2025.

Cranberry, hibiscus, sandy mud and pepper aromas show on the nose of this bottling from Morgantini Vineyard, which is rather light in color. It's soft and elegant on the sip, with well-integrated flavors of oregano, rose petals, bergamot, black raspberry and elderflower.

Relatively light in color, this reserve bottling from Delfina's Vineyard offers tangy red plum, sagebrush, bay leaf and rust aromas on the nose. The palate is awash in herbs, from thyme to oregano, set against a red-currant-reduction sauce and light savory flavors of roasted pork.

Ripe berry aromas are at the precipice of jammy. A saturated palate is not overly deep, so this Garnacha-Graciano exhibits mostly a surface-level character. Blackberry flavors are chocolaty and toasty prior to a drumming finish. For a wine with significant Graciano, a grape prone to showing nothing but high acidity, this is a success and a cool find. Drink from 2019–2035.

The Douro gives its power, structure and dark tannins to this intense wine. Black-currant fruits are layered with minerality and a dense texture. This is a wine for aging, rich and powerful. Drink from 2020.

There are strong aromas of turned earth, wet loam, bay leaf, tobacco leaves and black olive tapenade on the nose of this recent library release from the winery that sits atop the Santa Cruz Mountains above Silicon Valley. It's thick on the palate with Indian and Mexican spices (from coriander to curry), with hints of powdered cocoa and tobacco as well. The acid and structure remain solid.

This Syrah-dominate blend smells rooty and medicinal, like licorice and black cherry syrup, sprinkled with white pepper. The palate starts off with a bright berry flavor but quickly softens into baked raspberry, vanilla, licorice and woody tannins. Oak kicks off the finish, while the tannins lend a crushed velvet texture, ending on a dry, muddled black plum note.

A rather round nose offers heady aromas of honey, dried apricot and hazelnut. The palate has some weight, but is well balanced by acidity and shows notes of apple juice, baking spice and more hazelnuts.
Earthy berry aromas are a bit damp and inexact. A tough rubbery palate is slightly collapsed, while this tastes of salty plum and raspberry. Rubbery tannins toughen up an intense finish.

Dainty and soft in nature, this opens with faint floral notes of peony and sweet pea that are supported by fruity accents of strawberry hull and crisp red currant. It's lightweight and soft in texture, with a lingering note of orange zest on the close.
Produced mainly from Touriga Nacional and the local Castelão grape, this is a soft, red-berry-flavored wine. With an attractive touch of acidity to give it a lift, it is ready to drink.
This juicy, fruity wine is filled with red-berry flavors and bright acidity, with just a light touch of tannins. It is an open wine, just right for a barbecue. Drink now.

Rich and brooding with intensely perfumed oak, this is a layered white made from grapes grown throughout the appellation. It delivers medium-bodied weight and grip, with lush apple and gingersnap flavors.

Smooth and seductive, this offers aromas of wild berry, blue flower, dark spice, crushed rock and a whiff of Mediterranean brush. The polished, savory palate doles out juicy Morello cherry, strawberry, star anise and wild herb. Lithe tannins provide seamless support while bright acidity lends balance. Drink 2021–2028.

This is a bold, ripe and rich wine that leads with saturated aromas of black fruits. On the palate, it feels broad, gentle and velvety as fine-grained tannins support flavors of blueberry, cocoa and black pepper. Excellent to drink now, it has the requisite tannins, acidity and depth for aging. Best after 2023.

From old vines in the heart of the Sonoma Valley, this is an earthy, savory and impeccably structured wine. Lavender, rose and cedar all play a role in contributing complexity and depth to this beautiful wine.

Aromas of pipe tobacco, ripe dark-skinned fruit, nutmeg and vanilla lead the way. The concentrated, polished palate offers prune, fig, mocha and licorice alongside polished, velvety tannins. Drink through 2028.

One of the winery's single-block series, this focused bottling features clone 777 and delivers aromas of red cherry, vanilla, licorice and pine oil on the nose. The texture is quite grippy, and the palate offers flavors of roasted cranberry, anise, sumac and allspice.
This wine comes from the upper Lima Valley, in the heart of the Vinho Verde region. It's fruity, fragrant and off dry, with fine citrus and pear flavors. Drink now.
This bright, lively blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto is fruity and easy, packed with lemon and green apple flavors. It's already delicious to drink
This phenolic Verdejo has bell pepper, cactus and lean citrus aromas. On the palate, it's flabby and wayward, with generic citrus and pepper flavors and low acidity.
Softly sweet and very fruity, this light-pink wine is simple and clean. It should appeal especially to new wine drinkers.

A simple weeknight wine that ticks the New World red box with notes of ripe berries, cocoa powder and slightly sweet, sweaty oak. That sweet oak is particularly prominent on the palate, and all that is really there to balance it is more ripe fruit.
This wine carries aromas of banana and melon. It has a tight palate, with flavors of nuts, oak and stone fruit pits. On the finish, distant hints of lemon and orange lightly register.

Tightly wound layers of woody cassis, cherry and cedar combine nicely around a robust midpalate in this hearty full-bodied wine, pronounced in tannin and oak. A floral finish of violet sparks a bright, lingering finish.

Mixed with small amounts of Syrah and Petite Sirah, this is aged in both French and American oak, and it shows a richly woven palate of grainy leather, tobacco and cedar. The ripe succulent fruit is jammy in blackberry and dark chocolate.

A dark purple color and lush blackberry, cassis and woodspice aromas open this full-bodied Tannat. Toasty oak graces its core blackberry flavors, creating coffee and chocolate notes. On the finish, it's peppery, full and textured. Drink through 2020.

This wine offers plenty of structured tannins that are paralleled by the succulent black fruits. The texture is dusty, the tannins dry but very much integrated with the fruit. This wine could be drunk young, say from 2019, but will also age. Drink ideally from 2022.
This is a beautiful wine, impressively bringing out the rich, creamy, yellow- and white-fruit flavors of Encruzado. A great value, it's ripe, lightly herbal and ready to drink.

This well-balanced wine from high-elevation Lake County has everything in the right proportions: fresh herb and citrus aromas, lip-smacking, crisp fruit flavors, a generous texture and lingering finish.
Citrus, Spanish broom and Mediterranean brush aromas lead the way on this tangy white. The juicy palate offers ripe yellow apple, green melon and a hint of saline alongside fresh acidity.

A smoky aroma shows a surprising amount of wood aging for a Vintage Port that has to be bottled after two years. But the contrast with the fine black fruits is good, giving a wine that just needs time to come together. So drink from 2027.

Based in Chamery on the Montagne de Reims, this producer makes deliciously ripe, balanced wines. This rosé with its hints of red fruits and tannin is a good example, rich while at the same time full of crisp acidity and with a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Brut Rosé

description: Made from 75% Chardonnay and 25% Pinot Noir, this spends 12 months on its lees and then 16 months in bottle before release. It's surprisingly brisk and precise in character, with laser-beam notes of lime and green apple that are coupled with richer tones of rose petal and peach pit. The palate is zippy, with a full but aggressive mousse, high acidity and a mouthwatering finish.

Intriguing mineral, savory and figgy aromas announce that this is not an average wine. The flavors are equally complex but well harmonized, blending fruity and earthy elements and supported by good acidity and a nice richness in texture.

Richly endowed, this full, perfumed wine celebrates 20 years since this estate first bottled wine. With ripe apples balanced by fine citrus acidity, the wine is both rich and tensely crisp. Drink from 2019.

A soft pink color, this bottling from the Riboli family's new Stefano Vineyard shows watermelon, lime rinds and orange on the nose. It's clean and crisp on the palate with lime, strawberry and a fresh acidity.
Ripe yellow pear on the nose is also apparent on the very easy light juicy palate. The slightly dilute palate benefits from tangy citrus on the dry finish.

Rust and wet gravel aromas meet with rhubarb, macerated strawberry and carnations on the nose of this bottling, a rare Pinot Noir from Paso Robles. The rusty character extends to the palate, which it gains rose hip, dried mint, cranberry and vanilla flavors. The acid is bright throughout.

Tart red fruit tones are peppered with a leafy, green tobacco note on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is round and soft, with no hard edges, letting the fleshy red plum and cranberry-skin flavors do all the talking.

A blend of 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Noir, this méthode Champenoise is dry and fruity, with a strong aroma of strawberry on the nose. Approachable and fresh, it adds a taste of tangerine to continuing flavors of strawberry and peach.

Pale salmon in color, aromas of Golden Delicious apple, strawberry, white flowers and wet concrete waft from the glass. The palate echoes the nose, adding Asian pear, white peach, a squeeze of lime and a mineral-driven vein of acidity. The finish is light and clean, with delicate flavors of pear and watermelon juice.

A 100% varietal wine given 26 months in new French oak, this is a well-integrated richly concentrated showcase for the appellation. It is impressive in cinnamon, black pepper and jammy black cherry and plum.

Loads of yellow peach, lemon pith and a kiss of wood show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is ripe yet restrained enough, offering nectarine and lemon flavors, set against a tight structure and zesty acid.

This blend of 75% Bien Nacido Vineyard and 25% Sierra Madre offers sea salt, lemon rind, honeysuckle extract and a hint of blanched almonds on the nose. There is fresh and tightly wound citrus on the tip of the palate, and then it warms up toward almond and orange-cookie flavors.

Made with dried Verduzzo grapes, this opens with aromas of acacia honey, ripe Golden Delicious apple and apricot jam that carry over to the juicy palate along with a note of marron glacé. It has a long persistent finish.

This wine's nose offers a subtle hint of moss but nothing more. On the palate, yeasty, salty flavors appear alongside some pithy citrus zest notes. It's taut, textured and fresh, with a lovely dry finish.

Made entirely with Aglianico, this savory sparkler offers aromas of bread crust, toasted nut, Mediterranean scrub and wild berry. It's tangy, with white-peach, wild cherry, ginger and citrus-zest flavors set against bright acidity. A soft perlage lends finesse.
Light, dry white fruit aromas come with a hint of green. A plump, inexact palate is foamy, while this tastes of green melon with mild bitterness. For a standard brut Cava, this is good.

Common aromas of grape skins, cantaloupe and papaya are mostly clean and legit. The palate, while showing some acidic tang, is a bit grabby and short on substance, while this Garnacha Rosado tastes of nectarine but little more. A soft finish that turns bready indicates a wine in decline, so drink immediately.
Very extracted aromas of red currants and all spice show on the ripe nose of this bottling. Muddled plums and berries meet with spice cake on the rich palate.
Mild aromas of melon and apple are clean and lead to a fresh palate with light spice and green herb flavors. This is fresh, peppy and proper, with pleasantries but nothing complex or serious.
This big and rather tart wine has a green streak in the piney, woody aromas and flavors that accompany red-cherry and sour-cherry notes.

This opens with aromas of medicinal herb, walnut and a whiff of adhesive bandage that follow over to the palate along with toast, bread crust, yellow apple and citrus. Racy acidity and vivacious bubbles provide the background.

Tempting toast and fresh bread aromas lead to layers of lemon, butter, crisp apple and baking-spice flavors in this nicely complex, compact and well-balanced wine from a three-year-old urban winery in Berkeley. It is medium bodied, feels lively but smooth on the palate and has aged-on-the-lees complexity and richness.

This elegant blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay is the top Champagne from this Marne Valley producer. It has a good balance between its acidity and zesty texture. The mineral character along with citrus fruit give this still-young wine aging potential. Drink from 2020.

This is a beautifully blended 63% Petite Sirah, 32% Zinfandel and 5% Syrah from one estate block. Earthy, it offers soft, supple layers of blueberry, blackberry and cocoa powder, the tannins present, supportive and dusty. The finish explores the garrigue and black pepper side of the Rhône grapes.

Concentrated notes of tangerine, yellow apple and pineapple abound in this ripe and approachable yet elegant Riesling. While dry and light bodied, it's a penetrating wine with a leesy richness on the midpalate. Zesty acidity and a lean, mineral finish lend elegance.

While juicy white-grapefruit and lemon flavors are prominent here, this dry Riesling is a more a showcase of its brilliant mineral tones. Medium-bodied in style, it's punchy and citrusy yet lavish and silky, finishing on lingering layers of crushed river rocks, slate and zesty lime pith.

With a strong tone of oak and tar on the nose, this vineyard-designate wine offers well-integrated power and intensity. Fresh red currant greets the palate within a framework of concentrated depth and extraction, with a lasting finish.

Intense aromas of black currant, violets and white pepper make for an extremely purple expression on the nose of this bottling by the family-owned winery. Snappy black-plum and boysenberry flavors are lifted by peppercorns and crushed herbs on the palate, which offers both tart and ripe elements for a dynamic experience.

Enticing scents of Spanish broom, citrus blossom, white stone fruit and Mediterranean herb lift out of the glass. The juicy, savory palate delivers lemon zest, pastry dough, ripe yellow apple and pear alongside fresh acidity. A tangy mineral note gives it a savory, almost salty finish. It's everything an Etna white should be: elegant, fresh and delicious.

Pronounced aromas of red berry, rose, flint and smoke lead the nose on this focused, vibrant red. It's elegantly structured, offering crushed strawberry, sour cherry, star anise, white pepper and iron. Taut, polished tannins and bright acidity provide support and finesse. Savory and ready now, it also has good mid-term aging potential. Drink through 2024.

Heady, inviting aromas of wild herb, field flower and white stone fruit lift from the glass along with a whiff of crusty bread. Made with no added dosage, the vibrant, linear palate doles out yellow apple, white peach, lemon rind and mineral alongside bright acidity and a silky mousse. A hint of hazelnut lingers on the smooth, dry finish.

A blend of 70% Syrah and 30% Grenache, this full-bodied red wine offsets Syrah's peppery, vivacious character with the rounded silkiness of Grenache. Mulberry and blackberry flavors are crisply concentrated, but the palate feels creamy and supple. The finish is marked by fine, silky tannins. Already drinks well but should improve through 2025 and hold a few years further.

Deep and concentrated aromas of black plum and red currant meet an earthy core of herbs and forest floor on the nose of this bottling. Fresh and snappy flavors of raspberry and pomegranate are framed by a chalky texture on the palate, where sagebrush and incense flavors also arise.

Pink grapefruit and citrus-scented soap aromas form the opening. On the palate, this is fairly chunky, raw and rough. Orange and grapefruit flavors are average prior to a citric finish with pulpy weight.
The aromas are quite subdued for the variety, with notes of jasmine and peach struggling to get to the surface. It drinks medium sweet with a slight bitter note on the finish.

This blend of 35% Grenache, 20% Syrah, 20% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Mourvèdre is meaty and spicy, reminiscent of cured jerky coupled with irony berry, currant and rhubarb. The medium-weight palate is quick astringent, with lingering fruit-skin flavors that finish dry and grippy.
Cherry compote and extracted red fruit meet with toffee on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely tangy and tart, with pinches of herb, coffee and cocoa adding intrigue.

Lightly tropical as well as herbal, this wine is crisp and bright. Its acidity and fresh kiwi and gooseberry flavors are balanced by a touch of pineapple and topped with intense, young acidity. Drink the wine now.

Yeasty aromas include notes of egg whites and mustard. This feels direct and healthy, but nothing beyond regular. Briny stone-fruit flavors include notes of citrus and spent yeast, while this tastes savory and mustardy on the finish.

An almost leafy, greenish note hovers on the nose, reminiscent of spring meadow and tender green pear. The palate adds a wonderfully fine mousse to this, on the slender light palate. Notions of lime zest and green pear become stronger towards the refreshing finish. This is an elegant, slender and wonderfully bone-dry sparkler.

Warm, full and fruity, this wine offers ripe red berries and a rich, soft texture. It is smooth, with a lightly mineral texture, pepper and good acidity to finish and balance. The wine is ready to drink.

This Grenache-based rosé is one of the best of the year, showing tight aromas of strawberry, pink rose petals and crushed chalk. The palate is framed by an incredible acidic sizzle and chalky grip, carrying expertly subdued flavors of raspberry and red plum.

Brioche and almond flavors meet a sleek, smooth and tightly focused core in this meticulously made white. Apple, pear and lemon meringue provide complexity on the midpalate before finishing crisp and slightly spicy.

A clean shade of yellow hay in the glass, the nose on this bottling is very inviting with aromas of baking croissant, baking soda and lemon peel. The palate combines strong yeast with crushed chalk and clay flavors, proving quite creamy in texture.

Something zesty and fresh is apparent on the nose. On the palate, this zestiness adds zing to the ripe rounded pear notes which are amplified by a little residual sweetness. The interplay of zestiness and ripe, almost luscious fruit provides fun and moreishness.
This salmon colored wine has aromas and flavors of red raspberry and strawberry with a soft, easygoing finish.
Very fruity, lightly sweet and quite mouth coating, this rich wine has jammy aromas and flavors centering around blackberries.

Made entirely with organically grown Nero d'Avola, this informal red opens with aromas of dark berry, blue flower and underbrush. The easygoing palate evokes cherry jam and a hint of star anise alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.

This opens with saucy berry, tomato and game aromas. On the palate, it's chunky and heavy, with candied flavors and little structure. Jammy, lightly herbal black fruit flavors mark the shallow finish.
This is a straightforward medium-bodied red wine that has decent balance, moderate tannins and mostly herbaceous, peppery flavors.
Spice and herb flavors dominate this light-bodied, crisp and dry wine. White-pepper, fennel bulb and lemon flavors make an interesting mix and the mouthfeel is respectably tangy.
Sanguine and crisp in cranberry, currant and violet aromas, this wine is bright, expansive and integrated in oak, with accents of cedar and graphite. The full-bodied ripeness holds its own.

From vineyards in St. Helena, Atlas Peak and Howell Mountain, this is a well-made, relatively restrained wine, smoky and earthy up front. Broadly structured, it features fine highlights of black currant and pencil lead and will work nicely at the table.

Whole cluster fermentation brings this wine's juicy fruit flavors front and center. Like an especially fine Beaujolais, it pushes ripe berry notes into the spotlight and finishes with drying, tea leaf tannins. It was aged 11 months in one quarter new French oak.
An elegant, almost delicate wine, it has floral and cherry-like aromas, delicious cherry and pomegranate flavors and a gentle texture with good acidity and very light tannins.

Light on the nose with hints of cranberry, crushed gravel, wet slate and rose petals, this affordable bottling gives a good sense of minerality at a fair price. There's an herbal background to the bright palate, which offers tart pomegranate and hibiscus flavors.

This wine is clean, crisp and tasty. Aromas of honey, lime peel and rounded mango lead into a palate that's zippy in bright acidity and grippy in structure. Racy mandarin zest, yellow melon and wet stone flavors carry the palate.
Aromas of dark-skinned berry, scorched soil and leather emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers morello cherry, tobacco and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.

The newest vintage from Castle Rock offers a sturdy and flavorful wine without overdoing the oak treatment. Flavors of blackberries, black cherries and mocha make this a great go-to option, rich enough for most Pinot-friendly main courses.

Tight and concentrated, this pure varietal shows strong flavors of vanilla, crème de cassis and purple fruits. It's smooth and highlighted with details of bark and stem. A finishing note of smoky bacon adds further interest.

Subdued aromas evoking baking spice, cedar and dark fruit slowly take shape on this full-bodied red. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2021.
