A ripe rosé with a mix of crisp fruit and a bright texture, this wine has a soft character. It is well balanced, poised between richness and red-currant acidity. The wine is totally ready to drink.

Prune, leather and balsamic aromas appear in the glass. The aromas carry over to the rather tired palate along with dried cherry and a hint of baking spice. Dusty, grainy tannins give it a firm but not very persistent finish. Give the tannins a few more years to soften then drink to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.

Aromas of toasted nut, bread crust and a whiff of candied citrus zest waft out of the glass. On the palate, vigorous bubbles provide the firm setting for yellow apple skin, bitter walnut and a candied note.

Aromas of toasted walnut and moist underbrush lead the nose. The walnut note carries over to the lean palate along with bitter yellow apple skin and a candied note. It has brisk acidity and firm, steely bubbles.
Rustic and hearty in style, this medium-bodied wine has earthy aromas, strong acidity and flavors like peach skin and grapefruit rind.
This opens with aromas of wildflower and orchard fruit. On the simple palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe Bartlett pear and mature yellow apple.
This wine has fresh fruit flavors and a fair share of vanilla and nutmeg from aging with oak. It feels smooth, medium bodied and soft in structure as little tannin comes through.
Basic aromas of black fruit and a dusting of oaky cinnamon lead to a chunky palate with tannins that grab. Saucy plum and oak flavors remain woody on a finish that's rubbery and raw.

The name of this cuvée is Chinese for rich and beautiful, honoring the mother of one of the winery's owners. It's a rich white version of Pinot Noir that moves from a sharply defined crisp apple and citrus fruit into a softer, broader midpalate. It carries hints of cherry pit and a light suggestion of chocolate.

Friendly, fragrant notes of Conference pear have a lemony edge on the nose. They show on the dry but full-fruited body that conveys notions of ripe, yellow pear. There is power here and lovely texture. The finish is dry and long. Drink now–2028.
Aromas of Mediterranean brush, yellow apple, crushed rock and juicy citrus flow over to the bright savory palate along with pear and savory mineral notes. Bright acidity imparts a refreshing finish.

Complexities of spice and salty, smoky mineral persist from nose to finish here, accenting flavors of ripe white peach, tangerine and honeydew. It's a lip-smacking cream-textured kabinett balanced by spine-tingling persistent acidity. It will improve through 2023 and hold further.

Grenache makes up the majority of this blend at 65%, with 15% Syrah and 20% Mourvèdre. Together they offer earthy barnyard, compost and fresh strawberry puree, the body thick and dense in tightly packed tannin. This is delicious and complex.

Roots, stems and dried leaves make for an earthy entry into this estate appellation wine. Wraparound tannins and oak emphasize a gritty, grainy texture marked by robust cherry ripeness and secondary characteristics of black tea and rose.
This wine's green pear scent has an earthy tang. The palate has gentle grass- and lemon-scented freshness. It's light in body and unobtrusive, with a dry, subtly aromatic finish.

Fairly light in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows a great deal of sagebrush and chaparral spice on the nose, which gives depth to the cranberry and turned-earth aromas. The palate is also very earthy and herbal, with crushed thyme, oregano and dried sage peppering the zesty red fruits.

An aromatic, almost floral touch hovers above this wine's red cherry fruit. The palate is light, with a tingling edge of white pepper amid the pure cherry notes. The frame is light, the body sinuous and dry. It's elegant, measured and delicious, with a lovely fresh finish.

Delicate, enticing scents of white spring blossom, crushed herb and ripe orchard fruit take shape on this elegant white. On the savory linear palate, fresh acidity accompanies apple, white peach and tangy citrus while a hint of white almond wraps up the finish.

Ripe cassis aromas push up against prune and raisin. A full palate is bold and generous, but also displaying tartaric acid. Fully oaked blackberry fruit smells a touch cheesy and of vanilla, while this is pudgy and oozing ripeness on the finish.

Deep fruit flavors and full body give this wine a lot to explore. It tastes as if it were drenched in blackberry and raspberry syrup without being literally sweet, has light tannins and acidity so the texture is soft, and enough concentration for a lingering finish.
This opens with toasted oak, mocha and dark berry aromas. The dense palate delivers prune, tobacco and roasted coffee flavors alongside taut, somewhat astringent tannins.

This wine's subtle aromas suggest black-skinned fruit, cedar and leafy underbrush. The straightforward palate offers clove, tobacco and black currant touches alongside solid tannins. Drink through 2021.

This offers classic, intense aromas of guava, fig, lychee, grass and jalapeño, plus a hint of white pepper. There's a welcome textural weight on the palate, balancing crisp acidity and more green vegetal and grass flavors, wrapping up with a long, melon rind finish.

This wine's tilled soil, dark-skinned fruit and mint aromas take shape in the glass. The savory palate offers black plum, star anise and white pepper notes alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.

Rich and buttery all the way through, this full-bodied wine smells like butterscotch and cream, tastes ripe, oaky and full of vanilla, and has butter and fig flavors. The texture is extremely soft and mouthfilling.
This attractive wine has a crisp texture that underlies the citrus and lightly perfumed character. Fruity, light and bright, it is ready to drink.

The nose on this Sauvignon Blanc is very green, offering up eucalyptus, fresh garden herbs and lemon peel. The palate is astringent in feel, leaning on lemon and lime pith with lots of grassiness straight through the finish.

Starting out a bit reduced, the aromas open to reveal notes of berry, herb and orange peel. The fruit flavors are straight down the fairway, if seeming a bit innocuous, with the concentration light with a candied finish.

Crisp while also full of ripe fruit, this bright, lively wine is refreshing and zesty. Lemon, ripe apples and a touch of warmer tropical fruits all come together in this attractive wine. It's ready to drink now.
The aromas come out of the gate seeming a bit reduced, opening to reveal notes of berry and tar. The coffee and berry flavors seem extremely light, trailing on the finish.

Leafy aromas are damp, nutty and not fully clicking. This blend of Garnacha, Merlot and Syrah is hard and tannic, with little to no cushion to the palate. Much like the nose, this is green and earthy tasting, with minty flavors and heat to the finish.
This wine celebrates diversity and is beautifully layered and fresh in a rounded peach tone. Moderate structure gives way to plenty of brioche richness on the palate.

Produced from old vines, this rich, concentrated wine has great weight plus intense black-currant and berry fruits. Big tannins and a ripe structure are part of a bold wine that will age further. Drink from 2019.

Earthy notes of ripe peach on the nose suggest a very full-fruited ripe wine. The palate delivers generously with its medium-sweet notions of bottled peach and ripe pear compote. This is rounded, juicy and generous. The medium-sweet finish is tempered with some citrus freshness and very lasting.

There is a savory hint of saltiness amidst the zesty citrus and green-apple fruit on the nose. The palate comes in with more generous fruit—think melon and juicy pear. Fine fizz bursts gently but persistently, with a lovely lemon freshness. This is a wonderfully balanced, easy, but not facile wine. There is classy balanced fizz, with a dry finish.

A honeysuckle overtone mix with hints of ripe peach and zesty lemon on the nose. The off-dry palate strikes a balance between the poles of juicy, aromatic ripeness and lemon zestiness. This is a real mouthful of ripe peach, mandarin and lemon flavors, always perfumed with that honeysuckle streak. Drink now–2025.

This blend of 28% Malbec, 28% Tannat, 15% Syrah, 15% Petite Sirah and 14% Grenache is very rich on the nose, showing cherry reduction, pepper and licorice aromas. The palate starts off very silky and then stiffens to present well-integrated flavors of black cherry, dried mint and loamy earth.

Beautifully inviting in aromas of baked bread and cherry-berry fruitiness, this is a well-integrated, soft and rich wine that delivers plenty of vibrant flavor and complexity. A note of charred oak provides complexity on the finish.

Rich aromas of blackberry jam and equally concentrated fruit flavors give a lot of enjoyment to this deeply colored, full-bodied wine. It has lots of fine-grained tannins that enrich the texture while nuances of black pepper and boysenberry flood the tongue and linger on the finish.
This rich wine is now fully mature and ready to drink. It has weight and richness as well as strong minerality and acidity. A balanced, spicy wine, it's opulent and fully textured. Drink now.

Juicy blue fruit is wrapped in expansive tannins in this complex, nicely structured, reserve-level wine. Clove, nutmeg and black pepper dot a well-textured palate accented in ample acidity and lovely length and breadth.

Soft in wild blue fruit, black tea and stemmy earth, this wine has a brooding earthiness that's exotic and beguiling. It invites with a perfume of violet and rose as well as coastal salt and crushed rock, mineral components that accent a grainy texture.

Deep ripe fruit flavors give this full-bodied wine a big personality, while moderate tannins and brisk acidity add a nice textural touch. It has plenty of ripe black-fruit aromas and flavors, and light spicy accents like cinnamon and black tea.

Spanish broom, mature yellow stone fruit and a whiff of oak rise out of the glass. The concentrated palate offers candied citrus zest, dried apricot, vanilla and toast while a coffee note backs up the finish.

Spring flower, citrus blossom orchard fruit aromas drift out of the glass along with an enticing whiff of vineyard dust. It's juicy and savory, doling out ripe yellow pear, nectarine and white almond alongside fresh acidity. A hint of chopped herb enhances the finish.

This appellation is sometimes overlooked, but for white wines it is star. This is a ripe, full wine, toasty from wood aging and with rich apricot fruit cut by lemon acidity. It is balanced, full of fruitiness and will be ready to drink from 2019.

A blend of many parcels, this wine brings out the character of Meursault, poised between a crisp, mineral style and something much richer. Wood aging has brought out the riper side of the wine, emphasizing apricots as much as citrus. Drink this sumptuous wine from 2020.

Stainless-steel fermented, this is a red that's ready to drink, blended with small amounts of Syrah and Pinot Noir. Thick, leathery, structured black fruit stars alongside dried herb and earth before a long, juicy finish.

Dark black cherry, hints of thyme and tarragon and a flash of crushed gravel show on the nose of this blend of 34% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Cabernet Franc and 33% Merlot. Firm, upright and nearly sticky with tannins, the palate shows stewed plum and mulling-spice flavors. Needs a bit more time to reach its prime.

This light-bodied wine strives for concentration and ripeness, but retains the typical bright acidity of Barbera. It smells like black cherries, tastes like not-quite-ripe blackberries and has a tangy, moderately tannic texture.
This wine has a flinty, earthy aroma, ripe fruit flavors and low tannins. It's smooth on the palate and has a hint of good acidity to keep it lively.
A lavender color and cherry-like aromas lead to very dry flavors of not-quite-ripe plums and a sensation of mild tannins in this light-bodied wine.

Whiffs of sugar cookie, ripe peach and tangerine are inviting on the nose of this off-dry kabinett, but the palate here is showing maturity already. Notes of apple and pear are a bit pressed in style, accented by hints of dusty mineral and a slightly bitter, phenolic finish. Drink now.

This full-bodied Barossa Shiraz comes charging through the gate with sweet oak notes, namely vanilla, butterscotch and coffee. Behind them gallop ripe berry fruits. The palate is more balanced, offering grainy, leathery tannins to tame the plush juicy fruit. This is a teeth-staining choice for those looking for a big ballsy red at $20 or under.
This Garnarcha features roasted berry and horseradish aromas. It's choppy on the palate, with top-heavy acidity and jammy blackberry and cassis flavors. Tobacco notes emerge on the finish.
Boasting overripe aromas and flavors of raisins and dried cherries, this wine is full bodied and very broad.
This ripe wine has attractively soft tannins and juicy, jammy red-berry flavors. It does have a dry core but the fruit is dominant. Drink this wine from 2021.

One of a range of wines produced by the Château Lafite-Rothschild winemaking team, this bottling is generous, ripe and juicy. Its black-currant fruits, soft tannins and open texture mean it is almost ready to enjoy. Drink from 2019.

A multi-national collaboration between Winemaker James Foster and Pat Monahan, lead singer of the band Train, the duo's Sauvignon Blanc is a straightforward expression of the variety. The typical grapefruit, guava, pineapple and tomato leaf notes are all there. The palate is crisp and zippy, with a touch of creaminess due to time on lees.
This is an austere, earthy and tannic red tangy in strawberry and dark cherry with a lingering taste of hazelnut and oak.
This tight, crisp apple-flavored wine is full of fresh acidity and with lively texture. It has a touch of spice as well as minerality. This lightly structured, fruity wine is ready to drink.
Rich and generous, this full-bodied, ripe wine is rich in black-cherry flavors with layers of toast. It is still young and could age further. Drink from 2019.
This delicious, soft wine is well balanced between fresh red fruits and acidity. Lively and packed with fruitiness, it is ready to drink.

This is a firmly medium-bodied Shiraz that shows tones of plum, red currant, chocolate and peppery herbal spices along with a little meatiness. The palate is silky-textured, with bright acidity and an earthy, savory core. A great weeknight sipper.

A blend of fruit from the Montagne de Reims and the Côte des Blancs, this ripe wine is getting better every year. It is moving towards dryness, gathering rich fruit on the way. The acidity and taut texture are balanced by the fruitiness. Drink now.
Oodles of jammy berry-like flavors pump up this rich and full-bodied wine from the maker of Josh wines. It has a broad mouth-coating texture, and hints of dark chocolate and vanilla on the finish.

Delicate up front with a backbone of thick weight and tannin, this wine is pleasant on the midpalate in cherry and pomegranate, with a floral tease of rose petal. This is a barrel selection of several sites, including Hallberg and Bucher.

A flinty touch of reduction adds interest to notions of ripe peach, yellow plum and juicy pear on the nose. The medium sweet palate is rounded and fruit-driven but also has textured, phenolic appeal and some tangerine freshness. This wine shows lovely balance.
designation: Clos Lisser Monopole Grand Cru Kirchberg de Barr

description: Not long out of the barrel, this bright young wine is loaded with tasty raspberry fruit. Those flavors are both deep and lively, amped up with plenty of acidity and rounded with a lick of chocolate from oak-aging. Though already quite tasty and showing a lot of youthful energy, the overall structure suggests it will reward cellaring. Tuck a few bottles away and drink now–2030.

This well-made wine is crisp and structured, layered in Meyer lemon, mandarin orange and a steely core of effusive acidity. Light bodied, it shows depth and texture enough to match a meal and find companionship at the table.

Made in tiny quantities, this Shiraz encompasses much more than the typical ripe fruit and oak combo. There's fruit, to be sure, in the form of greengage plums, plus dried rose petals, raw meat and hoisin sauce, with some Middle Eastern spices and a little earthy funk for good measure. It's medium bodied with a briny spine and grainy tannins—elegance and power combined. Drink now–2028.

This outstanding single vineyard selection pulls out all the stops. Though still young and somewhat stiff, it already shows superior balance and complexity, capturing the tensile strengths of the vintage. Its ripe and polished layers of berry- and cherry-inflected fruit—the result of 30% whole cluster fermentation—are accented with streaks of mocha and caramel from aging 12 months in 30% new French oak. Give it a little more bottle age and drink 2020–2030.

Ripe winter apple and bruised apple peel on the nose suggest mellowness. The palate follows suit with gentle, residual sweetness that accentuates the ripe richness, while fresh lemon brightness ensures it stays on the off-dry side. This wine is harmonious, rich, textured and long.

One of the meatier, spicier rosés from California, this wine smells like fresh berries and prosciutto, and tastes quite substantial. Made from Sangiovese grapes, it has more concentration than most and keeps improving in the glass.

This wine's pear, bread crust and citrus rind aromas slowly appear in the glass and follow through to the round, full-bodied palate, along with a hint of marzipan. Evident warmth from alcohol on the finish pushes it to the limit of freshness and balance.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

description: This wine's subtle peach jam and acacia honey aromas carry over to savory palate, along with candied ginger notes. A toasted almond note marks the close.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

description: Green apple and pear drop on the nose reappear on the juicy easy-drinking palate, which has just a slight edge of sage savoriness. The finish is dry and refreshing.
Aromas of papaya, lemongrass and tart candies are brimming with vibrancy on the nose. There's a solid fruit presence on the rounded palate, with a line of crisp acidity providing adequate tension.
This light-colored and medium-bodied wine has fresh citrus aromas, lemon, apple and vanilla flavors and a rounded texture that give it a full mouthfeel. It's well made and well-balanced.

A touch of banana, loads of ripe pear and red-cheeked apple, some lemony zing: this field blend makes most of its varietal mix. With its peppery verve and dry but beautifully textured palate, it belongs on the table.

A very faint but pure note of ripe lemon plays on the nose of this wine. The palate still has some slight fizz from the ferment but displays the same lovely lemon note and adds green apple. It's light, dry, fresh and subtle, with a zingy, long and clean finish.

Made entirely with Nerello Cappuccio, this opens with aromas of wild red berry, Mediterranean scrub, grilled herb and a whiff of dark baking spice. It's elegant and savory, delivering flavors of raspberry compote, juicy Marasca cherry, white pepper and star anise alongside polished tannins. It closes on a smoky mineral note.

A bullish nose is charred, minty and delivers heavy blackberry aromas. This is a massive Malbec with weight issues: It's rather flabby, but with biting tannins. Stewed blackberry and chocolate flavors finish with notes of fig and raisin.

Fragrant spring flower, green apple and citrus aromas lead the nose on this bright, fragrant Pinot Bianco. Reflecting the nose, the savory palate doles out creamy pear, juicy lemon and a hint of white almond. It has a clean, refreshing finish.

A touch of earthy banana plays amid the lively mandarin and apple fruit on the nose of this wine. Mandarin notes pervade the palate, making for a wonderfully concentrated, fruit-filled core of joyful freshness. Lovely, unusual and totally refreshing.

This is a beautifully balanced wine that has enticing, expressive black-cherry and sweet oak aromas, and equally vibrant and complex fruit flavors that are well supported by good acidity and moderate tannins. It's a nicely tight wine that doesn't give everything away at first whiff, but keeps one coming back for more.
This is a finely made wine that offers plenty of ripeness, structure and intensity. Rich and round, it has a soft backbone of cherry and cassis, with supportive yet integrated oak.

This wine comes from the magnificent vineyard opposite the town of Pinhão at the heart of the Douro. With its big, bold fruits, ripe tannins and wood-aging flavors, it provides a rich evocation of the minerality and structured texture from the region. Drink from 2019.

The aromas are brooding out of the gate, with notes of earthy funk, freshly ground black pepper, black olive, smoked meat and tar. The palate is elegant but still richly flavorful with a lingering smoky meat-filled finish. It seems a bit difficult to access at present, though it broadens with some time open. Best after 2022.
designation: Reserve Estate Foothills in the Sun Vineyard

description: Very aromatic notes of green-apple peel have a richer hint of green citrus and melon about them on the nose. The palate continues with this purity and generosity of fruit, caressing it with wonderfully fine bubbles that fizz away with freshness and poise. This is fruit-driven, totally expressive and elegant. The finish is clean, long with yeast and satisfyingly dry.
Lush round flavors of pear, melon and salted rocky minerality work well together in this well-made estate wine. With integrated oak, it offers a soft smooth palate of balanced richness.
Plum, vanilla bean and spice aromas lead to lighter-styled fruit and vanilla flavors. There's enjoyment to be had, but the concentration seems quite light.

Aromas of berry fruits, creamy oak and bland spices fit the norm for basic Cabernet. A racy pulling palate is strapped with elastic tannins, while this tastes of savory plum and saucy berry fruits. A steady finish is hard and grating.
Soft, lightly spicy and crisply fresh, this wine is also tangy, zesty and ready to drink. Red-currant fruit shoots through this bright, textured wine. Drink now.

This wine is a blend of 54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Merlot, 10% Malbec and 2% Cabernet Franc. Aromas of blueberry, herb, vanilla and toasty spices lead to very lightly styled cherry and vanilla flavors. The flavors seem a bit washed out, with the oak way out front.
Pinched, slightly astringent aromas are generic and barely fruity, but not off. A plump palate deals the minimum in bracing acidity, while light generic flavors of red fruits finish watery.

Soft aromas of cantaloupe, strawberry hull and orange pith define the bouquet of this fresh and easy rosé. Lightweight and easy to like, the palate offers more of the same, with a lingering pithy melon-rind flavor dominating the close.

To the north of the line of Grand Crus, this premier cru is one of the most familiar. This wine is rich, full and well balanced. Ripe yellow fruits are cut with acidity, minerality and a tangy, zesty edge that is delicious. Drink this poised wine from 2020.

This wine is still young and firm with concentrated tannins as well as perfumed berry flavors. Its texture and dry core show the ripe fruits and the touches of wood aging that come through gently. The wine will be ready to drink from 2023.

This wine has a bitter edge from extraction but it feels as though, with the weight of the fruit, it will soften and broaden as it matures. Plenty of bright cherry flavors should help it on its way. Drink from 2023.

Smooth and supple all the way through, this concentrated and powerful wine nevertheless has great layers of ripe fruit and velvety tannins. Grown at 2,000-feet in elevation, it has black cherry and blackberry that blend with hints of black pepper and toasted oak as the flavors roll across and linger on the palate.

Black raspberry, red plum candy and a hint of hibiscus show on the nose of this bottling from a new winery owned by Andy Busch of the Anheuser-Busch family. There are intense streaks of red flowers and rosewater on the palate, alongside notes of plum and cinnamon.
Full bodied and rich, this is a generous wine. Its richness and tropical-fruit character is balanced by intense acidity that cuts through and gives it a lift. Drink this ripe wine now.

This wine doesn't succeed as well as some of Sidewood's others. The oak influence is sweet and on the sweaty side, and it's sitting rather clunkily beside ripe peach, pineapple, apple and lime notes. The palate sees plenty of tangy fruit and a decent lick of acidity, but it's not quite enough to lift some of the textural flabbiness. The oak rears its head again on the finish.

This shows varietally correct aromas of apple and light citrus fruit. With just moderate acidity, the palate is starting to flatline. Besides pyrazine-based flavors and oak notes, it doesn't have much else to offer.

There's a chemical note on the nose, along with dusting polish, chocolate and cola, all coming from the oak influence. Plush, sun-puckered raspberry and red-cherry fruits are also in abundance. The palate is rich and luscious with dusty drying tannins and more ripe fruit. The oak here is equally prominent and a little clunky on the finish.
Foxy plum and violet aromas introduce this basic Tempranillo. It's broad on the palate, with herbal plum and berry flavors, modest acidity and little structure or intensity.
This wine is lively, fruity and refreshingly crisp. With a pleasant, ripe red-fruit character and layers of attractive acidity, it's juicy, fruity and ready to drink.
This is a sharp wine, tight with intense acidity that is not balanced by the fruitiness. Its edge is taut, nervy and over-crisp. It should soften a little and will taste riper from late 2018.

Bursts of spine-tingling grapefruit and lemon flavors abound in this lively dry white. It's a fresh, pristinely fruity Riesling with a lean profile and taut stony finish. Enjoyable already but it should hold till 2023.

Don't miss a chance to taste a Dornfelder from California. This intensely concentrated and fruity but not tannic wine has a deep dark ruby color and aromas like blueberries and dark chocolate. Flavors of blackberries and raspberries join in on the palate, and the texture is velvety and lively.
Aromas of iris, underbrush and a whiff of mint are front and center. The juicy palate doles out black cherry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside lively acidity and dusty tannins. Drink through 2023.

Made with organically farmed grapes, this boasts enticing aromas of iris, leather and aromatic herb. The chewy savory palate doles out juicy Marasca cherry, star anise and clove alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2021.

Produced from old vines of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine has powerful tannins and a dense, dusty texture. The black-currant flavors are intense, rich and bold. It has a good structure, still dominated by its fruit. Drink this wine now and until 2025.

The Portuguese like to create unusual blends. This sweet late-harvest wine is 70% Viognier and 30% Fernão Pires. It is intense, still retaining some of the typical apricot flavors and refining them through honey and botrytis. This wine is rich, opulent and ready to drink now.

Lovers of Cabernet's greener side will enjoy the plentiful notes of green bell pepper and chili flakes on prominent display in this wine. There's also a slightly charred wood character amidst supple black cherries. The palate comes with peppery spice, leathery, taut tannins and an earthy spine. There's an oaky touch at the end, but overall this is a solid wine.

Pristine grapefruit, yellow peach and fresh apricot flavors abound in this honeyed, intensely fruity Riesling. It's sweet on the palate but balanced by spine tingling acidity and a touch of saffron on the finish. An excellent value Auslese to enjoy now–2025.

The nose on this medium-sweet Riesling is initially smoky and earthy with hints of lemon and lime peel. The palate, by contrast, is buoyantly fruity, offering loads of sweet yellow peach and apricot nectar. A juicy, easy-drinking wine but elevated by a touch of minerality on the finish. Drink now–2023.

Char, toast and dark chocolate barrel aromas are out front, with herb and cherry lurking underneath. Full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. The wood influence is heavy, but there's enough fruit to largely stand up to it.

There is a considerable amount of Petite Sirah (11%) blended within this wine, which helps emphasize its big power and concentration. Earth, soy, currant, cedar and graphite accent a core of juicy blackberry and chocolate-covered cherry.

Well balanced, this Champagne, even with its enormous production, remains a benchmark and is always enjoyable. In this bottling, ripe white fruit is cut with citrus, with an edge of toastiness that gives complexity. Drink now.

Prickly citrus and generic green aromas are a bit pyrazinic. A plump, pulpy palate is a touch flat, while this tastes of lettuce, bell pepper and lime. Mild bitterness is notable on a finish where green herb flavors are lasting.

Herbal, saucy aromas of rubbery berry fruit, tomato and oak are jumbled. This feels blocky, with little to no layering. Vanilla, cocoa and herbal red fruit flavors are a bit green on a pulsing finish.
Aromas of green pepper, black currant, plum and spice are at the fore. The flavors are reserved in style, not staying together throughout but still providing some appeal.

Yellow peach and Mandarin orange peel are shy on the nose. The palate offers bright acidity and flavors of ripe yellow peach, pear, white flower and chalk. Lemon and orange flavors finish with a chalky texture.

This wine possesses a hearty helping of tannin and herbal elements that won't appeal to all. Full bodied and concentrated in ripeness, the dried herbs and cedar dominate on the nose and palate. Small amounts of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec are blended in.
Warm and ripe, this wine offers touches of spice to balance the almonds and fresh lemon flavors. It is softly textured, just beginning to show signs of toasty maturity. Drink the wine now.

Elegant and spicy floral notes of concentrated rose petal, hibiscus, sage and juniper play against a sugar-plum aroma on the nose of this bottling. Thyme and bay leaf lace the ripe plum-pudding and baked berry flavors of the palate, which is lifted by a crushed purple-flower element.

A honeyed touch and hints of stone suggest some evolution. The palate with fresh but fulsome notes of orange and yellow plum pays tribute to the ripe, warm vintage while some residual sugar plays a supporting role. Riesling's brightness counters this and the wine finishes off dry with lasting notes of orange.

Smoke, flint, pear peel and earth on the nose promise an intriguing wine. The palate keeps step with rich, almost honeyed pear fruit on the off-dry palate. A creamy freshness counters this, as does the concentrated body. This wine is earthy and smoky from start to finish.

Ripe, aromatic green and yellow pears waft on the nose. Concentrated and rich, the palate is tempered with a guiding streak of ripe lemon freshness, creating attractive tension as well as harmonious balance. The finish is off dry and long.

Made from ripe Pommard clone fruit, this explodes with rich cherry, sweet cola, molasses and wet stone flavors, with a touch of leather. Of all the winery's 2015 Pinot Noirs, this is one to open soon—within the next couple of years.

A touch of reduction still plays on the nose but the palate shows ample, ripe pear notes on a dry but concentrated body. The bold fruit holds its own against lemon brightness. This rich but taut wine strikes a lovely balance and has both drive and impact. The finish is long and dry.

A nose built almost entirely around raw oak is warm and earthy more than fresh and fruity. In the mouth, this is severely tannic and resiny. Hot woody berry flavors are demanding, while this is dry and dominated by the barrel on the finish.

There's a pleasant grassy overlay to the lime leaf, citrus peel and melon rind aromas and flavors in this zippy wine. Mouthwatering and puckering, it's quite zippy and zesty in feel, with a fresh finish of lime and green apple flavors.

Subtle hints of sweet grass and lemon verbena mingle with the green melon, lime and underripe mango core of this wine. It's medium in weight, with a flatness to the midpalate that countered by a bitter pithiness on the finish.
The aromas provide notes of wet penny, black pepper, damp sagebrush, anise and cherry. The sweet cherry and raspberry flavors seem to have a slight metallic tinge. Tasted twice with consistent notes.

A light blend of Duras, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, this is crisply flavored with red currants and raspberries. Acidity gives it a crunchy character, tight while also having bright fruitiness. Drink now.

Floral scents of carnation, peony and baby's breath lead the nose of this delicate rosé, supported by fruity notes of white cherry and wild strawberry. The palate is light and easy, with a pleasant citrus-pith flavor that unfolds on the finish.
designation: Villa La Vie En Rose Négrette

description: Aromatic baking spices accent the lavish, ripe fruit flavors in this generous full-bodied wine that combines power and good balance. It is full of black cherries from the first whiff to the mouth-filling flavors and on through the finish. Moderate tannins and a touch of acidity add a little welcome grip to the texture.

This domaine, owned by the Pelvillain family, is a vineyard in the heart of the Lot Valley. The rich tannins that come from this powerful wine provide the structure that supports great swathes of black plum and jammy berry flavors. Drink this dense wine from 2022.

Toasty oak aromas surround the bright raspberry and strawberry fruit as well as a floral touch of rose petals and carnation on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very fresh with smashed raspberry and cranberry flavors, smoothed out by oak-smoked meat.

This single-vineyard expression is loaded on the nose with brioche aromas alongside Meyer lemon preserves and a hint of apple cream. The palate is full in that California way, but balanced deftly, combining toast, oak, cashew and tangy lemon-curd flavors.

The merest touch of lemon appears on the nose of this pale-pink sparkler. The palate comes in with the same restraint but notes of red apple and ripe lemon slowly unfold. The mousse is very fine and delicate, as are the flavors. This is slender, pale, fresh and very seductive. The finish is dry and refreshing, an ideal and elegant apéritif.

The generosity of ripe apples, golden mirabelles and vivid citrus assails the nose with joyous intent. On the palate, these generous fruit notes are defined by vivid citrus freshness and a wonderfully frothy freshness. This is bottled exuberance and will disappear in no time at all. This slips down far too easily with all its fruity freshness.

An opaque dark-purple color and thick raisiny aromas announce a wine at maximum ripeness and saturation. On the palate, this is syrupy, with only moderate acidity. Toasty, oaky prune and blackberry flavors are peppery prior to a warm, dense finish.
Loads of citrus and banana cream pie make for a mouthwatering bouquet. The palate is softly structured and ripe in feel, with ripe tropical fruit flavors balanced by lightly charred citrus.
A whiff of passion fruit flickers across the mind before ripe pear takes over. The very light palate is equally fruit driven with a gentle, ripe freshness across the very light dry palate.

Los Angeles Dodgers longtime manager Tommy Lasorda's family is making wine now, starting with this bottling that's loaded with aromas of Asian pear, salted lemon, peach blossom and custard on the nose. The palate is rounded with flavors of creamed pear and then cut with brisk lemony acidity.

Made from 95% Sangiovese and 5% Colorino, this opens with toasted oak, espresso and dark fruit aromas. The dense palate offers vanilla, mocha, tobacco and black cherry jam notes alongside close-grained tannins.
This wine's cedar, tobacco and plum aromas appear in the glass. On the palate, rounded tannins support Morello cherry, vanilla and orange peel touches. Drink through 2021.

Rose, wild berry, dark spice, crushed herb and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub lead the way. It's full-bodied, elegant and savory, delivering ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and a hint of tobacco alongside taut, close-grained tannins that leave a rather grippy finish. Drink 2021–2028.

The east-facing vineyard gives cool wines with layers of intense acidity that contrast with the honey flavors of this wine. The two elements give a rich wine but one with plenty of freshness as well as spice. Drink from 2021.

A velvety texture based on a wealth of fine-grained tannins sets this high-octane wine apart. That structure supports good ripe fruit flavors and lots of spicy oak accents so the wine is layered and long on the finish.
designation: Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Old Vine

description: Lavish dark-fruit flavors meld with moderately spicy oak nuances for a rich, layered and delicious combination. The wine is deeply colored, redolent of black cherries and blueberries in the aroma, and practically gushing with rich fruit and spice notes on the palate and finish.

This wine is powerful but well-balanced, showing a ripe black-fruit aroma and rich black-cherry flavor. Moderate tannins and bright acidity yield a lip-smacking texture. The appealing fruit flavors are lightly accented by subtle oak spice.

This charming wine offers richness backed by well-honed acidity, so it stays fresh on the palate through the finish. Light baking-spice and honeysuckle aromas lead to subtle vanilla and white-peach flavors that enhance the smooth mouthfeel.

A touch of earthy banana plays amid the lively mandarin and apple fruit on the nose of this wine. Mandarin notes pervade the palate, making for a wonderfully concentrated, fruit-filled core of joyful freshness. Lovely, unusual and totally refreshing.
This Malbec from a difficult vintage is a success. Plum and dark berry aromas are ripe and dry. The palate is flush, while ripe berry and black-plum flavors dry out on the finish.

Raspberry, spicebox and herbal aromas take the lead in Alpha Estate's popular Hedgehog red. On the palate, lush red cherry, pepper and a distinct mineral spin give it poise and purpose. Pair it with grilled meats, pork and tomato dishes.

This wine's stone fruit and green apple aromas are lightly briny and focused. It features a tight, centered palate with vivid orange, lime and green melon flavors. The finish is compact, minerally and driven by energy.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

description: Winemaker: Rianie Strydom. This blend of 80% Cabernet Franc and 20% Merlot opens with scents of blackberry paste, black plum, blackcurrant leaf and tobacco that carry through to the medium-weight mouth, where the fruit intensity grows. The tannins are firm and structured, lending a crushed-velvet texture and enduring grip to the finish.
designation: Cape Winemakers Guild The Game Changer

description: Deep garnet to the eye, this wine offers a bouquet of pomegranate and violet. The palate brings flavors of cassis, dark plum, apple peel and lavender that have a hint of salinity. Firm tannins persist on the toffee-flavored finish.

Produced from foot treading in open lagars, this is a beautiful wine. Its richness is mitigated by its structure and the dense texture of black fruits along with the edge of the spirits and wood. Like any Reserve Port, it can be drunk now, although its structure suggests it could age.

This wine is silky smooth and resplendent in rose-petal aromas. On the lightly crafted palate of restrained ripeness, it reveals deft characteristics of orange zest, pomegranate and red cherry amid a grippy texture and quiet finish.

This is a delicious and beautifully-proportioned wine that delivers exceptional value. Concentrated cranberry and blueberry fruit takes the middle ground, and the raw-wood aromas suggest that further bottle age will soften the flavors on the finish.

Made with Sangiovese and 5% Merlot, this offers aromas of red-skinned berry, forest floor and a whiff of cedar. The structured palate offers dried black cherry, clove, licorice and mocha flavors framed in firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.
designation: Riserva di Fizzano Single Vineyard Gran Selezione

description: Made entirely with Fiano, this has aromas of hazelnut, acacia, dried herb and wet rock. The bright elegant palate delivers yellow apple, golden pear, toasted almond and flinty mineral set against bright acidity. It closes on a honeyed note.

It's too bad this winery's Carmenère production remains so small, as the improvement from vintage to vintage has been impressive. This is the best yet, showing the varietal notes of herb and seaweed without the aggressively vegetal character of some examples. Firm blackberry fruit and mocha and black olive accents keep it smooth, supple and interesting.
This easy, fruity wine is rounded, ripe and soft. With touches of citrus as well as peach flavors, it's lightly zesty and refreshingly ready to drink.

This medium-bodied wine has a slightly cloudy appearance and an auburn edge, a sharp mouthfeel and hints of raspberry vinegar along with cherries, black pepper and smoke. Try it for a complete change of pace.

Sourced from the Thistlecroft vineyard, this was produced and bottled by Eola Hills winery. It's an oaky, blocky wine, with potent vanilla syrup scents and flavors that marginalize the fruit and disguise any varietal typicity.
Light and fruity, this softly textured, creamy wine is perfumed and refreshing. Its lemon and grapefruit flavors contrast with red apple notes and a touch of spice. Drink now.
Really crisp and fruity, this light, dry wine has a slight prickle on the tongue. It has the cool, clean taste of Vinho Verde and is refreshing and full of bright acidity at the end.
Bright, crisp and fruity, this is a light, perfumed wine with attractive acidity. Its lightness and acidity are balanced by refreshing red berry flavors. Drink now.
An especially bright copper color make this wine stand out visually, while tart fruit flavors and a very dry crisp texture complete the picture. Moderate in alcohol, it has a lean taste profile, too.

Passionfruit, pineapple and mango rind dominate this wine from the bottom of New Zealand's north island. There's a touch of residual sugar on the palate, yet bright acidity balances all the ripe fruit.
This wine has a touch of reduction that makes it hard to fully delve into, a well as a thickly tannic character of ripeness that quietly exudes notions of blackberry and vanilla.

Spiced cherry and currant aromas are basic but true for Pinot Noir. A plump palate with zesty acidity tastes of raspberry, plum and mild spice. In terms of feel and vitality, this is flat on the back palate and finish.

French oak, coconut and mature plum aromas carry over to the rather light-bodied, astringent palate along with hints of clove, coffee bean and a note of powdered sage. Raspy, grainy tannins dry out the finish.

One of several Bordeaux chateaus that are followed by the Univitis cooperative, this wine has the generosity to be expected from this ripe vintage. Firm tannins will allow the wine to age further. Drink from 2019.

Sourced from one of the state's top Chardonnay sites, this wine was aged longer in barrel (16 months vs. 10), with a greater percentage of new oak (50% vs 35%) than the winery's Columbia Valley bottling. Its toast, cardamom, peach and clarified butter aromas are followed by full-bodied, creamy stone fruit flavors with plentiful spice accents. It's a delicious expression of the variety from a warm vintage.

The oak is still showing prominently throughout this young bottling, but it has all the bones to make for a compelling sip for the next decade or so. Aromas of black raspberry sorbet and smoke lead into a palate of snappy red fruit, white pepper, star anise and clove. Be patient and this will smooth out nicely. Drink 2020–2030.

This wine's toasty oak and inky black fruit aromas suggest pencil lead. The palate is full bodied but controlled, with prominent woody flavors of tobacco and vanilla. Savory black fruit and tobacco notes mark the finish. Drink through 2028.

Blending five of the producer's vineyard-designates, all dry-farmed and old-vine, this is a high-acid red with hearty spice and components of dried herb, cedar and oak. Supple and rich, it's distinctively savory and tart on the midpalate and finish, finishing in a blur of pepper.

Smoky notes of oak dominate the nose. The palate also shows nutty oak richness as well as gentle, ripe pear fruit and sprightly lemon freshness as a bright counterpoint. Full bodied, dry and concentrated, this needs time to integrate. Drink 2022–2030.

With the extra maturity from bottle aging, this wine has hints of toastiness to balance its dry, low dosage character. It also offers ripe pear and apricot fruit, a floral character and a rich aftertaste. Drink now.

This estate, close to the Mediterranean and near Bandol, has a fine way with Mourvèdre, which is blended here with Syrah. The result is an intense, wood-aged wine, rich in tannins and with dense black-plum-skin flavors. Dark tannins and great concentration leave no doubt about the power of this age-worthy wine. Drink from 2020.

This wine is sourced from the Osoyoos East Bench and the Black Sage Bench. It's concentrated and dark, with savory herbs and lush flavors of roasted black fruit, smoke, char, licorice and espresso. Impressively, the tannins remain polished and proportionate.

The half-dozen Chardonnays from this new producer are subtly differentiated, and reward your extra attention. This is comprised of Dijon clones, fermented with wild yeasts and aged 17 months in 45% new French oak. It's gracefully layered with blended flavors of apple, lemon and melon. It finishes with pleasing tastes of butter cookie and fresh mint.

Crisply defined, this blends aromas and flavors of lemon rind, green tea and butter cookie. It's an elegant wine, with a subtle, lingering finish. This is one of a half-dozen chess-themed Chardonnays from this exciting new winery.
Smoky oak meets rounded black fruit in this rich dense wine, softened in structure on the midpalate. Chocolate and vanilla flavors combine to underline the grip and full-bodied ripeness.

This elegant fragrant red opens with inviting scents of crushed rose, wild herb, red berry and a slight whiff of smoke. It's bright and focused, delivering Marasca cherry, strawberry, star anise and tobacco set against taut polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2026.

Concord grape, boysenberry and dried anise aromas show on the nose of this fresh bottling. The palate focuses first on dried herbs and then moves into elderberry as well as elderflower, beef jerky and soy.

Made from organic grapes, this is a juicy, approachable wine full of forward black plum and cherry flavors. Full bodied in style, it's accented by hints of caramelized sugar, nut and granite. The moderately long finish is marked by fine-grained, soft tannins.
Lightly herbal and crisp, this is a delicious, fragrant wine. It has a typical light Provencal color along with great fruitiness and a ripe red-fruit aftertaste. Drink now.
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: Stalky and packed with black-currant and berry fruits, this wine is intense with tannins, acidity and a licorice flavor. All this will soften to give a rich wine, although likely the stalky fruit will likely remain. Drink from 2020.
Notes of juicy green pear characterize the nose. The palate is less defined when it comes to fruit but is easy, fluid, fresh and very light. This is almost translucent in flavor and has a dry finish.
Plump berry aromas are easygoing. In the mouth, this is more raw and acidic, leading to punchy plum, berry and cassis flavors. A fresh finish thins out quickly, leaving grating edginess.

Once again this budget label from Paul O'Brien offers exceptional value. Barrel aged for a year in 25% new French oak, it includes 20% Willamette Valley grapes, with the rest from the Umpqua Valley. A portion of whole clusters were included, and the fermentation was done in both concrete and French oak foudres. Some flavors of earth and stem come through, and a certain astringency from the concrete, along with brambly black cherry fruit and chewy tannins.

Bright, zesty aromas of lemon zest, crushed stone and melon meld with a delicate white blossom undertone is this unoaked Chardonnay. Juicy and succulent yet pillowy in feel, the palate offers a broad impression of fruit balanced by honed acidity.

This inaugural release is a blend of 59% Cabernet Sauvignon, 24% Cabernet Franc and 17% Merlot, with the fruit coming from Seven Hills, Summit View and Waliser vineyards. Seeing just 35% new French oak, the emphasis is squarely on the fruit. Aromas of raspberry jam, blueberry compote, black currant and spice give way to fruit flavors that show elegance, delicacy and length. It's a pretty take on these varieties and the valley.

This is a solid wine, with a chunky mouthfeel. Firm flavors are anchored in cherries and chocolate (from 17 months spent in 40% new French oak). This is a full-bodied wine, which incorporates some herbal notes and finishes with tannins that leave a taste of green tea.
Aromas of violet, leather and truffle lead the nose. On the chewy palate, firm tannins accompany ripe Marasca cherry, clove and licorice. Drink after 2021.
This young wine is still full of crisp fresh fruits. The texture is tight, mineral from the flint soil and nervy. Drink from 2020.
Lime leaf, green gooseberry and plum lead the nose of this fresh and easy white, with a soft flintiness in the background. It's prickly and vibrant on the palate, with a final bitter-melon flavor.
Shy aromas of citrus and strawberry carry a mild concentration on the nose and echo on the light-bodied palate. This is simple and to the point, with a balanced feel.
In the warm climate of Tejo, the northern grape Alvarinho becomes rich, full of creamy apple fruits that are shot through with citrus acidity. This is a balanced wine already and can be drunk now.

Subdued, slightly reduced aromas of lime leaf and white peach lead to just off-dry drinking, lighter-styled fruit flavors, with ale notes on the tart finish. There are good things going on, but it seems a bit pulled back for the variety. Perhaps it just needs some additional time in bottle?
This wine has a strong note of juniper amidst dried herb, earth, leather and tobacco, the tannins persistently chewy and somewhat astringent.
Ripe and creamy, this blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto is fruity and gently textured. Tangy zestiness gives the wine a lift but the aftertaste is gentle, rounded and full of attractive fruitiness.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte da Baía Branco

description: Plush aromas of white peach and honeysuckle are cut by wet gravel, river stones and rain-on-cement elements on the tense nose of this bottling. There is lots of acidic zip and grippy tensions to the palate, where lemon-lime, grapefruit pith and nearly petrol flavors play out.

From a typically cool and crisp appellation, this is a delicious wine. Its tight mineral texture and bright acidity are all of a piece with the intense citrus and apple fruits. This structured wine will age further and should be ready from 2019.

This wine is generous and well balanced, with a good partnership between lush fruit and a mineral texture. It is still young but has good potential, and will show its richness and acidity even better given time. Drink from 2019.

This blend of fruit from the McGinley and Grassini vineyards is fermented in cigar barrels, and shows rounded aromas of passion fruit and nectarine on the nose alongside lime, grass and chalk. There is a smoky quality to the smoke, with red pear, chalk and grass flavors wrapped in a creamy texture.

Enticing scents of ripe pear, citrus zest, pastry and Alpine herb mingle together on this elegant, refreshing sparkler. On the bright, silky palate, a refined perlage and tangy acidity offset lemon, Golden Delicious apple, ginger and a mineral note evoking wet stone.

This wine tastes delicious, honest, full of fruit flavors and has a velvety texture that carries blackberry, black cherry and light oak spices over the palate and hangs on to them through the finish. It is full bodied, lightly tannic and quite concentrated.

The schist and granite soil of this vineyard yields a wine that is strongly mineral. Its acidity and fruitiness are restrained by a tense texture and steely character. This fine wine needs to age a few more months, so drink from early 2019.
designation: Domaine de la Fruitière Gneiss de Bel Abord Sur Lie

description: This blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon, Picolit and Moscato Giallo opens with aromas of toasted oak, orchard fruit and a hint of saffron. The structured balanced palate doles out Fuji apple, dried apricot and a touch of ginger alongside tangy acidity. Enjoy through 2022.
Gritty lemon and salty wet stone give this wine a welcome complexity and texture, amid a tart precision of citrus zest and grapefruit. Lithe, blended acidity keeps it fresh and focused in the glass.

Made with organically farmed Turbiana grapes, this delicious white opens with heady aromas of fragrant spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of flint. Bright and linear, the palate delivers crisp Rennet apple, white peach and grapefruit alongside refreshing acidity. A white almond note lingers on the close.

This mouth-filling wine starts with spicy cedary aromas that are vivid and attractive. It is rich in texture and deep in flavor. A full body and a thick layer of fine-grained tannins give plenty of structure for the chocolate and black-cherry flavors.

Dried earth, thyme, sagebrush, potpourri and boysenberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which is bolstered by 8% Grenache and 4% Tempranillo. Tart purple fruits and herbal elements arise on the palate, which is fresh with acidity and framed by tightly wound tannins.

Enticing scents of white orchard fruit, crushed herb and citrus blossom float out of the glass. On the palate, vibrant acidity balances ripe Anjou pear, juicy pineapple, nectarine and white-peach flavors while a mineral note energizes the crisp clean finish.

Aromas of cherry, cassis and butterscotch open into flavors of cherry, strawberry, pomegranate, violet and smoke. Strong tannins are no match for powerful fruit flavors that softly fade into a finish marked with bitter almond, flint and pomegranate.

An elegant and supple example of the varietal, this wine blends ripe, seductive fruit aromas and flavors with a sleek texture and silky mouthfeel. Moderate tannins melt into the black cherry and blackberry notes for a nice sense of depth and a lingering finish, too.

Produced from old vines (age unspecified) and fermented using whole clusters, this is an aromatic mélange of strawberry preserves, cranberry sauce and graham crackers. Its solid, chunky midpalate keeps those tart fruit flavors front and center.

Plush and fruity, this sports a tasty mix of apple, pear, apricot and peach flavors, along with a hint of tropical fruit. It's soft and accessible, with a little extra texture due, perhaps, to indigenous yeast fermentation.

Cofermented with 3% Viognier, this red is lovely and floral in red cherry and blueberry, the fruit richly concentrated and approachable. Lovely accents of white pepper and dried herb add to a tease of black olive that's entirely rewarding.
A fruit bowl of pineapple, peach and watermelon, this is a simple, dry drop that doesn't show much in the way of character or pizazz but won't offend either.
This wine is all bright, clean fruit and acidity. It's just off dry, with a slight spritz and a lively texture. Drink now.

This blend of Nero d'Avola and Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of dark-skinned fruit and cooking spice that carry over to the simple palate alongside a hint of green peppercorn. It's easygoing, with laid-back tannins. Drink soon.
This ruby colored Pinot Noir has aromas of clove, black cherry and mesquite smoke. On the palate, there are smooth tannins and flavors of red cherry and red plum.

This Rioja's gritty berry aromas include hints of pepper, asphalt and animal fur. It's clipped and raw, with oak-laden herbal plum and berry flavors. A burnt oak character rests heavily on the finish.
This wine's punchy citrus and nectarine aromas signal a basic Verdejo. It's fresh but light, with moderate acidity, dry melony flavors and a steady, briny-tasting finish.
The Muscadelle in this wine makes it so attractive. It gives it a perfumed character, as well as enhancing the lively citrus fruits. Lightly herbal, the wine is ready to drink.

This has aromas of French oak, prune, underbrush and vanilla. Reflecting the nose, the lean, light-bodied palate evokes coconut, espresso and a hint of dried berry alongside dusty, rather fleeting tannins that leave a drying, astringent finish.

This wine is a blend of 38% Merlot, 31% Cabernet Franc, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Petit Verdot. Aromas of dried cherry and baking spice lead to tangy, somewhat green seeming fruit flavors that drop off on the finish.
This medium-bodied wine shows a lot of oak influence in the baking-spice aromas, cedar and vanilla flavors and spicy finish. Under the oak are bright raspberry and cherry flavors.

Fully toasted oak aromas are smoky and grainy, and they cover up briny apple notes. A mix of oily weight and sharp acidity defines the palate, while this tastes a bit sour, with lots of oak attached to stone fruit flavors. Hailing from southerly Malleco, this is a cool-climate Chardonnay, and thus the high acid level makes sense.
Obvious oak aromas and an almost sweet sensation on the palate give this wine a sense of wearing plenty of makeup. The texture is broad and soft, and the flavors are like candied cherries.

From a site within the cool Sebastopol Hills, this light-bodied wine is earthy, minty and spicy, with length and grace. Smooth and silky on the palate, it shines in dark cherry, cassis and cardamom, and has a memorable, lasting finish.

A touch of beeswax on the nose leads onto a rather sweet palate where a pithy citrus bitterness and freshness set pleasant accents in the smooth, ripe, rounded and generous fruit. That beeswax notion resurfaces on the long medium-sweet finish.

Gentle apricot mellowness joins the juicy pear notes on the nose. The palate adds both a boost of slight residual sweetness and a guiding pithy phenolic element. Zesty freshness of ripe citrus plays in the background. This balanced, harmonious wine has a medium-sweet finish.

Ripe baked and dried pear-notes appear all at once with a deeply fruity allure. The palate boosts these rounded and already sweet notes with even richer honeyed sweetness. The concentration is evident while a chalky backdrop alongside lemon freshness provides some balance to this rich and generously fruited wine. The finish is medium sweet.

Very ripe notions of yellow Mirabelle plum almost have a citrus edge of marmalade to them on the nose. The medium-sweet palate boosts these fruit notions to the max, tempering them with that orange zest sweetness. This is full-on, concentrated and has quite a bit of warmth on its sweet and intense finish.

Very ripe pear notes on the nose have the added charm of ripe Mirabelle plums and a tinge of earthiness. Both these themes are reprised on the palate. Pear and Mirabelle fruit are boosted by gentle sweetness, while the earthiness turns into a pleasantly bitter phenolic streak that is a counterpoint to the fruit. The finish is off dry but fresh.

Concentrated flavors of white grapefruit and yellow apple are accented by hints of crushed mineral and lime pith here. While spry and light in body, there's a leesy richness and subtle sweetness that enriches the palate. Sunny lemon-lime acidity shines on the finish. Enjoy now through 2028.

This broad, rich and mouth-coating wine starts with effusive spicy oak aromas like wood smoke, cardamom and cedar before spilling very ripe, almost jammy, boysenberry flavors on the palate. It's unabashedly oaky, but has so many ripe generous fruit flavors that they balance each other out.

A touch of flint, tangerine peel, red and green apple meet on the nose. The palate is fresh but approachably softened by rounded ripeness. Citrus freshness plays charmingly in the background, but is ripe rather than bracing, making for a dry and refreshing finish.
designation: Collection heritage Grand Cru Kirchberg de Barr

description: Part of the winery's reserve tier, this was barrel-fermented, offering a totally different set of flavors from the stainless steel-fermented Viognier. It is lush on the palate, with concentrated apple, grapefruit and papaya flavors and a buttery, toasty finish.

Wet earth, jasmine and honeysuckle on the nose carry though onto the palate. Here they are met with apple sweet-sourness that creates balance and turns this into a very appetizing proposition. The body is light but dense with flavor, the off-dry finish is long and moreish.

This bottling from four vineyards, with 12% Mourvèdre, shows loads of crushed carnation, rose petal, cranberry and raspberry on the nose. There is a compelling freshness to the palate, with potpourri and lavender flavors meshing into a background of pomegranate and rosewater.

Firm tannic structure and brisk acidity lend a bold structural character to this dusky, onion skin-hued rosé. Flavors of raspberry and dried strawberry are slightly savory and muted, making the wine an elegant companion to poultry or pork, even in the fall months.

This is a ripe, full-bodied wine, rich in white fruits, generous acidity and with a good balance. It has weight and intensity, the fruitiness partnered by acidity and touches of spice and minerality. Still young, the wine emphasizes fresh fruit, but is ready to drink.

Made entirely with Syrah, this opens with aromas of dark berry, sandalwood and espresso. The full-bodied, spicy palate offers blackberry jam, black pepper, cinnamon and clove alongside supple tannins.

This lively blend of 60% Nero d'Avola and 40% Frappato opens with aromas of red berry, tilled soil and dark spice. The bright, enjoyable palate offers ripe strawberry, crushed blackberry and white pepper alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.
This attractively fruity, dry rosé has red-currant flavors and a zesty, mineral texture. It is an attractive, crisp wine with plenty of fruitiness, a taut texture and immediate drinkability.
Pressed violet, herb and camphor aromas shape the nose. The chewy palate delivers raspberry, black cherry and a hint of star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink 2021–2027.

It seems odd to make a Sauvignon Blanc in the same region as Vinho Verde's great whites, but this fat wine is the result. It has richness and touches of tropical fruit, but lacks acidity. Drink the wine now.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Maria Papoilac

description: Cedar, wood spice, herb, coffee and licorice aromas are followed by coiled-up, slightly bitter-seeming tannins. It doesn't all work.

Soupy saucy berry aromas lack commitment and purity. This feels soupy as well, with jammy weight. Herb-infused black-fruit flavors are kind of green, while this is lugubrious on a finish without much flow.
Simple and fruity, this crisp wine has good acidity and a bright aftertaste. Refreshing citrus and a touch of pepper combine with juicy apple to give a wine that's ready to drink.

Aromas of gooseberry and white peach tinged with vanilla are joined by a whiff of spoiled tangerine. The palate is certainly round, with a pudding like weight highlighting the vanilla and creamy lemon cookie flavors, though there is enough acidity for balance.

Clean and straightforward, this offers notes of black plum, raspberry and milk chocolate on the nose and mouth. It's light in feel and easy to drink, with ample acidity to lend some verve through the close.

This wine's earthy, smoky aromas fade with aeration, revealing bright sour cherry and raspberry notes. The palate is dry and briskly concentrated, offering subdued berry and red apple flavors offset by zesty acidity. The finish is fresh and elegantly herbal. Drink now.

Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a pale-colored rosé, rounded with spice and caramel as well as crisp, clean acidity. Red-currant and raspberry fruitiness gives the wine a deliciously fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
This is a crisp, fruity wine with lively acidity. Its bright texture and lemon and grapefruit purity are delicious and ready to drink.
This balanced, creamy and fruity wine from 50-year-old vines is still young but already delicious. It's succulent and juicy, with apple flavors and zesty acidity at the end. Drink from late 2018.

This wine is a blend of Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Aromas of plum, raspberry jam, white pepper and barrel spice lead to full-bodied fruit flavors. Raspberry and plum notes linger on the slightly candied finish.

Strawberry punch aromas meet with cotton candy on the light but very inviting and rounded nose of this Grenache-based pink wine. It's soft on the palate with just enough grip to make for a compelling sip.

This is big but agile wine that deftly balances an earthy, wild-herb character with vibrant red-cherry and plum flavors and has just the right amount of fine-grained tannins and good acidity for grip and freshness on the palate. Best after 2023.

Nutty aromas of walnut and hazelnut meet with sandalwood and a cream pudding touch on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong citrus pith tension to the palate alongside the roasted nut flavor, and the finish is waxy in texture.

Plump black plum and berry aromas are accented by hints of violet and dried mushroom on the nose here. It's a plush but soft-spoken wine with richness balanced by finely edged tannins and bright acidity. The finish lingers on an elegant but savory tone. Enjoy now–2028.

Ripe but restrained black cherry and plum aromas are accented by whiffs of toast, sweet spice and olive. There's plenty of plush, juicy black fruit here, but it's balanced briskly against a cool mineral tone and fresh acidity. An stately wine with integrated alcohol and lingering chalky tannins.

Aromas of spiced plum, new leather, toasted oak and tobacco shape the nose. It's concentrated and full bodied, doling out blackberry jam, licorice and black pepper flavors framed in tightly wound, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2033.

Wood aged and still developing, this wine has great potential. Apples, citrus and hints of more tropical fruits are there, along with a tight texture that needs to soften. Give this wine until 2020 before drinking.

This wine's ripe pear and pleasantly bitter grapefruit zest aromas make for an intriguing duo. They continue on the fresh, taut and pithy palate, where textured lemon notes add an extra dimension. The finish is dry and very refreshing.
White peach, lemon and spice aromas are followed by light styled fruit flavors in this wine. Lemon notes carry the finish. It's a very pretty interpretation of the variety.

Nice and fruity, nice and dry, this full-bodied, pure and concentrated wine offers brilliant black-cherry aromas, delicious cherry and raspberry flavors and a polished texture. It's a fine example of old-vine composure and balance.

Ripe but pristine black cherry and plum on the nose gain body and richness on the palate. It's a supple but elegant wine with elegant hints of violet and spice. Ripe but firm tannins and fresh acidity lend structure. Enjoy now–2025.

The producer's first vintage of this white, this shows medium-bodied ripeness and texture, nearly no oak, and strong aromas and flavors of green apple and mango. It's a fine wine for the table, picnic basket or front porch with friends.

Smooth and supple, this medium-bodied wine is beautifully polished in texture and poised in terms of balance. It shows light peach and canteloupe flavors, a touch of red-wine grip on the palate and good concentration that contributes to a lingering, snappy finish.

This is a 100% varietal wine from one clone, made in tiny amounts with indigenous yeast fermentation. Exotic and inviting, it offers robust berry, citrus and leather, with a biting quality of tannin that eases into a concentration of velvety texture.

Aromas of black currant, green peppercorn and a whiff of ginger come together on this firm red. The savory palate delivers ripe blackberry, cinnamon and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.
Alluring scents of honeysuckle and tropical fruit lead the nose while the round palate doles out honeydew melon, creamy white peach and juicy citrus. Bright acidity lifts the ripe flavors.

Broad aromas of black plum, cherry, sweet cedar and a touch of smoke show on the nose of this blend of 38% Petit Verdot, 36% Malbec and 26% Cabernet Sauvignon. The palate is framed by layered tannins that provide structure but don't get in the way, allowing ripe flavors of boysenberry to mesh with peppery spices and crushed gravel.

This wine is rich but balanced, full of black fruits while also structured. Made from typical Douro grapes including Touriga Nacional, it is poised with a strong mineral texture. It's still young, so drink from 2019.

This is a wood-aged wine, vinified in wood, with a production of only 10 barrels. Its rich, creamy texture comes equally from the wood and the ripe, baked-apple fruitiness. This rich wine is young and will age well, so drink from 2019.

Strong flavors of black tea and Bing cherries give a big personality to this medium-bodied wine. It tastes extremely fruity, like cherries and blackberries, has light tannins and a rather soft mouthfeel.
This attractive, fruity and light wine is classic, just off-dry Vinho Verde. Its citrus sherbet flavor is lifted by bright acidity and a fine, zesty texture.
This wine leads with a profusion of sweet oaky spices in the aroma followed by even more oaky smoky syrupy flavors and a lightly sweet balance. It is full bodied and has lots of flavor impact.
Light in color, bright and fruity, this is a lively, crisp wine. Its acidity, touches of red-currant fruit and clean texture all give it a refreshing character. It is ready to drink.

A very dense, almost-black color and concentrated blueberry and chocolate aromas make this wine an attention-getter. It has a touch of sweetness to soften moderate tannins, and offers plenty of grapey jammy fruit flavors.

Stewed plum aromas lead the nose of this wine, losing clarity with airing. It smacks of superficial acidity and tastes of plums and berries, with a touch of chocolate in the backdrop. The finish is creamy and artificial-seeming in both flavor and texture.
Made with 70% Montepulciano and 30% Sangiovese, this has aromas of prune, raisin and tilled soil. The rather evolved palate offers dried cherry, vanilla and star anise alongside rounded tannins.

Aggressive aromas of gamy berry fruits are slightly green. Tough, choppy tannins make the palate gritty, while this tastes of robust black fruit, tomato sauce and green herb. A punchy finish reverberates with hard tannins.
This wine is structured and firm, with dark tannins and a core of smoky, bitter flavors. Let this wine rest for the potential of its black fruits to shine. Drink from 2021.
Bright red cherries and raspberries shine out of this attractive, light and jammy wine. Its tannins are well behaved behind all this fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2021.

This wine is beginning to brown at the edges, indicating its age. This cuvée is mature although, typically for this vintage, it has not lost its tannins. Drink now, although it will have a tough edge.
This smoky, meaty wine offers solid tannins and high-toast, burnt flavors. Luckily the fruit is there and should shine through the structure as the wine develops. Drink from 2021.

With 22% Petite Sirah and 2% Carignan in the mix, and the vines averaging more than 95 years in age, this is a memorable wine. Structured and powerful, it boasts flavors of raspberry jam, graham cracker and cinnamon, with integrated tannins that impart richness and length.

Yeasty autolysis is immediately apparent on the rich creamy nose. This is followed by an equally rounded but dry palate that is dominated by yeasty generosity and finely fizzing bubbles but is actually defined by wonderful freshness. There is a sweet saltiness on the dry finish that is very moreish and lasting. Lovely.

This is a very savory and quite compelling Cabernet, starting with aromas of black pepper, tar, dried olive and yet also a bright fresh boysenberry kick. The palate is framed by lavish, silky tannins that envelop flavors of cassis, black cherry and baking spice, with continued layers of Sichuan peppercorn and plum arising into the finish.

Made in the estate's eponymously named vineyard site, this fragrant Barolo boasts alluring aromas of iris, violet and woodland berry. Supple and savory, the graceful, inviting palate doles out raspberry compote, Marasca cherry, star anise and cinnamon alongside lithe tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance. It's already almost accessible but also offers good mid-term aging. Drink 2020–2026.
This wine has a backbone of tannin and dense fruit that offers power. Flavors of rhubarb, pomegranate and strawberry meet added complexities of cherry liquor and earthy spice on the palate.

Savory sage and black tea are top notes for this well-balanced, nicely fruity and medium-bodied wine from one of the pioneering wineries of Anderson Valley. Hints of black pepper and clove meet solid, ripe black-cherry and raspberry flavors as moderate tannins help shape an appetizing mouthfeel.

A slight petrol lift of evolution and ripeness that joins the juicy mandarin notes on the nose promises richness. The palate carries these flavors over, adding notions of chalk and stone. A streak of lemon brightens everything on the dry palate. Lovely now, it's sure to continue evolving. Drink now–2028.

Notes of damask rose and peach on the nose become full-fledged on the rounded but fluid palate that shows pristine fruit. A lick of residual sweetness is framed, directed and boosted by mandarin freshness. Flavors are limpid and joyful in their off-dry balance. This wine is vivid and harmonious.

This big bold Bordeaux-inspired blend combines 85% Cabernet Sauvignon with 10% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc. It offers a layering of dusty sage and crushed rock around tight-grained tannin that presents as soft and structured on the palate. The integrated fruit is a welcome mix of cassis and red currant.

A new release from Pewsey Vale's oldest vineyards and fermented on native yeasts, there is a long life ahead of this wine. Right now, it's young, eking out notes of apple skins, blossoms, grapefruit and talc. The balance is spot on, and while this would be delicious now with shellfish, it'd be even better with some time in the cellar. Drink now–2032.

Flavorful and rich in texture, this generous and full-bodied wine presents a rather light, toasty aroma. Ripe, concentrated fruit and oak flavors are carried on a plush texture that coats the palate with vanilla, baking spice and ripe pear that linger on the finish.

Spicy floral Hungarian oak aromas and rich, detailed and concentrated fruit and spice-rack flavors give great appeal to this full-bodied and well-balanced wine. It has a plush layered texture, a great foundation of black cherry and complex tea, plus interwoven notes of cinnamon and forest floor.

This is a ripe and relatively full-flavored wine made from Barbera that offers somewhat richer fruit flavors than many of its peers and a lush mouthfeel. The peach and apple flavors are vivid, and good acidity keeps it lively on the palate.
This pale-colored wine is light, crisp and zestily refreshing. It has a fresh, bright character that is full of red-currant and spice flavors. Drink this attractive wine now.
A refreshing fruity blend of Cinsault, Grenache and Syrah with a touch of white Rolle, this wine is bright, offering intense acidity as well as a sweep of red fruits. Drink this attractive wine now.
The fruit and the good acidity are balanced by the ripe nature of this wine. It has concentration, with red-currant and berry flavors all attractively packaged. Drink this wine now.

Small amounts of Sauvignon Musque and Sauvignon Gris are blended within this substantive, lushly built wine, which is thick and rich in flavors of peach and vanilla. The finish brightens with aromas of jasmine.

Orange zest and fresh apples make for a most appetizing and fragrant nose. The palate is just as vivid, fruit-forward and fresh. This may be easy and totally driven by fruit but is carries bags of charm despite its lightness. It's the quintessential party wine.
This wine is quietly floral with a thick entry of simple, lemon-lime flavors and a rounded structure.

Wiry aromas of brined apple come with a whiff of air freshener, making for a questionable nose. This is lean and citrusy on the palate, with little to no bead. Simple flavors of green pear and nectarine finish quietly.
Vanilla bean, pencil eraser and licorice aromas lead to light but creamy-feeling vanilla-extract flavors. The oak influence seems primary, without the fruit to stand up to it.
Aromas of custard, funk and corn-on-the-cob lead to lightly creamy-feeling fruit flavors. The concentration waxes and wanes throughout, at times coming off as quite light.

Peach juice, pollen and a slightly grassy tone carry the mildly intense nose. Medium in weight, with zesty acidity, this offers tart gooseberry and peach flavors that end on a short, slightly sweet note.
This simple, fruity wine offers attractive red-berry flavors and accompanying acidity. Its fresh character goes with the light tannins and fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

Firmly tannic with its black fruits still shyly in the background, this wine is darkly structured and complex. Its dark, spicy character is given richness by the ripe berry flavors. Drink the wine from 2027.

This wine comes from old vines planted on flinty soil. The terroir gives a strongly mineral edge to the crisp, ripe white fruits. It has a rich character, the creamed-apple flavors edged with a touch of apricot. The wine is ready to drink.

Made entirely with Syrah, this opens with earthy aromas of black-skinned berry, tilled soil and leather. The forward palate delivers black plum, black currant and a hint of white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2021.
Aromas of eucalyptus, underbrush and dark berry emerge from the glass. The solid palate evokes dark cherry, licorice and a hint of white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2021.

Toasty notes accompany the lemon and red apple freshness on the nose and promise generosity. The palate, with its very lively froth, obliges and gives rounded, creamy notes of apple and yeast. There is a lovely backdrop of yeasty autolysis, rounded out with generous dosage. The finish is dry and fresh.
