A sharp sandalwood flavors comes through on the sip, along with poached apple, buttered toast and sea salt. It needs a touch more time to come together.

Earthier notes of earth and river rock blow off with aeration revealing a concentrated palate full of lip-smacking pink grapefruit, guava and tangerine. It's an electric penetrating wine balanced by delicate sweetness and a pristine mineral finish. Drink now through 2026.

Bursting with sunny tangerine and grapefruit flavors, this is a dry Riesling made from pristinely ripe grapes. It's a primary, fresh and fruity wine but nuanced by hints of dusty mineral. Briskly composed, it's marked by zesty lime-pith finish.

This Grenache-based wine has very ripe satisfying black-fruit flavors at its core and plenty of good acidity and firm tannins to balance them out. Blackberry, balsam, beef jus and a light touch of black pepper emerge as it opens in the glass.
This straightforward wine has red cherry, iris and green peppercorn aromas that carry over to easygoing palate, along with supple tannins. Enjoy soon to catch the fruit richness.

This sweet, full-bodied wine made by fortifying the fermenting must with brandy is rich with jammy black fruit flavors. Its tannins are finely integrated into the structure and sweet fruit. Drink now.
Light in color, this herbal and fruity wine is perfumed and delicate. It has red-currant flavors with pink-grapefruit touches, plenty of zesty acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink now.

Named after the owner's godmother, this unusual, perfumed blend of Syrah and Muscat is ripe with great fruitiness. Full of red berry and mango flavors, it's crisp, intense with acidity and full bodied. Drink now.

This opens with subtle dark-skinned berry, tilled soil and cooking spice aromas. The straightforward, easy-drinking palate offers fleshy black plum, nutmeg and white pepper hints alongside supple tannins. Drink soon.
This opens with cedar, baking spice and dark fruit aromas. The straightforward palate offers black plum, vanilla and tobacco flavors alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2020.

A rusty red color in the glass, this light but layered bottling shows dried cherry, pomegranate, carnation, hibiscus, cinnamon and vanilla-dusted toast on the nose. There is a strong grip to the palate, where flavors center on rose petal and Montmorency cherry, proving quite firm and yet delicate.

Aromas of red berry, underbrush and new leather form the nose on this full-bodied red. The firm palate delivers crushed raspberry, licorice and clove alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2022–2031.

From a large estate located in the western foothills of Paso Robles, this blend of 75% Grenache, 10% Syrah, 8% Mourvèdre and 7% Tannat shows dark mulberry, plum, elderflower and sandalwood on the nose. It's rich on the palate, with black plum, dried purple flowers and more elderflower touches.

This bottling has been a lighter, chillable red long before those wines came into vogue, and it's still a leading option. Aromas of smashed raspberries and white pepper drop into an energetic sip, where fresh cranberries, carnations and a zippy acidity reign.

A subtle hint of heady vanilla suggests the use of oak before ripe citrus notes take over on the nose. The palate then bursts open with generous notions of green and yellow apple and tapers towards a pure, lasting and serene note of lemon freshness. All this happens against a lovely backdrop of yeasty richness, still informed by that vanilla note. Lovely, balanced and moreish, it has a dry and lasting finish.

A rich, rounded entry starts off this voluptuous, layered and clove-spiced wine that offers length and breadth on the palate. Baked orange and cherry flavors exude warmth and complement tones of forest floor and white pepper.

Made with organically farmed Perricone grapes, this opens with aromas of raspberry jam, exotic spice, Mediterranean herb and star anise. The savory medium-bodied palate evokes prune, licorice and a dusting of mocha alongside a tight network of polished tannins. Drink through 2021.

Leathery cigar box and a thick, rich backbone of tannin and oaky char give this wine a robust definition and hearty quality. Entirely varietal, it comes from one steeply sloped block of the producer's hillside vineyard, and finishes in a dusting of chocolate and fig.

Wild and animalistic aromas start the nose of this bottling, with roasted lamb leading into tangy blank plum. The palate carries those meat jerky flavors as well, alongside roasted coffee and fresh purple flowers, making for a complex experience.

Mature orchard fruit, pressed spring blossom and a whiff of bread crust lift out of the glass. On the full-bodied savory palate, fresh acidity brightens mature yellow apple and nectarine alongside a steely mineral note.

Spring wild flower and yellow stone-fruit aromas take center stage on this bright linear white. The savory palate offers mature yellow peach, citrus peel and ripe apple set against fresh acidity. It closes crisp and clean.

Initial notes of earth and crushed vitamin blow off with aeration revealing plump but pristine blackberry and mulberry flavors. It's a lusciously rich wine but balanced by fresh acidity and firm, penetrating tannins. Enjoy this elegant, structured Grenache-blend now–2025.
Aromas of Jolly Rancher and licorice are followed by lighter-styled flavors that show a lot of wood influence. Green notes linger on the finish.

A blend of 55% Colombard and 45% Viognier, a pleasant floral character takes center stage on the nose, expressed in waves of jasmine, honeysuckle and orange blossom. The medium-weight mouth offers more fruity flavors of peach, melon and spiced orange, with soft acidity that tried to keep in all in check.

Black currant and elderberry aromas show on the overly ripe nose of this blend of 34% Merlot, 34% Cabernet Franc and 32% Sangiovese. Deep-black-fruit flavors meet with caramel, vanilla and balsamic vinegar on the palate.
Raspberry and red-berry aromas are clean and fresh, but nothing more. A rubbing tannic palate is scratchy, while this organic-grape Rioja provides generic berry flavors that finish with astringency.

Lavender-scented soap and talcum-powder aromas are light and airy. This brut nature feels austere and citric. Sour orange and melon flavors are a bit stale, while this tastes of underripe cantaloupe on the finish.
Hand soap, murky melon and red-fruit aromas precede a plump foamy palate. Red-berry flavors are good but average, while this tastes savory and salty on a briny finish.

Other than slight clonal variations in the three estate blends, there's little to differentiate the 2016 Pinots from Fairsing, at least at this young age. This has the same citrus component and wild blackberry fruit as the wine labeled Estate. Barrel aging for 10 months in 30% new French oak adds a touch of vanilla wafer.
This tense, dense wine is still young. Its pure line in acidity is emphasized by the concentration and strong minerality. Drink this wine from 2019.

Notes of wet slate, green apple and orange blossom perfume this delicately off-dry wine. The palate is juicy, offering a pristine citrus flavor that is accented by zesty acidity and a clean, mineral finish. While not a deeply concentrated wine, it is invigorating and thirst quenching.

This blend holds Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, the latter aged briefly in wood. The result is a generous wine, the acidity integrated into ripe apple flavors. It is fruity, still a young bottling and likely to benefit from a few more months of aging. Drink from 2019.

This half-stainless- and half-neutral-oak-fermented wine takes a gentle approach to this variety. The natural acidity and herbaceousness of Sauvignon Blanc is softened here with 10 g/L of residual sugar. The wine is round and fruity, with a mix of preserved lemon, white peach and pineapple. Drink slightly chilled.

It's often forgotten that Pinot Blanc is one of the permitted grapes in Champagne. Normally found in the Aube, it makes, as here, a wine softer than Chardonnay, with ripe white fruits and an open texture. This wine is attractive, fruity and ready to drink.

This wine has delightful aromas of red raspberry, black currant and black plum. It is a well-balanced blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Teran, with flavors of cassis, mocha and espresso that wash across the whole palate. The tannins are well balanced and the finish is smooth and persistent.

Subtle but alluring aromas of wild berry, fragrant blue flower and menthol come together on this. It's elegant and structured, evoking succulent Marasca cherry, orange zest, star anise and a flinty mineral note alongside polished tannins.

Smoky aromas and potent meaty earthy smoky flavors make a powerful statement for this full-bodied, concentrated and firmly tannic wine. It's one of those wild feral singed-sage wines that combines obviously intense grapey fruity flavors with other earthy influences.

Brawny and thick in richness, this wine evolves in the glass and softens, its tannins going from grippy to polished. Coconut and vanilla flavors emphasize the role of oak as blackberry gets jammy and seasoned in nutmeg and sage.

This lovely sparkler hits all the right buttons. It opens with delicate scents of pastry dough, wildflower and a whiff of Alpine herb. On the fresh, polished palate, an elegant mousse and bright acidity provide a smooth backdrop for yellow apple, lemon zest, bread crust and mineral. It has a juicy, bone-dry finish.

Ripe, full bodied and opulent, this wine also has the texture to age. With concentration and acidity balancing the fruits, it is complex, with freshness and richness working well together. Drink from 2020.
Delicious red-currant fruitiness shines from this crisp wine. With a bright, light texture, it's fresh, lively and ready to drink now.
This medium-bodied wine has straightforward herb and apple aromas joined by an earthy streak in the flavor. It's rather light in terms of concentration.

This wine's earthy, green aromas lead to a choppy palate with wiry acidity. The flavors are saucy, recalling mint, plums, berries and tomatoes. It finishes with herb and blaring oak notes, as well as a hint of scrambled egg and cheese.
This bright, off-dry wine has crisp and clean acidity as well as refreshing strawberry-like fruit. It's light, bright and ready to drink.
Made in the easygoing, medium-sweet style of many Vinhos Verdes, this is soft yet crisp, with orange and spice notes. It finishes with lemon sherbet flavors. Drink now.
There's a slight prickle to this soft, rounded wine. It has strawberry flavors, a zing of acidity and a bright, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

This wine's appealing cherry and plum aromas feature an oaky note suggestive of maple. It's medium in body, its spicy, oak-aided flavors of cherry and currant driven long into the finish by lively acidity. It ends with tobacco and chocolate notes. Drink through 2020.

The purity of fruit flavor in this medium-bodied wine is compelling to taste, and shines through in a focused way uncomplicated by noticeable oakiness. The wine is elegant, sleek in texture and redolent of red cherries all the way through a lingering finish.

From Cat Canyon vineyard and aged in neutral French oak, this bottling is tightly wound on the nose, with restrained aromas of white peach, nectarine, pineapple and lemon rind. There's a touch of almond paste to the sip, then come fresh lemon wedges and buttered nuts in the finish.

This blend of 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay brings big bubbles and bold flavors. Its cherry and berry fruit puts it squarely in a New World style, and it was sourced from some of the estate's oldest vines. A March 2016 disgorgement, it's drinking well at this time, finishing with a touch of dark chocolate.

This wine's berry and plum aromas come with a hint of Band-Aid. It's fresh and tight on the palate, with full tannins that don't go overboard. Dry, earthy plum and berry flavors are moderately oaky, finishing with woody and spicy red fruit notes

Sandalwood, black cherry, mulberry jam and campfire smoke show on the nose of this wine that's sourced from the Regan and Veranda vineyards. It's already showing a touch of age on the palate, with balsamic notes drizzled across the plump berry, white pepper and marjoram spices.
A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Muscadelle, this easily combines herbal flavors with an attractive riper, perfumed character. The wine is crisp, full of acidity and ready to drink.
This fresh, fruity wine has good acidity and soft tannins. The attractive juicy character partners with a backbone of tannins. Drink from 2020.
An attractive smoky aroma is followed by ripe tannins and juicy black-currant fruit. The wine is fresh and fruity, with gentle tannins that will soften soon. Drink from 2020.
This juicy, fruity wine from the André Lurton group offers attractive red fruits and plenty of acidity. It has a poised, light feel, crisp and lightly textured at the end. Drink from 2020.
Soft-textured and definitely fruity, this easy-going non-oaky wine is charming for its fresh raspberry aromas and red-fruit flavors. The texture is smooth and non-tannic.

Generic black fruit aromas are earthy and oaky. A crisp, smacking palate is short on body and stuffing, while this tastes tart and snappy, with tomato and herbal red plum flavors. A short, scouring finish is indicative of moderately ripe Merlot.

This is one of the best rosés tasted so far this year, starting with brilliant aromas of bubblegum, white peach, orange rind and crushed chalk. The palate is racy and zips across the tongue with lime and plum flesh flavors.

Very ripe notes of pear and peach dominate the nose, while the palate brims with freshness. The concentrated body has texture from the zestiness but also that background of ripe richness. It finishes completely dry, with a streak of mandarin on the long finish.

“Retro” may be winemaker Rich Cushman's reference to this wine's sweet style, since it clocks in at 24 g/L of residual sugar. It's a pungent take on the grape, with a piney aroma and massively concentrated fruit. Peach, apricot and papaya flavorscome into play, with balanced acidity. The finish is deep, pure and long.

Sweet herb aromas of oregano and tarragon mesh with exotic mulberry, plum and Luxardo cherry on the nose of this blend of 32% Syrah, 16% Grenache, 14% Petit Verdot, 12% Cabernet Franc, 12% Alicante Bouschet, 7% Cabernet Sauvignon and 7% Petite Sirah. That herbal intensity carries into the palate, where minty flavors decorate the background of plum fruit.

Feral aromas of leather and countryside make for a complex backdrop from which to enjoy this well-integrated wine's succulent black fruit, dried herb and clove. Full bodied, it's structured to age, dense from the vintage and appellation, yet softly layered in polished tannin.

There's lots for big red drinkers to like about this wine. It offers a mélange of licorice, plush dark berries, coffee and chocolate notes, with a prominent earthy core of something smoky and charred, like the dying embers of a campfire. It's full bodied but restrained, with a nice line of acidity and ultrafine sinewy and savory tannins. There's enough structure to back the juicy berry fruit. Drink 2020–2034.

Made from organically farmed grapes, this opens with subdued aromas of scorched earth and dark-skinned fruit. The straightforward palate shows ripe black plum, clove and orange peel touches alongside round tannins. Drink soon.

A Provence-pink look helps this powdery smelling Malbec rosé give off a sense of simple freshness. Nice acidity and good balance amp up the wine's palate, while this is citrusy in flavor, with a hint of red fruit.

El Origen is a reliable producer of this easygoing white wine. This bottling is fresh and clean on the nose, but not effusive. A tight palate has a grape-skin feel to it, while this offers citrus flavors mixed with salad-like bitter notes. A chalky finish is a good way for this to end.
This wine's black plum and baking spice aromas carry over to the straightforward palate, together with a touch of licorice. It's round and ready to drink thanks to soft tannins. Enjoy soon.

Musky earthy berry aromas come with a note of graphite. In the mouth, this is raw and lacks totality. Flavors of plum skins and grape skins are slightly oxidized and finish with herbal raspberry and currant notes.
Spicy bramble berry and cherry aromas are raspy on the nose. Light in body, with bright acidity and soft tannins, the palate is carried by a condensed cherry note.

Intense aromas of black fruit, savory meats and dried flowers provide a complex entry to the nose of this wine, which comes from vines planted in 1880. Buoyant acidity and ample structure uphold the palate, where bright flavors of blackberry and elderberry meet with mocha and anise.

A blend of 60% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has alluring, earthy aromas of new leather, tobacco and ripe black-skinned berry. On the smooth palate, fresh acidity brightens juicy raspberry, Marasca cherry, orange zest, star anise and eucalyptus. Polished tannins lend elegant support. Drink through 2025.

Fresh and forested, this wine has tannin weight and spice to match and complement buzzy acidity and ongoing freshness in the glass. With 35% new French oak, it allows the pomegranate-tangy fruit and Asian spice to take turns speaking.

From one of the oldest grape growing sites in New Zealand and from a relatively ripe, concentrated vintage, this wine shows all of the complex and intense fruit notes you would expect. A mélange of stone fruit and pineapple aromas are bolstered by touches of honey and butterscotch. The palate is creamy and full, but its life raft is the tangy, almost crunchy acidity. The finish is long and salty. Drink now–2023.

Two Paddocks's mid-range Pinot still plays very much in the premium league. Bright red berry, vanilla pod, black olive, drying herbs and bran muffin notes are underpinned by tightly wound tannins and a mineral streak amidst a silky texture. The contrast between the bright, crunchy fruit and the austerity of the tannins is intriguing, making this wine drinkable now, but suggesting that its best is yet to come. Drink now–2026.

Earthy berry, cocoa, oak spice, tobacco and herbal aromas are integrated on the nose. While this is thick and rich in feel, dense berry and spice flavors are compelling. A blend of multiple vintages of Valdivieso's best red-wine stock, it's dry, tannic and spicy on the finish. Drink now with thorough airing, or hold through 2030.
Crisp flavors of lemon and lime run through the cool, bright character of this wine. Its acidity is refreshing and cuts through a tangy fruit flavor, giving the wine great lift. Drink now.

The medium-dry blend favors the Gewürztraminer portion, with a spicy character around fruit flavors of fresh peaches. The sweetness is moderate, but the wine falls a bit flat in the mouth. Drink up over the next year.

This is a straightforward and juicy wine, with pleasant notes of red plum and cherry that are accented by hints of sweet spice and iris petal. The palate is fresh and vibrant, with a subtle saline character, medium acidity and soft, integrated tannins.
This is a thickly constructed white that tastes sweet in vanilla and mango, a big expression of the variety that opts for richness over freshness.
An earthy barnyardy aroma gives way to flavors like tamarind and dried cherries in this funky but interesting wine. Medium body and moderate tannins give it some weight on the palate.
Apple aromas and a hint of fresh bread are the best parts of the nose. This is cidery and soda-like on the palate. Yeasty apple flavors finish short.

The lovely ripe pear and fresh white currant notes on the nose of this wine continue with subtle fruitiness on the slender, fresh palate. There's a slight, pleasant edge of distant smoke that, alongside vivid lemon freshness, adds to the concentrated flavors.

Delicate scents reminiscent of white spring flower, Alpine herb and pear appear in the glass. On the bright palate, refreshing acidity accompanies mature apple, peach, wild fennel and citrus. A note of flint gives it a crisp, clean close.

Thick and chocolatey, this wine is voluptuously lush and big in style, with unctuous waves of baked plum and dark cherry. Dusty crushed rock and earth lie beneath the bold fruit, finishing moderately in length.

This wine goes for crispness, with some attractive acidity and lemon flavors. In the background, the honey and botrytis give weight. The aftertaste is all about sweet freshness. Drink this Siozard brothers' wine from 2019.

This is a large-production wine that spares no attention to detail or quality. Winemaker Randy Ullom created an expression of thick, rich, grippy power that's available for an attractive price. Baked plum, clove, mountain sage and black cherry all figure into the mix, with a lasting touch of mocha on the lengthy finish.

Black-plum and cherry flavors are pleasantly plump and juicy here but edged by savory undertones of garrigue and fresh moss. Full bodied and richly concentrated, it's an elegant but forward, fruity wine to enjoy now–2026.

A whole-cluster pressed white aged in both French oak and stainless steel, this wine is richly woven in lemon verbena, pineapple, quince and grapefruit, its structure complex, lengthy and moderate in acidity.

The rich spice of maple syrup makes a fleeting appearance on the fresh apple-driven nose. The palate foams with the finest mousse of creamy bubbles and smooths all the lemon and apple freshness into a joyous unity. This is fresh, apple-driven, lemony and very refreshing. The finish is dry and utterly mouthwatering.

Fermented in a clay amphora and then aged partly in wood, this fascinating wine is packed with fruit. It has a richer character than its alcohol would suggest, dense and ripe but with only the lightest of tannins. Drink this already delicious wine now, but better from 2019.

The pear notes on the nose are clothed in vanilla-scented creaminess. The palate has a similar richness and a mellow smooth feel that couches subtly sweet pear fruit and a pleasantly bitter phenolic richness. All of this is countered with lemony brightness which defines and freshens. This rich rounded wine has a medium-sweet finish. Drink now through 2025.

A touch of melon joins the fruity hints of Mirabelle plum and red apple on the nose. The palate joins these red-apple flavors and adds lots of rich creaminess to them. Autolysis is expressed as rich shortbread, always tempered by zesty lemon. This shows a lovely, fruity and yeasty balance with such appetizing creaminess from the fine fizz. It is lovely and classic, with a dry finish.

Ripe yellow apple and a vanilla dominate the nose. This richness continues on the palate, with its full flavor and gently fizzing bubbles. It's a rich and rounded, yet dry and fresh wine. Consider this with food rather than as an aperitif. Lovely now, it is sure to evolve. Drink now–2025.

A pale coppery pink color, this opens with scents of strawberry hull, watermelon rind, pomegranate pith and a touch of toasted biscuit. There's a pleasant plushness to the mouthfeel, thanks to a creamy mousse and bright red-fruit flavors, but it's balanced by ample acidity and lime-like acidity that shines on the finish.
designation: Twee Jonge Gezellen Vintage Rosé Cuvée Brut Méthode Cap Classique

description: Made from vines planted in 1843, Langmeil turns out a full throttle, unmistakably Barossa red. Familiar notes of ripe red and black fruit, chocolate and peppery spice carry to a silken palate with a toasty line of oak.

This has enticing aromas of tobacco, spiced plum, exotic spice and balsamic notes. The brawny, concentrated palate offers steeped prune, black cherry extract and licorice alongside fine-grained, velvety tannins. You'll also notice the heat of alcohol that throws the finish off balance. Drink through 2024.

Made from 100% Pommard clone grapes, this flavorful wine comes front loaded with broad streaks of cherry cola, vanilla and Kahlua. Half was made in stainless, half in French oak. After that initial burst the wine seems to tail off rather quickly, leaving drying tannins.
Smooth, well balanced and lightly fruity, this light-bodied wine offers peach and cantaloupe flavors, with a supple texture and just enough acidity for freshness.

Fantastically seductive in aromatics of brambly blackberry and chocolate, the flavors continue along the same theme, dotted in vanilla. Thick, dense and richly ripe, this wine packs a powerful punch and lingers in creamy texture on the finish.
This robust and powerfully concentrated wine is thick in tannin yet pretty in rose petal and strong flavors of black cherry, strawberry puree and tangerine. For fans of a bigger style, it delivers.

Blended with 14% Petite Sirah from a planting that dates back to 1904, this wine is smoky in oak and brightly fresh in black cherry and blackberry fruitiness. Focused on the palate, it's robust yet balanced and enjoyable.

Half-and-half Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon, this warm, structured wine made from old vines is just ready to drink. Its tannins, from two naturally tannic grapes, are now integrated into the black-currant fruit.

Rich both in fruit and in toast flavors, this wine is mature, with rich spice, almonds and hints of more youthful yellow and apple fruits. A ripe wine, it keeps plenty of mineral acidity and great concentration. Drink now.

A little wood aging never did Encruzado any harm. Here, it brings out the rich creaminess of the wine along with toastiness. Just enough acidity adds a crisp edge without detracting from the richness. Drink from late 2018.

Named after the clay and limestone soil of the vineyard, this wine is broad and rich. The dry core of tannins has now merged with the jammy black fruits. This wine is full of ripe tones and ready to drink now.
Sweet in plum, vanilla and brown sugar, this wine is raisiny, soft and somewhat unstructured.
Light and easy, this offers softly spiced plum and cherry tones throughout the nose and mouth. The palate is clean and direct, with fleeting tannins and a light, tart-fruit accent on the close.
This wine's cidery nose and watery, spritzy palate announce a generic white wine with sea brine and lemon water flavors. It has a short but tangy finish.
This medium-bodied pop-style wine has jammy aromas and very ripe, lightly sweet fruit flavors that leave a candied taste on the tongue.
Candy pink in color, this is a soft wine. Its caramel and spice are balanced with the red-currant fruits to give an easy, open wine that is ready to drink.

This is a very tight and tannic wine for a varietal that's often considered the lighter relative of Cabernet Sauvignon. It is bone dry, has red and black-cherry flavors, full body and dramatic palate-gripping tannins that leave an astringent aftertaste.

Aromas of rose petals and punchy but generic citrus fruits lead to a chunky palate with good acidity. Flavors of citrus skin and lime show a slight herbal green side, while this is plump but balanced on the finish.

Sourdough and white fruit aromas are comported. Moderate acidity means the palate on this brut reserva is good but not clearly defined. Apple and lime flavors are slightly green in front of a finish that barely registers.
Bright, lightly textured and with good acidity, this wine offers citrus and green-plum flavors. A good touch of minerality gives the wine extra shape. Drink now.
Quite light in the glass, this twist-top bottling shows hints of hibiscus, cranberry and damp herbs on the nose. The palate offers tart flavors of tomato and orange rind, lifted by fresh herbs.

Dominated by Chardonnay, this tight and textured wine is still young, giving it bright acidity, a strong mineral texture and a zesty aftertaste. It is going to develop well, bringing in richness from the Pinot Noir and more yeasty characters from the Chardonnay. Drink this ageworthy wine from 2020.

Mediterranean brush, wild berry, menthol and baking spice aromas take center stage in this fragrant red. Linear and elegantly structured, the lithe palate evokes black cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and white pepper alongside bright acidity and refined tannins. A savory mineral note lingers on the finish.

The nose is shy but the palate reveals a superclean, dry body with the restrained richness of ripe pear fruit. Concentration, drive, power and sappiness are all contained in this energetic bundle of wine. Lovely now, it's sure to develop. Drink now–2028.

Faint lemon and citrus foliage on the nose become fleshed with ripe, juicy yellow apple and Mirabelle plum on the palate. The ripeness of these vivid fruit is always suffused with lemon that brightens and defines them. The finish is whistle-clean and dry.

Zesty, lemony purity is evident from the start. The nose brims with lemon and the palate makes it shine even more. This freshness has a counterpoint in tangy concentration that shimmers with tropical hints of passion fruit. The finish is pure, crystalline and lasting.

Lifted notes of stone, chamomile and a touch of petrol hint at some development. The palate is fluid and fresh but also has started on its evolving trajectory. Mild but dry, this is a very concentrated, maturing Riesling from a warm vintage with almost balm-like qualities. Lovely now, it's sure to continue evolving. Drink now–2028.

Red cherry and spicy raspberry meet with earthy stems on the nose, while the palate is more straightforward in its juicy red-fruit nature. It's light in feel, with driving acidity and a dusting of tannins. Best enjoyed with a meal, like smoked duck.

A mild concentration of cherry, raspberry and white pepper marks the nose. Light in weight and supported by soft tannins, the palate brings juicy cherry to the fore, with a pleasing grip of black pepper adding texture. Enjoy with a slight chill on a hot summer's day.

Underbrush, scorched earth and mature black-skinned fruit aromas take center stage in this. The straightforward palate offers dark berry and star anise hints alongside polished, not very persistent tannins.

Cedar, vanilla and dark-skinned fruit aromas lead the nose of this wine while the straightforward palate offers black plum, star anise and tobacco hints. It's easy-drinking and ready, with pliant tannins. Drink soon.
Full bodied and very ripe tasting, this bold wine is packed with plum and raisin flavors and supported by moderate tannins that add grip to the texture.
This is a hearty, mouthfilling and amply fruity wine (in a beautifully jacketed bottle) that is scented like strawberries and tastes like cherries, and has a touch of sweetness on the finish.

From a small parcel of vines, this dense wine is solid with dark tannins. Still young and exhibiting dark coffee and licorice flavors, it has a touch of extraction that leaves a bitter aftertaste. In the future this edginess will soften to give a rich, full and firmly balanced wine with great final acidity. Drink from 2023.

This wine is big and bold, offering a ripe black-fruit aroma along with complex nuances of black olive, sage and black pepper. These tones carry to the full-bodied palate and are supported by a firm tannic structure. Drink after 2022.

This wine is still young, with hints of richness behind its currently tight structure. It has plenty of acidity as well as ripe yellow and white stone-fruit flavors that are lifted by hints of spice from wood aging. This wine has plenty of the aristocratic character of a fine Puligny-Montrachet.

This wine is big but balanced as it delivers copious amounts of ripe fruit flavor, full body and tasty accents of black pepper and sage to convey that brambly brushy personality of Zin. Some of that spiciness can be attributed to aging for 20 months in 50% new oak barrels.

Dried red cherry, wild thyme, sagebrush and an underlying hint of game show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard first planted more than four decades ago. The palate is herbaceous at first before delivering flavors of roast pork in a mulberry-thyme sauce.

Harmonious and beautifully integrated, this supple and flavorful wine feels seamless and tastes rich, complex and complete. The palate subtly combines flavors of ripe apple and pear with hints of honey, butter and vanilla.

Ripe modern aromas of black fruits and fine oak set up a flush palate with density and smooth tannins. Chocolaty oak flavors are wrapped around blackberry and plum notes, while this is savory tasting and doesn't hammer away on the finish. Drink this excellent Tempranillo through 2025.

A hint of Mirabelle plum plays on the nose before becoming fully fledged on the medium-sweet palate. This flows with a stone fruit flavor that is always tempered by lemon freshness. It's smooth, rounded and fruit-driven, with a medium-sweet finish.

This fascinating wine blended from five Rhône grape varieties—both red and white—has enough character and body to pass as a full-fledged red, and in fact the color is much deeper than most rosés today. A plethora of plums and raspberries fill the aroma and spread richly across the palate.

A selection in the vineyard is the basis of this powerful wine. Rich in tannins as well as fruit, it has a dense texture, the weight and concentration showing the wine needs aging. It has a rich future; drink from 2023.

With the combination of the two potentially tannic grapes, Malbec and Tannat, it's hardly surprising that this is a powerfully dense wine. At the same time, the juicy and jammy fruits are enticing, indicating the wine's richness. Drink from 2022.

Red-plum, pomegranate and wild-berry aromas make for a potpourri of fruit on the nose of this Malbec from gravelly soils in the Altamira district of the Uco Valley. A tight sinewy palate is structured, while this deals a hardy mix of plum and berry flavors with no interference from oak. A racy tight finish is mildly astringent. This should benefit from more time in the cellar. Drink from 2019–2030.

Peach candies and pineapple slices form the nose of this ripe wine, though with only moderate intensity. The lean palate shows more restraint, with tart plum and lime flavors that finish zippy and mouth-puckering.

Mild white-fruit aromas are more neutral and stolid than expressive. A simple palate holds flavors of mustard and briny citrus fruits. On the finish, this sparkler made from Hondarrabi grapes holds onto those same mustardy briny flavors.

Briny white-fruit aromas include a bready note along with grassy scents. On the palate, this brut is foamy and shaky in terms of its structure and build. Cidery apple and pickled flavors do nothing on the finish.

Melon flesh, orange supreme and snappy red-currant scents form the nose of this rosé. Made from 40% Cinsault, 40% Grenache and 20% Syrah, it boasts round flavors of strawberry and cantaloupe that finish with moderate length, bolstered by just enough acidic lift.
Ripe and soft, this strawberry-flavored wine has richness and only light acidity, giving it a fat character although the fruitiness compensates Drink now.
Red plum and cherry tones are coupled with a malted milk-ball accent on the nose of this gluggable Pinot. Soft in tannins, it's juicy and approachable, with a short but clean finish.
Milk chocolate, roasted coffee bean, black cherry and generous barrel spice aromas lead to supple, well-balanced fruit and barrel flavors in this wine. It shows pleasing nuances.

Fragrant spring flower, tropical fruit and white peach aromas practically jump out of the glass. Fresh and savory, the medium-bodied palate doles out apricot, green apple, citrus and a hint of white almond alongside bright acidity.
Spring flower, white stone fruit and bread crust aromas glide over to the elegant medium-bodied palate along with a hint of honeydew melon and white peach. A citrus note lingers on the tangy finish.
Aromas of ginger, candied orange zest and chamomile flower emerge from the glass. On the enveloping palate, notes of eucalyptus honey, fig and sweet almond accent a core of ripe apricot.

Grapefruit peel and yeast notes mingle with fresh Conference pear on the nose of this wine. The palate takes all this fruit and adds a salty savoriness reminiscent of white pepper and soy sauce. The finish is full-flavored, long and dry, with refreshing, savory moreishness.

This bubbly pink blend is one of the better canned wines on the market, regardless of style. A blend of 57% Grenache, 18% Grenache Blanc with bits of Mourvèdre, Roussanne, Carignan and Cinsaut, it shows rounded watermelon, nectarine and grapefruit-rind aromas on the nose. The palate is crisp with strawberry, melon, red-apple and tart plum-skin flavors.
designation: La Bulle-Moose de Cigare Fizzy Pink of the Earth

description: This is a very solid Cab for the price, starting with aromas of roasted blackberries, black plums and oak. There is fairly prominent tannic structure on the palate, presenting flavors of roasted plums and berries and a hint of coffee.
This is a sturdy, well-balanced wine, with supportive tannins and refreshing acidity that carries ripe flavors of blackberry and black cherry. It will be just the thing for a steak, roast or stew.

Chunky berry aromas are spicy and dense, but a touch flat. On the palate, this Crianza is smacking, with lively acidity. Plum and berry flavors are generic but good, while this toes the same flavor line on a solid finish. Drink through 2019.

This pure Pommard clone offering has a lightly leathery scent, and a nice mix of marionberry fruit and baking spices. Though tasters vary as far as likes/dislikes regarding Brett, there's a trailing bitterness here and a sense that this would be best consumed while it's young.

Aromas of dark berry, grilled herb and whiffs of toast come to the forefront. Made mostly with Nero d'Avola, the firm palate offers espresso, blackberry jam and black pepper alongside assertive tannins. It finishes on a star anise note.

Made predominantly with Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, baking spice and Mediterranean brush. The easygoing, juicy palate doles out ripe Morello cherry, licorice and star anise alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2021.
Reduced with a strong grasp of oak, this wine has powerful concentration and body, a mix of dried herb and cedar that tangles with dark chocolate, brown sugar and blackberry cobbler richness.
Durant's Dove is a fine-boned wine, with crushed rose and red plum aromas. On the palate, expect cherry pastry-like flavors that persist into a rich, full and nicely textured finish.

Damask rose and honeysuckle play on the nose. On the palate they perfume mandarin and peach notes, pervaded by sweet citrus zestiness. This wine manages to be light bodied, textured, off dry and zesty at the same time, and displays exquisite balance all though the long, lively finish.

Foresty berry aromas and a hint of olive stick out on the nose of this rugged Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Petit Verdot blend. Spicy blackberry, mint and herbal flavors play out on the crisp finish, with herb and lemon notes.

Enticing scents of hawthorn, Spanish broom, Mediterranean brush and a whiff of the sea escape out of the glass. On the palate, flinty mineral accents yellow pear, citrus and a honey note while toasted hazelnut graces the close.

Delicate aromas of toasted hazelnut, citrus peel and wild flower lift out of the glass. The linear elegant palate delivers crushed herb, yellow apple, almond and savory mineral set against crisp acidity.

This wine's bold but generic set of black fruit aromas is both familiar and pleasing. It's intense and fully saturated on the palate, with focused, ripe berry flavors backed by dark, toasty power. Drink through 2022.

This blend across different regions of Portugal celebrates the voyages of Portuguese explorers in the 15th and 16th centuries. It is a juicy, ripe wine, well structured and rich. With warm red fruits and balanced acidity, this smooth wine can be enjoyed now.

This blend of 66% Cabernet Sauvignon (from two different vineyards) and 34% Zinfandel shows reduced strawberry and fig juice on the nose as well as cola, pepper and baked earth aromas. It's pleasantly smooth on the palate, offering baked plums, stewed raspberries and woody herbal qualities of thyme and peppercorn.
This wine's punchy grapefruit, pyrazine and oak aromas seem unripe. On the palate, it's citrusy and and crisp, with creamy oak, citrus peel and green banana flavors.
This slightly raisiny Garnacha-Syrah blend leads with prune and soft raspberry aromas. It has a rubbery texture and generic plum and wood spice flavors that spread out across the finish.

This Merlot's herbal berry aromas are tinged with brett and vinegar. It's tannic on the palate, without the body to support that kind of edginess. Its plum and currant flavors are grassy and green, and its tannins are scratchy.
This is a decent-quality wine with medium body, rather earthy cherry flavors and a reasonably smooth texture.
A chocolaty sweetness pervades this medium-bodied, smooth-textured and oaky wine. It adds grape jam to the chocolate flavors and has a soft mouthfeel.
This second label wine from Leda smells flat, raisiny and overripe. A soupy, heavy palate follows the nose, delivering stewed berry and raisin flavors. Stewed fruit and cinnamon notes mark the close.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

description: Kimmeridge chalk, named after a village in Dorset in southern England, is the principal soil type in Chablis. This wine, although a Burgundy appellation, celebrates the soil with its mineral edge among all the ripe yellow fruits and acidity. Drink the wine now.
This wine is textured and tight with a strong sense of minerality. The texture is backed by crisp apple and lemon-zest flavors to give a fruity wine ready to drink.
Dry spice and woody aromas blend with plum and berry scents. This Carmenère feels chunky and solid. Woody, herbal plum and savory spice flavors end with varietally typical herbal green notes.

Barnyard and berry aromas are piercing but lack elegance. A thick, wide palate is a bit shapeless and lacking in framework. Burnt berry flavors are a bit herbal and green, while the finish is a bit chalky and tannic.

Rubbery berry aromas have a whiff of compost. On the palate, this is fairly raw and biting; midpalate cushion is nonexistent. Blackened flavors of grilled meat and peppery oak dominate this hard Carmenère from a tough vintage for Chile.

Aromas of orange blossoms, lemon peels and yellow apples are pleasant on the nose. The palate offers ripe orange, lime juice and lime leaves, but the dry finish is astringent and sweeps away those juicy citrus flavors.

This crisp, fruity wine is produced by the Angelvin family of Saint-Tropez from old parcels of Grenache and Mourvèdre. Its red-berry and pineapple flavors are light, bright and lifted by lively acidity. Drink the wine now.

Spicy dry aromas of plum and cherry are classy and traditional. A tight and crisp palate feels lemony due to high acidity, while this tastes of dry salty plum and currant. Oak spice, clove and cocoa flavors settle in on a woody finish.

Spanish broom, acacia and ripe orchard fruit aromas slowly emerge from this wine. On the bright palate, a bitter almond note underscores nectarine and yellow apple flavors. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.

This medium-bodied wine smells at first like toasted garlic and dried herbs, but it develops complexity and good fruit flavors after airing in the glass and then it deepens with each sip. It's supported by a very lively crisp texture.
This wine's Spanish broom and apricot aromas follow over to the rounded palate, together with yellow peach and citrus notes. A hint of bitter almond marks the close.

This orange-red tinted Cabernet opens with spice notes and the scent of apple skins. A wide yet balanced palate is ultimately basic, while this tastes of briny red fruits, earthy spices and tomato sauce. On the finish, this holds onto its saucy character, making it a food-friendly rosé.

Silky and bright, this refined sparkler has delicate, enticing scents of yellow pear, chopped herb and bread crust. On the bone-dry palate, crisp acidity lifts juicy lemon, creamy white peach and a hint of ginger while a silky mousse adds softening finesse.

Whispers of sweet spice and vanilla juxtapose mineral tones of smoke and ash in this intensely blackberried wine. It's rich and lavishly mouthfilling, with a rounded, supple texture augmented by layers of soft, feathery tannins. Approachable already but should improve through 2028.

Ripe and structured, this is a rich, juicy wine from Jean-Remi Larrat's small estate. Its bold, mainly Merlot fruits integrate well with the full, tannic structure. The wine has weight and potential. Drink from 2021.

Powerful ripe fruits and rich tannins come together in this jammy Merlot with a dark texture. Packed with spice, berry flavors and toasty wood aging accents, the wine is still young. It needs time for the impressive fruit to come through, so drink from 2022.

This wine comes from one of the cooler premier crus and that shows in the enhanced acidity and crisp texture. That gives a taut wine with some of the steely minerality associated with Chablis. It makes for a delicious, refreshing wine that will be ready from 2020.

This full-bodied red is intensely ripe, offering luscious black cherry flavor marked by savory nuances of black olive, spice and smoked meat. It's juicy yet firmly edged by fine, persistent tannins and fresh acidity. Should improve through 2026 and hold a few years longer.
Light and attractive, this wine offers crisp apple and citrus flavors. It's just off dry and has a good tang. Drink now.
This easy and spicy wine is dominated by black fruits, with touches of toast and tannin. It is ready to drink.
Earthy berry aromas are also chocolaty. In the mouth, this fails obedience school and comes across as raw and assaulting. Spicy, herbal plum flavors stay around on a rough drying finish.
The 50% of Malvasia in this wine gives it a perfumed character to balance the crisper citrus flavors and hints of tropical fruits. It is light and is ready to drink.

A dark color translates to chunky aromas of stone fruits and grape skins. This full-bodied Garnacha rosé delivers odd peachy flavors that break down and show mild bitterness. A wayward unfocused finish is not a surprise.

A pale copper-pink color, this is light and dainty in character, with barely there aromas and flavors of white cranberry, strawberry hull and lemon pith. The zippy palate is prickly and mouthwatering, with a brisk, short finish.

Made entirely with Nebbiolo, this opens with aromas of tobacco, dark berry and tilled soil. The firm palate offers red-skinned berry, cooking spice and a touch of licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

A peppery, herbaceous aroma and savory spicy flavors make this full-bodied wine, grown at high elevation, a bit edgy but full of personality. The flavors, at first, resemble grilled fruit and beef juices, then ripe black plums flow in, complementing a texture that is firm and moderately tannic.

A touch of reduction still colors the pear and yeast notes on the nose of this wine. The palate is dominated by leesy notes of yeast and the textural backdrop they create, framing some lovely bright lemon notes. That textural pleasure lasts all the way to the refreshing, dry finish.

Intriguing aromas of crushed herb, fragrant wild flower and ripe white stone fruit take center stage on this tangy white. On the linear palate, chopped mint, white pepper and a flinty mineral vein underscore yellow apple and lemon zest.

This opens with heady scents of spring wild flower, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of crushed stone. Medium bodied and savory, the palate offers ripe green apple, creamy white peach and a note of pineapple set against bright acidity. A hint of nut wraps up the finish.

Pristine fruit and savory, earthen complexities set this full-bodied, plush Lirac apart from its peers. Rich but crisp black-cherry and mulberry flavors have an elevated edge of acidity as well as integrated complexities of green olive, granite and dried herb. The finish is moderately long, marked by ripe but firm, grippy tannins. Enjoy now–2023.

Immensely fresh and intense on the nose, aromas of apple, dried chamomile, sea spray and lime zest kick off this wine. Fermented and aged in tonneaux, this has some textural roundness on the palate yet searing acidity keeping it fresh and persistent. There are plenty of ripe fruit flavors to maintain balance, but give this another few years in bottle to help soften the acidity and it will find its sweet spot. Drink from 2020.

Rooty berry aromas include notes of raisin, licorice and herbs. A thick chunky palate is chewy and dense. Flavors of stewed berry fruits, mocha and chocolate finish with a blast of oak and coffee along with herbal hints and firm residual tannins. Drink through 2022.

Candied boysenberry fruit, dried sagebrush, pepper spice and a pinch of purple flowers show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate combines earthy and herbal tones of bay leaf and pine needle with black-plum flavors, wrapped in tense tannins.

Crisp and creamy in Meyer lemon meringue and grapefruit, this lovely white also has flavors of red cherry and is acid-driven, with ample body to complement the freshness. It finishes in a lingering taste of wet stone.

Deep and hearty in the glass, this built-to-last bottling shows black currant, roasted coffee, cocoa powder, new leather and cola on the nose. Chiseled yet sticky tannins and powerful acidity frame the palate, where dark-berry, root-beer and chocolate flavors reign. Drink 2021–2034.

Underbrush, leather, menthol and crushed herb aromas waft out of the glass. It's full bodied and structured, offering dried cherry, cranberry, star anise and clove set against assertive fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. It's still youthfully austere and will benefit with more bottle age. Drink 2024–2034.

Light aromas of pear cider and lemon rinds show on the nose of this bottling, which is one of the more popular bubblies from the Central Coast. The palate offers dried apples and apple-cider flavors, with a touch of earthy dust.
designation: Cork Jumper Rosé Blanc de Noirs

description: This is a very floral wine, with tight fruit and a mineral edge that contrasts with the layer of spirit and black fruits. The wine is in a light style, fruity while also structured. Drink from 2026.

Made by the Sanguinhal team at another estate owned by the same family, this wine is spicy, firm with dry tannins, and with black-coffee and black-fruit flavors. Its richness will allow this wine to age well and it will be ready from 2020.

Ripe orange pith, tight apple flesh, lemon rind and sandalwood aromas show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from a property in the Corralitos area. There is a fine line of lime set against roasted apple and seared lemon on the palate, with toasty flavors on the finish.

Blackberry, black licorice and campfire aromas lead to a fleshy palate that's full but with gaps. Blackberry, dark plum and cassis flavors are standard for quality Malbec from Mendoza, while this is chocolaty on a finish that doesn't evolve.
Pure Chardonnay gives a tight edge to the otherwise warm, rich fruitiness of this wine. Acidity integrates with the ripe yellow fruits to give a rich Champagne that is ready to drink now.

This wine's near-equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec saw just a touch (15%) of new oak. The aromas draw you into the glass, evoking plums, cloves, dried herbs and spices. Its ripe, full, soft fruit flavors coat the palate, extending into a warm finish. It exudes a lovely sense of purity.

This wine's fresh, ripe pear flavor is accented by touches of tart orange and lemon peel. Though technically dry, it has enough residual sugar to gently round off its youthful edges and keep the alcohol rather low.

This is a flavorful wine that combines vivid fruit flavors and judicious use of oak for a great sense of balance and composition. Butter, vanilla and pear aromas precede almond and baking spice flavors that are nicely backed by more pear and apple.

This lovely wine is full, firm and bursting with lightly spicy strawberry fruit. Its concentrated midpalate brings a light dusting of cinnamon flavor that carries into the clean, fresh finish that trails off gracefully.

This wine is rich, packed with red and citrus fruits and with a taut, nervy texture. A recent bottling, it needs to age to bring out the ripe fruits and calm the acidity. Then it will be a full wine, lightly structured and delicious. Drink from 2019.

A touch of crushed fennel seed plays about the lemon-zest nose. The palate bursts open with bright lemon freshness and verve. Although the body is slender it brims with zesty citrus. Totally refreshing, it has a dry finish.

This wine's sharp tropical fruit, citrus and generic green aromas scream Chilean Sauvignon Blanc. Its lean, citric palate is more hollow than substantive, with sour tangerine and lemon notes and a tart, pointy finish.
Lemon and grapefruit notes are slightly overwhelmed by vegetal ones: tomato leaf, lettuce and wet green leaves. The palate is crisp but balanced with a touch of residual sugar.
This wine's furry berry aromas bring a wet dog to mind. It's at once creamy and acidic on the palate, with chocolaty oak and gamy, herbal berry flavors. It finishes with a lasting note of carob.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

description: This offers mild citrus, green apple and melony aromas. The palate is soft, flat and marked by low intensity. Its tropical fruit and green herb flavors finish mildly bitter, with fleshy weight and little sizzle.
This wine's oily lemon aromas suggest floor polish. It's a bit flat, with briny citrus flavors and green, vegetal notes. The lemony finish turns slightly bitter as it fades away.
This wine's jammy raspberry and plum aromas are stretched thin. The palate is soft, lacking acidity. Strawberry and cassis flavors lead to an herb-laced finish.

For a white wine, this one has almost the feel of a big red. It shows a deep, gold color, lots of body, a gripping texture and flavors that are much more savory and nutty than simply fruity. It should open up and get more interesting with time. Best after 2020.
While this wine is certainly sweet, it is never cloying. The marvelous acidity of the Petit Manseng sees to that. It is crisp as well as honeyed, with a zesty character at the end.

This Sauvignon Blanc from coastal Leyda Valley boasts crisp, pure citrus and oceanic aromas. It's tight and firm on the palate, with citrus, sea salt and green herb flavors that finish smooth and round despite bold acidity.

This is made in an especially leesy, mineral-drenched style, which sets it apart from the vast majority of new world Sauvignon Blancs. Its immaculate lime skin, grapefruit, pineapple and fresh herb flavors combine in a most refreshing way.

This wine underwent a vineyard change this vintage; the fruit now comes from 1979 plantings at Upland. The aromas pop, recalling scooped cantaloupe, ripe pear, red apple and freshly sliced star fruit, with intriguing salinity. Simultaneously sleek and textured fruit flavors lead to an acid-driven finish.
Part of a series of wines showcasing single grape varieties, this highlights the perfumed character of Shiraz. Richly fruity, it's softly textured with supple tannins and is ready to drink.

Aromas of lemon oil and citrus blossom are wrapped in an herbal haze on the nose of this Sauvignon Blanc that's blended with 23% Chenin Blanc and 1% each of Marsanne and Viognier. The palate is dry and astringent, with spry lemon-lime acidity and flavors of ripe apple, blossoms and a whisper of salinity.
Light aromas of cherry, vanilla and spice lead to full-bodied fruit flavors backed by dry, grippy tannins that come off as quite aggressive out of the gate but calm down a bit with a day open.
Floral and herbal, this wine offers bright, persistent acidity around a full-bodied embrace of ripe peach and pineapple.

Blueberry and black raspberry aromas are slightly overripe on the nose. The palate remains ripe in feel, with baked blueberry and tart cranberry. Oaky tones add weight and dusty tannins quickly sweep in, somewhat smothering the flavors. The finish is mild and slightly bitter.
The aromas of this medium-bodied wine overflow with apples and peaches, and the flavors are crisp, fruity and clean. The mouthfeel is rather rich for the varietal and backed by a nip of good acidity.

This white offers aromas of white flowers, orange peels, apricots and peaches that mingle with notes of grass and white pepper. The palate has a creamy mouthfeel, rounding out flavors of lemonade, white peach juice, lemon balm and gooseberry. The orange oil finish has a faint bitter lime edge.

A very rare rosé of Tannat, this botling from the Bella Collina Vineyard is rather dark in the glass and shows aromas of carnation, cherry and black-plum juice. The flavors are very plummy and show a bit of baking spice as well.
This has tilled earth, cooking spice and dark fruit aromas. The straightforward palate offers clove, tobacco and black plum touches alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
Dark fruit and tilled soil aromas emerge from this wine. The straightforward palate offers red plum and star anise notes alongside round tannins. Drink soon.
Tight, integrated oak forms around a core of pineapple, sweet vanilla and pear in this robust, full-bodied white. Richly textured and layered, it satisfies in its boldness and lush, plush toastiness.
This wine's dark fruit, cooking spice and incense aromas emerge from the glass. The lively palate offers sour cherry, citrus zest and star anise notes alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
This assertive and earthy wine is crisp and nervy, showing lively herb, wet stone and citrus aromas, crisp apple and lemon flavors and a texture that's firmed up by good fruit acidity.

A blend of 75% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 5% Mourvèdre from vines spanning 40 to 50 years in age, this is a deeply concentrated wine offering layers of luscious black cherry and pomegranate flavors. It's supple and silky on the palate with ripe, smooth tannins and a hint of caramelized sugar that lingers on the finish. Ready now but should gain complexity through 2028.

Four generations of the Fourrey family have produced wine in Chablis. This latest vintage hails from one of their top parcels. Its crispness contrasts well with the weight and mineral texture of this young wine. Good acidity and a tangy texture indicate a good future. Drink from 2020.

This ripe and smooth wine is full of rich red fruits. At the same time, great tannins and structure give an excellent potential. The wine is balanced already, with good acidity at the end. Drink from 2023.

Aromas of toasted bread, chamomile and a whiff of dried aromatic herb follow over to the elegant, structured palate along with mature yellow apple and a hint of citrus zest. A creamy perlage provides the backdrop while a hazelnut note lingers on the finish.

This is a soft, well-integrated and moderately tannic wine, juicy in brawny black fruit and smoked meat. It offers a dusting of tannins that are offset by the fruit flavors, finishing with aspects of lavender, licorice and black pepper.

Next to the line of Grand Cru vineyards, this premier cru is one of the finest. This wine has minerality, a steely edge and a chalky character. These are allied to the ripe fruits that hint of apricot and offer both richness and crisp freshness. Drink this wine from 2021.

Juicy and plush but pertly balanced, this full-bodied rosé offers sun-kissed strawberry and sour-cherry flavors offset by crisp acidity and an elegant herbal finish. Delightful as an aperitif or with food, it's a well-balanced, nuanced wine to enjoy now—2020.

A hint of salty yeast accents this wine's freshly cut russet pear aromas. The palate comes in with ripe, round pear flavors that swish beautifully around the salty yeast notes. Firm freshness keeps everything toned through the dry finish.

The nose on this bottling walks a fine line between ripe peach and more reserved elements of lemon and key lime. There is a strong stony and chalky kick to the palate, where tangy lemon-rind flavors meet with yellow apples.

Rather than the typical orange-blossom aromas, this bottling is more Sauvignon Blanc-like, with cut grass, lime peels, rainy cement and botanical elements on the nose. The palate is very acidic and stony in texture, with candied kiwi and passion fruit flavors.

Made with 40% Pinot Bianco, 35% Friulano, 15% Sauvignon and 10% Ribolla Gialla, this has aromas of yellow stone fruit, white flower, wild herb and a whiff of crushed tomato vine. The ripe tangy palate shows grapefruit, pineapple and a touch of ginger while a note of toasted hazelnut closes the finish.
Creamy and medium-bodied, this delivers ripe apple, white peach and citrus flavors. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors while a hint of toasted hazelnut lingers on the finish.

Creamy vanilla-bean aromas come with backside funk. A mellow palate is low on vroom, while spiced citrus flavors come with notes of burnt brown sugar. Elusive depth is a big part of a mildly toasty finish.
The aromas of dried orange peel and lime provide interest but seem a bit evolved. The concentration of the dry Nestea Iced Tea and lemon flavors seems extremely light.
Overextracted aromas of reduced kirsch and cassis make for a very ripe nose. The palate is almost sweet but also very tangy with ripe extracted fruit.

Bready aromas of pound cake are full but oxidized. This has a coarse, tight mouthfeel with very little richness, depth or leeway. Flavors of mustard and briny apple and citrus fruits finish firm and slightly bitter in flavor.
Sweet fig, olive and sugar apple are the flavors that first come to the fore of this full-bodied, ripe and robust wine, which is flat in structure with little acidity.
Extremely overextracted on the nose, this shows aromas of cassis, dried berries and grape seed. It's tangy and ripe on the palate, with more grape-seed flavors.

Heady but also very pure notes of ripest Mirabelle leap from the glass. On the palate, their fruit expression becomes even more intense, boosted by the sweetness that swishes across the tongue. A counterpoint of lemon freshness sets an accent of freshness but does not impede the ripeness, expression or flow of the fruit. This is intense, sweet and full-on. The finish is lasting and sweet.

This creamy wine offers excellent details of celery, apple, butter cream, vanilla cookie dough and a dash of cinnamon. It's all Dijon 76 clone, wild yeast fermented and aged in half new French oak barrels. It is one of a half-dozen chess- themed Chardonnays from this exciting new  winery.

Toasty and packed with rich fruits, this ripe wine is a blend of Rabigato and Encruzado. Coming from high-altitude vineyards in Douro Superior, it has a cool edge that brings refreshing acidity. Drink this creamy wine now.

This is a rich wine, but its great fruit is balanced with intense acidity that comes from the relatively cool, high-altitude vineyards. These two elements work well together, giving a sophisticated, rich wine that could benefit from another two years' aging. Drink from 2020.

From the wilds of Atlas Peak this is a 100% varietal wine, aged nearly two years in 100% French oak. Dusty and bright, with lingering waves of toasted coconut, it offers persistent freshness and tamed tannins around strong flavors of mocha and raspberry.

Red-apple notes have a vivid touch of lemon freshness on the nose. The very lively mousse is fine and creamy while the red-apple notes are joined on the palate by a more leafy, more tart notion of red hedgerow fruit. Think hawthorn and rose hip. This is very dry, but the very fine creaminess of the tiny bubbles and subtle notes of rye sourdough provide ample balance on this elegant wine.

Aromas of truffle, dark spice, chopped mint and whiffs of oak lead the nose. It's austere and rather lean, showing dried cherry, clove and a hint of rust alongside assertive, close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish. Give the tannins several more years to unwind then drink sooner rather the later to capture the remaining fruit. Drink 2021–2029.

While light bodied and crisp, this is a silk-textured Grauburgunder offering loads of juicy pineapple and tangerine flavors. It's a dry, easy-drinking sip but nuanced by hints of waxy apple and peanut shell. The finish is vibrantly fresh.
Very showy aromas of daffodils and white peach meet with sea salt and vanilla on the nose of this bottling. There is good grip to the sip, where flavors of lime, grapefruit and sliced orange arise.

Initially shy on the nose, aromas of lime blossom, gardenia and crushed stone slowly creep from the glass. There's a pleasant tension to the slightly rounded palate, with flavors of pineapple rind and melon melding on a tangy wet stone undercurrent.

Scorched earth, underbrush, grilled porcini, chopped herb and leather aromas take center stage. The earthy full-bodied palate evokes dried black cherry, prune, star anise and a hint of roasted coffee bean alongside drying, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink sooner rather than later.

Truffle, crushed mint and red berry aromas mingle with a whiff of wild rose. The aromas carry through to the light-bodied, racy palate along with white pepper and a citrus note. A hint of oyster shell gives it a tangy finish.

This lovely and seductive wine from a top producer delivers a supple, smooth and silky mix of orange peel, strawberry compote and chocolate bonbon flavors. At its relatively modest price, you can't hope for a better value for iconic Dundee Hills Pinot Noir.

An almost exotic hint of mango swings along the pear fruit on the nose. The palate comes in with honeyed sweetness, again with tropical overtones. Bright lemon makes the honeyed notes shine even more. This fully sweet wine with lovely balance will be perfect for fruity desserts or salty cheeses. The finish is long and intense.

Fleshy peach notes on the nose have the merest whiff of passion fruit and mango, promising ample fruit. The palate obliges with intense juiciness boosted by residual sugar that gives a rich texture. Citrus brightness counterbalances all this peachy richness that lasts on the long, sweet finish.
A rather shy nose leads to a slender palate where lemon zest, chervil and a riper notion of red apple combine to make a very honest, dry and refreshing wine. A clean, earthy freshness lingers long.

Honeysuckle, wet earth and peach pop up amid intense notes of damask rose. The palate is equally perfumed, covered by a veil of rose perfume that makes this wine seem richer than it actually is. Backbone and concentration comes from zesty citrus and a mere lick of residual sugar. All elements come together in an attractive package.

Soft aromas of lemon and tangerine on the nose become more intense on the refreshing, fruity palate. This wine strikes a happy balance between ripe juiciness and zesty refreshment. The body is light and the finish is appetizing, dry and lasting.
Dramatic with oakiness, this full-bodied and tannic wine smells smoky and tastes heavy with black-pepper, maple and toasted-bread flavors that dominate the fruit flavors.
This herbal wine is light, crisp and fruity. A caramel edge makes it less attractive, but the red-currant fruits are bright enough to make it refreshing. Drink now.

This flat, chunky white offers mealy apple and grape skin aromas and briny flavors of salty citrus. It winds down into a heavy finish marked by citrusy acidity and a grape skin-like grip. Errazuriz usually performs better with its Chardonnays, but 2017 was a hot and stunted vintage with early picking.

This bottling smells a bit more like Chardonnay than Sauvignon Blanc, with lemon rinds and a hint of butter, but a lime and dried apple touch that is varietally familiar. Poached apples show on the palate.
Rooty red cherry and plum tones partner with a green leaf accent on the nose of this red wine. It's medium in weight, with slightly astringent, green tannins that lend a bitter twang to the close.
This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Macabeo offers yeasty nectarine and vanilla cookie aromas. It has high acidity but low overall quality., with lightly oxidized, salty citrus flavors.

Cabernet Sauvignon (70%) takes the lead here, with the balance in Syrah. The aromas fascinate, evoking gun smoke, spice, Bing cherry, black currant, dried herb and fresh flowers, with the oak influence dialed way back. The flavors show dazzling purity and richness, along with a grip of tannins and a meaty, smoke-laced finish. It's a whole lot of wine in a nearly oak-free style rarely seen from the state at this price point.

This is one of a range of limited-production wines showcasing grapes that have almost disappeared. The Ondenc is found in tiny quantities in the Gaillac region where, as here, it produces a lightly aromatic wine with a touch of cream and honey. The wine is deliciously lightly oxidized, giving extra dimension and complexity. Drink now.

Though light on the nose, there is a distinctive toasted hazelnut aromas on this bottling along with nectarine cream, brioche and citrus rind. The palate is a fuller expression yet without becoming tropical, offering toast with marmalade flavors, a lively acidity and a grippy texture.

Vibrant black cherry, black raspberry, licorice and barrel spice aromas lead to pitch-black fruit flavors in this wine. Despite the warmth of the fruit profile, it has lovely balance. Best before 2022.

Raspberry, earth and leather aromas lead to rich, deep and savory flavors in this full-bodied, firmly tannic and nicely funky wine. It goes beyond the simple fruit and acidity of many Barberas and adds a lot of complexity.

This is one of six wines from this village made by this producer. It shows its potential for excellent white wines with its ripe, smoky character, rich yellow fruits and crisp texture. With its minerality and acidity, it will age, so drink from 2020.
Light pink in the glass, this Bulgarian Rosé is made from Cabernet Franc and Merlot. It has aromas of raspberries and red plums with flavors of strawberry and red raspberries.
An earthy, buttery aroma leads to warm peach and spice flavors. This wine has a nicely rich texture and is light on fruitiness and acidity.

Vinous aromas of strawberry, Marasca cherry and blueberry follow over to the vibrant, light-bodied palate along with hints of baking spice. It's easy drinking, with medium-sized, lively bubbles and bright acidity.

Strong lemon-peel, Pink Lady apple and orange-blossom aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts slightly sweet and grows much sweeter toward the finish, with ripe pear and apple flavors, but not much acidity.
A broadly defined, simply structured white, this has expansive richness on the palate and measured acidity on offer. Green apple, lime and lemon custard provide varietal character.

This wine has delightful aromas of Acacia flower, citrus blossom and lemon rind. In the mouth, there are crisp flavors of lemon zest, white peach and green apple. It is very well balanced with a sturdy mineral backbone and a savory finish.

Black-plum sauce, Chinese five-spice and a hint of black olive linger behind the prominent pine-oil and wood-spice aromas on the nose of this bottling from the acclaimed producer. The palate is also very woody and savory, with oak and pine forest flavors slipping into baked blackberry and dark plum.
This opens with aromas evoking ripe black plum, underbrush and exotic spice. The structured, full-bodied palate offers dried sour cherry, tobacco and baking spice alongside fine-grained tannins.

Made mostly from Oak Knoll District fruit, this perennial favorite offers rich tones of mocha, blackberry and cinnamon toast that are balanced by underlying acidity. It's a crowd-pleasing style that strikes a harmonious chord between fruit and structure.

Packed in a festive gold-wrapped bottle in honor of the firm's 40th anniversary, this 100% Chardonnay opens with delicate scents of white stone fruit, bread crust and a hint of toast. The elegant palate offers yellow apple, pear, citrus zest and hazelnut alongside fresh acidity and a refined perlage.
Aromas of baked plum, mocha and crushed blue flower take shape in the glass. The smooth, full-bodied palate delivers black cherry jam, licorice and tobacco alongside polished tannins.

There's a chalky, carnation-like character upfront on the bouquet of this wine, countered by ripe yellow melon and peach tones that lend an interesting juxtaposition. The palate boasts a slightly rounded feel, with a soft creaminess thanks to the ripe melon and stone-fruit flavors. Just enough acidity manages to lend balance to the fruity weight and keeps the finish in check.

Typical aromas of grapefruit, passionfruit, lemon and snow peas are layered with some salty and herbal notes. There's a touch of residual sugar on the palate balancing a lot of crisp acidity in this clean example of a classic style.

There's a clean, refreshing tropical-fruit character to this zippy wine, showcased in waves of pineapple, peach and underripe mango that combine with notes of sweet grass, lime peel and green plum. Ample acidity keeps the palate fresh and zippy, while a pithy character lends astringent grip to the close. Drink now.

This starts shy, but after a good amount of swirling in glass it reveals a medley of ripe tropical and citrus fruits with white pepper and a green herbal tinge. There's a flintiness on the palate, wrapped in a smooth, chalky mouthfeel and a long, tangy finish.
This ticks all the Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc boxes with bold aromas of lemon, grapefruit, snow peas and grass on the nose. The zingy, citrusy palate is complete, with a long, lemony finish.

This offers delicate scents of white spring blossom, yellow stone fruit, hazelnut and citrus. The aromas follow over to the fresh elegant palate along with flinty mineral, tangerine slice and ripe yellow apple.

This wine has classic mint and cedar aromas, deep black-cherry flavors and a full yet soft mouthfeel. The flavors follow suit and are accented by a milk-chocolate tone. It's a tasty, approachble wine that's easy to like even if buck hunting is not the occasion.
designation: Buck Shack Small Batch Sustainably Farmed

description: Dried cherry, fig and intriguing star anise spice show on the nose of this wine, which is starting to show its age a bit via complex secondary elements. Dried mulberry, crushed peppercorn and balsamic fig flavors show on the sip.

The touch of reduction on the nose of this wine quickly blows off to reveal dark plum and black cherry scents. Their lovely, measured juiciness becomes evident on the supple and easy palate. The pepperiness of Blaufränkisch is in full force on the juicy finish.

This sparkling blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier displays integrated tart cherry, raspberry, fig and lemon shortbread aromas. The palate is broad but soft, with delicate bubbles that carry ripe red fruit flavors into the lingering, saline finish.

The lovely floral overtones of honeysuckle, elderflower and green apple on the nose of this wine attain a slightly riper aspect on the palate. Yellow apple notes appear alongside the alluring floral aromas, making it a most expressive, dry summer wine. Lovely.
This wine struggles for definition, showing a dryness of tannin around harsh, astringent green notes and overwhelming ripeness.
Aromas of canned corn are followed by quite light and linear-seeming fruit flavors. It comes off as very light.
Stewy aromas of raisin and prune include a warm note of leather. This Garnacha feels tannic and jammy. Flavors of raisin, blackberry and loud oak finish soft and jammy, with little to no structure.
A muddled aroma of lemon and gardenia carries to the light-bodied palate. This is simple and straightforward in its appeal.
Pale in color, this light wine is fruity with just a hint of tannin. It has a fresh feel, with raspberry flavors predominating. Drink now.

Aromas of brick dust and roasted plum amount to a rustic whole. On the palate, this is screechy like grape skins. Black-fruit and cherry flavors are herbal and saucy, while this Cabernet is spicy on a hard, minimal finish.

Lemon and tangerine peel seem to have a creamy softening edge. The palate then presents lemon, ripe apple and juicy Mirabelle in a ripe, but always fresh, fruit encounter. This is dry, fruit-driven, generous, tangy and fun with a wonderfully long and refreshing finish. Drink until 2028.

Black-plum and mulberry notes are plump and easy on the palate of this velvety, plush red. Ripe and rich, it's elegantly balanced by crisp acidity and fine, firm tannins. Primary and fruity now, with delicate hints of nut and spice, it should develop earth and spice tones through 2025.

A notion of rather earthy ripeness suggests peach and juicy yellow pear. With air, the notes of stone fruit, Mirabelle plum and peach become ever stronger and become fully fledged on the sweet palate. The pure ripe fruit expression of very ripe Mirabelle plums is almost spooky in its accuracy. The finish is a little warm but hits home with the full force of its ripe aromatic fruit.

The nose is fragrant with the appetizing notions of ripe pear and juicy apple. Later, lemon hints appear. The body is fluid and equally juicy with added citrus freshness and a pleasant lemony zing on the dry finish. The lemon note lasts and makes you want to sip more.

Aromas of fresh green apple have a pleasant tinge of earth about them. The palate takes this green-apple freshness and wraps it completely in creamy, expressive notes of yeast, earth and cream. Wonderful freshness keep it light and slender. The finish has something totally clean, something clarion-like that makes you crave more.

A chalky, stony nose screams of the alluvial rocks that inundate the vineyard from which this comes. Of course, there's also a lot of berry fruit in the picture. Ripe but energetic on the palate, this tastes of black fruit, coffee and pepper. A firm, classy finish is full and juicy. Drink through 2025.

Loads of sun-kissed grapefruit, quince and lemon flavors collide on the palate of this fruit-forward sip. It's uncomplicated and juicy, yet balanced by zesty lime acidity and a hint of minerality. The finish is brisk and clean.

Pure, pristine flavors of white grapefruit, lemon and lime lend an exhilarating freshness to this off-dry Riesling. Subtle nuances of wax and pollen accentuate the midpalate, but overall, it's a thirst-quenching, easy-drinking wine.

Made entirely from the one variety, this is bright and floral in red-fruit and lavender notes, as well as the darker side of the grape: compost, turned earth and barnyard leather. It shows power and full-bodied ripeness while maintaining varietal integrity.

Named after Léonie Duchêne, who created this producer, this wine is crisp and drier than most from the house. With taut minerality as well as some weight, it is made mainly from red grapes. Drink this bottling now.

Earthy, savory aromas of leathery berry fruits come with an animal note. This warm-vintage Reserva is dense and feels like it's piling on top of itself. Roasted, spicy berry flavors are slightly leafy, while oak spice is lasting on a solid, chunky finish.
